translation.en: Formal education is measured through public spending to finance learning institutions and time students spend in formal schooling.
translation.luo: Sama sirkal kwano nengo mar somb ng'ato, gikwano pesa ma sirkal otiyogo e skunde ma ng'atno osomoe kod kinde ma ng'atno otiyogo  e somo.

translation.en: There is a positive relation between the number of years students spend in school and the economic growth of a country.
translation.luo: Kaka ji medo higni ma gisomogo e skul e kaka dongruok medore e piny.

translation.en: The informal education is considered from the competencies that a country’s workforce acquires from the workplace.
translation.luo: Lony ma ng'ato yudo kar tich e ma  sirkal kwano kaka puonjruok ma ngato yudo oko mar skul.

translation.en: According to World Bank, Kenya’s spending on education as a ratio of the GDP was 3.93 per cent in 1971, 7.3 per cent in 2005 and 5.3 per cent in 2018.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi World Bank, e higa mar 1971, Kenya notiyo gi ata malo 3.93 mar yutone duto e weche somo, e higa mar 2005 ne otiyo gi ata malo 7.3, to e higa mar 2018 ne otiyo gi ata malo 5.3.

translation.en: While this is higher than the sub-Saharan Africa average, the return on investments is lost with the higher levels of unemployment or underemployment.
translation.luo: Kata obedo ni pasent ni oloyo ma pinje moko e sub-Saharan Africa, dongruok osebedo matin Kenya nikech ji mang'eny onge tich kata gitiyo tije ma ok kelnegi yuto moromo.

translation.en: The economy is heavily dependent on imports and predominantly informal that it misses out on the informal education economic benefits.
translation.luo: Gik mang'eny mochuno wuok e pinje ma oko. Ng'eny ji puonjore gik moko oko mar skul, omiyo Kenya ok bed gi dongruok mabedoe ka ji mang'eny osomo.

translation.en: On health, in 2018 Kenya spent a paltry 5.17 per cent of her GDP compared to the world average of 9.85 per cent.
translation.luo: To kodok korka weche thieth, Kenya notiyo mana gi pasent 5.17  mar yutone duto e weche thieth e higa mar  2018 . Pinje mamoko to ne otiyo gi gimoro pasent 9.85 mar yutogi.

translation.en: This would imply that in addition to the national disease burden, Kenya’s workforce productivity would be significantly compromised due to health-related complications.
translation.luo: Mano nyiso ni e wi pesa ma Kenya lalo nikech tuwo, Jo Kenya matiyo ok bi tiyo kaka owinjore nikech midekre ma kae gi kacha.

translation.en: The genius of technological progress is the return on investments in education and health.
translation.luo: Ka oti gi pesa moromo e weche somo kod thieth, mano keloga dongruok madongo mag teknoloji.

translation.en: The knowledge acquired is meant to stir innovation and creativity among the population.
translation.luo: Somo ma ji yudo e skul onego ochiew pach ji kendo omi gi ti gi wuog gi gik manyien.

translation.en: Government spending in research and development is an important element in measuring a country’s ability to create and innovate.
translation.luo: Pesa ma sirkal moro amora tiyogo e timo nonro kendo e kelo dongruok nyiso maler okang' ma pinyno nyalo wuok gi  gik manyien ma giloso kendgi.

translation.en: Unfortunately, our public expenditure in research and development has remained below 0.8 per cent compared to an average of about four per cent by South Korea, one of the world’s highest investor in this variable.
translation.luo: Gima lit en ni kuom pesa duto ma sirkandwa tiyogo, pasent matin ne  0.8 ema dhi e weche nonro kod dongruok. South Korea ma ong'ere gi dongruok mang'eny to tiyo gi pasent 4.

translation.en: Technology transforms resources into improved final products.
translation.luo: Teknoloji miyo piny moro medo bero gik mayudore e pinygi.

translation.en: While there is no doubt that Kenya is well endowed with very many creative minds, our political institutions and national leadership have failed miserably to harness, coordinate, protect and commercialise these innovations.
translation.luo: En adier ni Kenya nigi joma ng'eny ahinya mariek kendo mowuok gi gik manyien ma giloso kendgi. Gima lit en ni josiasa kod jotelo ok osekonyo kata matin e miyo gik ma olosgo oti Kenya, kata konyo jogo mondo gitudre gi joma nyalo konyogi, kata rito ratiro mag jogo mondo kik kwal riekogi, kata neno ni gik ma gilosogo okelonegi ohala.

translation.en: It is the obligation of the government to establish an enabling environment to allow the most talented to thrive.
translation.luo: En ting' mar sirkal miyo joma nigi talanta makende thuolo mar tiyo gi talantagi chuth mondo gikel ber ne oganda.

translation.en: Unfortunately, our political leadership promotes cronyism, mediocrity and a toxic business environment through punitive tax regimes and poorly thought out macroeconomic policies.
translation.luo: Lit ahinya ni jotelo mag siasa miyo ji chulo osuru mamalo  ahinya kendo ok gipar matut seche ma giloso chike matayo dongruok makwako Kenya duto. Nikech mano, tije yudore kuom ng'eruok, onge dongruok malong'o matimore, kendo ohelni mang'eny podho.

translation.en: In any case, it is economic hogwash to talk of huge infrastructural investments if they are not designed and built by our own engineers and designers, and majority of the supplies are not sourced from within the economy.
translation.luo: Adiera en ni,  onge dongruok mikwano sama sirkal tiyo gi pesa turi e gedo, to injinia ma Kenya ok ema ogoro plan mag gik migerogo kendo ok gin ema gigerogi. Dongruok en ma kayiem nono  ka ng'eny gik migedogo wuok e pinje ma oko.

translation.en: On natural resources, we have not been endowed with non-renewal resources.
translation.luo: Kodok korka mwandu masieko kendgi e alwora, ok ogwedh Kenya ahinya gi mwandu mikunyo to rumo, kuom ranyisi, kite mikunyo ma nengogi tek.

translation.en: But we have plenty of renewable resources.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ogwedhwa ahinya gi mwandu masieko kendgi kendo ok rum.

translation.en: The world has significantly shifted into Green Growth and Circular Economic models.
translation.luo: Pinje mang'eny dwaro dongruok ma ok keth alwora kata Green Growth. Bende, gidwaro kit dongruok makelo ohala, makonyo e ngima mar oganda kendo maloso alwora kata  Circular Economic models.

translation.en: This calls upon our policy makers to make a deliberate effort to integrate green energies into our building technologies.
translation.luo: Mano dwaro ni joma loso chike mag gedo otim kinda mondo gine ni teknoloji mag gedo manyasani tiyo gi gik moko kaka chieng', yamo kata pi e loso stima.

translation.en: It demands that green energy should be our primary source at both industrial and household levels.
translation.luo: Mano dwaro ni ng'eny stima ma watiyogo, obed e kembe kata e utewa, onego obed molos gi chieng', yamo kata pi.

translation.en: Our waste management system must be turned into frontier industries of the 21st century.
translation.luo: Chenro mantie mar wito kata loko taka mondo obed gik manyalo konyo e yore moko onego otimie dongruok mondo obed achiel kuom kembe mitimoe dongruok mang'eny e higni mag 2000.

translation.en: Relevant green technologies on waste management already exist.
translation.luo: Kata mana gie kindegi nitie teknoloji mar wito kata tiyo gi taka e yo ma ok keth alwora.

translation.en: On the final question of property rights and political stability we score probably three out of 10 at best.
translation.luo: To e wach ratiro ma ng'ato bedogo kuom mwandune kod kuwe e weche siasa, ka ng'eny, to inyalo mana mi Kenya adek e wi 10.

translation.en: It is an open secret that it is difficult to trust the authenticity of government documents on properties.
translation.luo: En gima ong'ere ni tek geno barupe kata seyi mag sirkal kodok korka mwandu.

translation.en: Citizens too have no shame copying and commercialising others’ innovations without rights.
translation.luo: Raia bende wigi ok kuod sama gikopo gik ma jowetegi oloso kata uso gigo maonge ratiro.

translation.en: An economy whose leaders cannot assure the sanctity of property rights nor guarantee protection of innovations of its citizens is doomed ab initio.
translation.luo: Ka jotelo mag sirkal ok nyal neno ni orit ratiro ma ji bedogo kuom mwandugi, kata ratiro ma gibedogo kuom gik ma giloso, mano dwoko piny chien kendo onge dongruok manyalo dhi nyime.

translation.en: No investor or creator will want to put all their energy and soul into such a system.
translation.luo: Onge ja ohala kata jal mawuok gi gik manyien ma diket chunye kod tekone e timo gimoro amora e piny ma kamano.

translation.en: With hindsight from models of effective economic structures, the late Michael Kijana Wamalwa had this in mind: That for the king to be great, then he must surround himself with fine and polished men and women in their own fields of expertise.
translation.luo: Kinde moro, kane Michael Kijana Wamalwa pod ngima, ne oparo achien e wi kuonde ma dongruok ne osedhi maber, mi nong'ado wach niya: Mondo Ruoth moro odhi maber, nyaka oyier adimba osiepe mobedogo machiegni. Nyaka gibed chwo gi mon modimbore, molony kendo mong'ith e tije ma gitimo.

translation.en: That model of leadership abhors sycophancy and mediocrity not only in the politics of the day, but also in the management of the economy.
translation.luo: Joloch ma kamago ok dwar joma lierore kuomgi ka gidwaro mwandu kata joma  tiyo mana  kidam kidam. Ok gidwar joma kamago ok mana e siasa, to bende ok gidwargi e weche motudre gi dongruok.

translation.en: To reboot the economy, we must not focus on sectors at expense of others
translation.luo: Mondo wachier dongruok mar piny onego waket pachwa kuom ji, to ok mana kidienje mag ohelni.

translation.en: Unfair tax regimes are costing the world’s largest economies up to Sh3.2 trillion ($32 billion) from the global big tech firms, Action Aid has said.
translation.luo: Riwruok mar Action Aid wacho ni nikech opwodh chenro mag osuru moko ma ok owinjore, kembe madongo dongo maloso gik matiyo gi  teknoloji osemiyo moko kuom pinje momewie moloyo olalo gimoro siling trilion 3.2 kata dola bilion 32.

translation.en: The money is enough to have every person in the world given two doses of Covid-19 vaccine, said the organisation, which focuses on the eradication of poverty.
translation.luo: Riwruogno mochiwore ne tieko dhier, wacho ni pesano oromo ji duto e piny ngima yudo chanjo ariyo mag Korona.

translation.en: Action Aid said in a statement that tech firms such as Alphabet, Facebook, Apple, Microsoft and Amazon should be made to remit tax according to the profit they make in each country they operate.
translation.luo: Action Aid ne owacho ni onego orid chik ne kembe ma kamago mondo gichul pinje duto ma gitiyoe osuru maluwore gi ohala ma giloso e pinjego. Kembego oriwo kembe kaka Alphabet, Facebook, Apple, Microsoft kod Amazon.

translation.en: “Tech giants Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Microsoft and Alphabet have extensive market activity across the world and have racked up billions in profits during the pandemic,” the statement said.
translation.luo: Riwruogno ne omedo niya; “Kembe madongo dongo kaka Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Microsoft kod Alphabet ma uso gigegi alanda e piny mangima, oyudo ohala mar siling bilionde e kinde masira mar Koronani."

translation.en: “If global corporate tax systems were fair, governments could increase their tax revenue and fund better health systems to end the pandemic and start the recovery.”
translation.luo: “Dabed ni chik mokwako piny ngima kendo matayo kaka ohelni madongo chulo osuru en makare, dikoro sirkande yudo pesa momedore mag osuru. Mano dine okonyogi siro chenro mag thieth kendo tieko Korona. Bende, dine okonyogi chako gero ohelni ma yande ok dhi maber.”

translation.en: Action Aid said if this is done, in just one year Sh3.2 billion would be collected from the five tech firms alone.
translation.luo: Action Aid wacho ni kotim kamano, e higa achiel kende inyalo chok bilion 3.2 kowuok kuom kembe abichgo.

translation.en: “$32 billion would cover vaccine doses only, not the full costs of the vaccine rollout. This figure merely offers a sense of the scale of resources involved in taxing big tech companies,” it said.
translation.luo: Riwruogno wacho niya: “Bilion 32 oromo mana loso chanjo madwarore e piny, to ok oromo chulo gik moko duto madwarore mondo chanjono ochop ne ji.  Kwanno nyiso mana pesa ma nyalo yudore ka okaw osuru mowinjore kuom kembe madongo maloso gik matiyo gi teknoloji.

translation.en: Some of these tech giants have, through corporate social responsibility, contributed to the fight against Covid-19, led by Microsoft founder Bill Gates through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.
translation.luo: Kokalo kuom chenro moro moket ma kembni konyo oganda, moko kuom kembego osekonyo e wach tieko Korona. Otelnegi gi Bill Gates, jal ma ne ochako kambi mar Microsoft kendo gitiyo gi riwruokne miluongo ni  Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

translation.en: In the recent surge of cases in India, Microsoft through Oxfam India and Unicef crowd-funded Sh300 million to support the country’s response.
translation.luo: Nyocha ma Korona omedore India, Microsoft ne ochoko pesa kuom oganda kotiyo gi Oxfam India kod Unicef mi gichiwo milion 300 mondo okony pinyno nyagore gi tuwono.

translation.en: “Tax revenue from tech giants with economic presence in the global south is even more crucial for much-needed investment in public services, such as healthcare and education, which have been decimated by the pandemic,” said Action
translation.luo: Action Aid wacho niya: “Osuru mawuok e kembe madongogo mauso gigegi e pinje mag South America kod Latin America dwarore moloyo mondo okonygo oganda  e yore kaka mag thieth kod somo mosedok chien ahinya nikech masirani mo kwako piny.”

translation.en: Absa Bank Kenya has reported a 24 per cent increase in profit after tax to Sh2.4 billion for the first quarter ending March 31, 2021, compared to a similar period last year.
translation.luo: Bengi mar Absa Bank Kenya ogolo ripot ni bang' golo osuru, ohala ma giloso higani e kind dwe mokwongo kod dwe mar adek, kendo morumo Mach 31, 2021, ochopo bilion 2.4. Mano en medruok mar pasent 24 kopim gi dweche adekgo e higa mokalo.

translation.en: The performance was mainly driven by growth in interest income, particularly in the small and medium enterprises segment as the bank continued to support businesses to recover from the impact of Covid-19.
translation.luo: Ng'enyne medruokno owuok e  pesa michulo e wiye sama ng'ato okawo lon. Ahinya ahinya, ohelni matindo kod modundo ema okelone bengi ohalano sama bengi ne konyogi chungo ohelnigi ma ne ok dhi maber nikech masira mar Korona.

translation.en: All the lender’s business units remained profitable and resilient, registering growth on key lines with all businesses registering growth year-on-year, Absa Bank Kenya Managing Director Jeremy Awori (pictured) said in a statement yesterday.
translation.luo: Jeremy Awori (monyis pichane kae) ma en Jatelo mar Absa Bank Kenya  Wacho ni ohelni duto mag bengi ne okelo ohala kendo ochung' motegno. Dongruok nitie e kidienje duto madongo mag bengi kendo ohala omedore kopim gi ohala ma higa mokalo.

translation.en: “In confronting the challenges posed by the Covid-19 pandemic, we have been greatly inspired by the ingenuity and undying determination espoused by our fellow Kenyans to rise above the storm and keep going,” he said.
translation.luo: Omedo wacho niya: “Jo Kenya osejiwowa ahinya e nyagruok gi pek ma masira mar Korona okelo. Gisenyiso chuny motegno kendo gisemanyo yore mag nyagore gi chal matekni, mano osemiyowa mijing'o mar dhi nyime ma ok chunywa tho kata obedo ni weche tek.”

translation.en: Total income grew by two per cent to Sh8.8 billion, mainly driven by the growth of interest income, which was up six per cent year-on-year on the back of increased lending.
translation.luo: Yuto duto mar bengi ne omedore gi pasent ariyo mochopo bilion 8.8. Ng'eny yutono owuok e pesa michulo e wi lon ma bende ne omedore gi pasent auchiel kopim gi higa mokalo. Mano ne obedoe nikech ne okaw lon momedore.

translation.en: Costs dropped by 0ne percent compared to a similar period of 2020.
translation.luo: Pesa ma bengi ne otiyogo ne odok chien gi pasent achiel kopim gi dweche ma kamago e higa mar  2020.

translation.en: Net customer loans went up eight per cent to close at Sh218 billion as customer deposits also grew by a similar marginto Sh257 billion.
translation.luo: Pesa ma nokaw kaka lon ne omedore gi pasent aboro mochopo bilion  218. Bende, pesa ma ne ji okano e bengi bende ne omedore gi pasent aboro mochopo bilion 257.

translation.en: The Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) is expected to collect Sh279 billion in two months to meet its target for the financial year.
translation.luo: Riwruok mar  Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) onego ochok bilion 279 e dweche ariyo mondo ochop kwan ma ne oketo ni obiro chopo dweche apar mokalo.

translation.en: This translates to an average monthly collection of Sh139 billion in the months of May and June, a huge task for a taxman that managed to net a monthly average of Sh119 billion between July 2020 and April this year.
translation.luo: Mondo ochop kwan-no onego ochok bilion 139 e dwe mar Mei kendo e dwe mar Jun. Mano kaka weche tek ne josol osuru mosebedo ka choko gimoro bilion 119 e dwe chakre Julai 2020 nyaka April  higani!

translation.en: Data from the National Treasury shows that KRA collected Sh1.19 trillion by end of April against a target of Sh1.47 trillion for the 12-month fiscal period to June.
translation.luo: Kwan mar migawo mar National Treasury nyiso ni KRA ne ochoko trilion 1.19 chop giko April, to idwaro ni chop Jun higani, oyud ka gisechoko trilion 1.47 .

translation.en: This leaves it with a difference of Sh279.1 billion, which is to be filled in the remaining two months, a failure to which the government will have to borrow more or cut spending.
translation.luo: Mano nyiso ni bilion 279.1 pod ni oko. Kendo onego ochok pesano e dweche ariyo modong'. Ka ok gichoko pesago biro chuno sirkal holo pesa kata dwoko chien pesa ma gitiyogo.

translation.en: According to a Sh256 billion, three-year programme that the government has with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Kenya is expected to cut spending rather than increase borrowing in case tax collection underperforms.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi chenro moro makawo higni adek ma International Monetary Fund (IMF) ne oholoe Kenya bilion 256,  sirkal ma Kenya ne owinjore kodgi ni ka ok gichoko osuru kaka dwarore, sirkal mar Kenya onego odwok piny pesa ma gitiyogo to ok oholo pesa momedore.

translation.en: “During this period, in case of any tax shortfall that would compromise the achievement of the primary deficit…the authorities are committed to identifying expenditure offsets,” said the IMF in a report, noting that depending on the extent and nature of the shortfall, the country could also be forced to look at additional tax measures.
translation.luo: Ripot mar IMF ne owacho niya: “E higni adekgi, kapo ni ok ochok osuru kaka dwarore kendo mano omiyo sirkal ok nyal chulo gopgi, sirkal onego omany yore mag dwoko chien pesa ma gitiyogo." E wi mano, ne giwacho ni kapo ni osuru mochok tin ahinya, sirkal nyalo manyo yore mag medo osuru ma raia chulo.

translation.en: Tax revenue performance has been negatively affected by the Covid-19 pandemic, first recorded in the country in March last year.
translation.luo: Nyaka ne land e dwe mar Mach higa mokalo ni Korona en masira mokwako piny mangima, pesa michoko mag osuru osedok chien.

translation.en: A lot of businesses have shut down even as workers have lost their sources of livelihood, leading to less tax collection.
translation.luo: Ohendni mang'eny osepodho, kendo ji mang'eny oselalo tijegi to mano omiyo osuru michoko odok piny.

translation.en: In the 10 months to April 2021, total expenditure was Sh2.16 trillion against a budget of Sh2.94 trillion.
translation.luo: E dweche 10 nyaka chop April 2021, sirkal ne osetiyo gi trilion 2.16 to bajet en trilion 2.94.

translation.en: During the period, ministries spent Sh826 billion on recurrent expenditure including salaries and other administrative costs against projected spending of Sh1.08 trillion.
translation.luo: E kindeno, migawo mopogore opogore mag sirkal ne otiyo gi  bilion 826 e chudo manwoyore kaka chulo osara kod  chulo ne tije mamoko madwarore, kata kamano,  bajet to ne oketo trilion 1.08.

translation.en: Consolidated Fund Services (CFS), which includes first-charge expenditures such as payment of interest on debts, pensions and salaries to constitutional officer holders, took up Sh841.1 billion against a target of Sh1.07 trillion.
translation.luo: Agulu mar sirkal miluongo ni Consolidated Fund Services (CFS), mikanoe pesa michulo e wi gowi, pesa michulo  joma oritaya, kod osach jotich ma  sirkal opwodho ne okawo bilion 841.1, to bajet ne en trilion 1.07.

translation.en: A big chunk of the money was spent on the payment of debt. For every Sh100 that the government collected in taxes in the 10 months of the financial year, Sh64 went to paying the debt.
translation.luo: Ng'eny pesano ne otigo e chulo gowi. Kuom moro ka moro kuom siling 100 ma sirkal ne ochoko kaka osuru, ne otigi siling 64 e chulo gowi.

translation.en: Development spending took up Sh258.2 billion, or just 64 per cent of a budget of Sh401.4 billion. Seven State agencies had not received a single shilling from the Exchequer by end of April.
translation.luo: Pesa ma ne otigo e weche dongruok ne en bilion 258.2  ma ne en mana pasent  64 mar bajet mar bilion 401.4. Kata kamano, riwruoge abiriyo mag sirkal ne pok omi kata mana siling achiel gi sirkal chop giko April.

translation.en: Counties, which have also complained about a delay in disbursement of funds, had received Sh239.8 billion against a total allocation of Sh383.6 billion inclusive of conditional grants.
translation.luo: Kaunti ma ne oywak ni sirkal ne odeko gi pesgi noyudo osemi  bilion 239.8 to bajet ne en 383.6 moriwo pesa ma sirkal oketo ne chik kuom kaka itiyogo.

translation.en: Other than revenue from taxes and ministerial fees, the National Treasury receipts also included external and domestic loans.
translation.luo: Mopogore gi pes osuru kod pesa michulo jotend sirkal, riside mag aguch sirkal kata National Treasury ne oriwo lon mokaw kuom pinje ma oko kod lon mokaw Kenya.

translation.en: President Uhuru Kenyatta when he officially opened the 114km Garsen-Witu-Lamu road on his way to Lamu County to preside over the operationalization of the first berth of the new Lamu Port.
translation.luo: Kane Ker Uhuru Kenyatta dhi e Kaunti ma Lamu mondo oyaw kidieny mokwongo mar kama meli gowoe, ne oyawo ndara mar Garsen-Witu-Lamu, ma en kilomita 114.

translation.en: The government has proposed to allocate Trade and Industrialisation ministry Sh6.8 billion in the 2021/2022 financial year, inline with the Big Four Agenda.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi chenro mar sirkal mar Big Four Agenda, chenro madwaro neno ni Jo Kenya nigi chiemo moromo, odak e ute mowinjore, obedo gi dongruok e kembe maloso gik moko kendo oyudo thieth mowinjore, sirkal ochano mar walo bilion 6.8  ne migawo mar Trade and Industrialisation e kind Julai 2021 kod Jun 2022.

translation.en: The Big Four Agenda is part of President Uhuru Kenyatta legacy projects.
translation.luo: Big Four Agenda en achiel kuom chenro mag kelo dongruok e  loch mar Ker  Uhuru Kenyatta.

translation.en: According a report by the National Assembly committee on trade and industrialisation, this figure is proposed by the National Treasury Cabinet Secretary Ukur Yatani in the next budget, to be unveiled early next month.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi ripot mar komiti mar Od Bura mar Piny e wi ohala kod dongruok e loso gik moko, Ukur Yatani, ma en Jatend sirkal e migawo mar Agulu mar Piny kata National Treasury, ema ne owacho ni pesano ema dwarore ne bajet maluwo, kendo  ibiro wuoye dwe mabiro.

translation.en: Of this amount, Sh2.2 billion is for recurrent expenditure and Sh3.7 billion is for development expenditure.
translation.luo: Kuom pesani duto, bilion 2.2 ibiro tigo e chudo manwore to bilion 3.7 ibiro tigo e weche dongruok.

translation.en: An analysis by the committee states that the key outputs for the coming financial year and medium term period will be promotion of industrial development and investments, standards and business incubation, development of Athi River textile hub and Special Economic Zones (SEZs).
translation.luo: Komitino wacho ni kuonde mibiro tiyoe gi pesa moloyo e higa mabiro kendo e kidieny mar dongruok ma wantiereni en tego dongruok mag kembe maloso gik moko, tego chenro mag konyo jo ohala manyien, keto chike matayo ohelni, kendo gero Athi River textile hub kod Special Economic Zones (SEZs).

translation.en: The department is also expected to modernise the foundry plant at Numerical Machining Complex (NMC), a one-stop-shop centre for investment facilitation, modernisation of Rivatex machinery and cotton extension subsidy and provision of credit to MSMEs.
translation.luo: Migawono bende onego okel dongruok manyasani e kambi mar loso chuma man Numerical Machining Complex (NMC), ma en kama itimoe gik mang'eny dichiel; ikonyo ng'ato chako ohala, itimoe lokruok manyasani kuom masinde mag Rivatex, iskonyogi ng'iewo pamba kendo ikonyogi gi chenro mar yudo pesa mar chako ohala, bed ni gin ohelni matindo tindo kata madiere(MSMEs).

translation.en: Others will be construction and equipping of industrial research laboratories in Nairobi and upgrading and completion of stalled infrastructural projects at KITI.
translation.luo: Dongruok mamoko biro riwo gero kendo keto gik madwarore e laboratori man Nairobi mag timo nonro mar loso gik moko e kembe, Keto lokruok manyasani, kendo tieko gedo moko mosechung' kuom kinde e kolej mar Kenya Industrial Training Institute (KITI).

translation.en: The committee chaired by Adan Haji also oversees the state department of cooperatives, state department for trade and enterprise development, state department for cooperatives and the National Treasury.
translation.luo: Komitino ma jakom mare en Adan Haji bende ochung' ne migawo mar sirkal mochung' ne  cooperatives (riwruoge ma kano pesa ne jotich mag kambi kata riwruok moro), migawo mar sirkal mochung' ne ohelni kod dongruok e yore ohala, kod migawo mar sirkal mochung'ne  cooperatives kod  National Treasury kata Agulu mar Piny.

translation.en: In the next financial year and over the medium term, the state department for cooperatives will implement one programme - co-operative development and management.
translation.luo: E higa mar Julai 2021 nyaka Jun 2022, kendo e kidieny mar dongruok ma wantiereni, migawo mar sirkal mochung' ne cooperatives biro chako chenro moro achiel; chenro mar kelo dongruok e cooperatives kendo chung'negi e yo maber.

translation.en: Key targeted outputs include registration of SACCOs, rehabilitation of Coffee Cooperatives, restructuring the Kenya Farmers Association and a Co-operative share trading platform.
translation.luo: Gima gidwaro timo ahinya en ndiko piny nyinge SACCO duto, loso weche mosebedo ka obam e  Coffee Cooperatives. Kelo lokruok e Kenya Farmers Association kendo loso  Co-operative achiel mariwo ohelni duto mag Cooperative mopogore opogore.

translation.en: The single programme in the 2021/2022 Financial Year also includes increasing coffee production, value addition technologies adopted by co-operatives, modernisation of new KCC processing plant and completion of Co-operative Management Information System (CMIS).
translation.luo: E higa achielno, programno dwaro medo kahawa ma ipidhoga, gidwaro kelo teknoloji manyasani mondo omi tije mag cooperative omed tire maber, gidwaro kelo lokruok manyasani e kambi manyien mar KCC kendo gidwaro tieko loso chenro mar timo kwano mar cooperative e intanet kata Co-operative Management Information System (CMIS).

translation.en: The submitted budget estimates is proposing to allocate the cooperative department Sh1.6 billion of which Sh1.2 billion is for recurrent expenditure and Sh374.6 million is for development expenditure.
translation.luo: Bajet ma ne ochiwno dwaro ni omi migawo mar cooperative bilion 1.6, kae to ogol bilion 1.2 kuom mano mondo otigo e chudo ma nwoyore to milion 374.6 otigo e weche dongruok mar cooperative.

translation.en: In an analysis seen by Standard, the state department for trade and enterprise plans to implement one programme in the coming financial year under which it will enhance trade development and promotion.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi ripot moro ma Standard ne oneno, migawo mar ohala gi dongruok  nigi chenro mar chako program achiel e higa mar Julai 2020-Jun 2021 ma obiro tiyogo e kelo dongruok momedore e ohelni.

translation.en: The key targeted outputs include completion of negotiations for a bilateral free trade agreement between Kenya and the US as well as Kenya and UK.
translation.luo: Gima duong' ma gidwaro timo en tieko loso winjruok mar timo ohala e kind Kenya gi Amerka kod Kenya gi Britain. En winjruok mabiro dwoko chien chudo mang'eny mabedoe sama pinje timo ohala e kindgi.

translation.en: The department will also focus on seizure and destruction of counterfeit goods, promotion of domestic trade and entrepreneurship through construction and completion of CIDC and operationalisation of Kenya National Multi-Commodities Exchange Limited (KOMEX) trading platform.
translation.luo: Migawono bende dwaro neno ni  iketho gik ma counterfeit duto (mwandu ma ok owinjore modonjo gi mibadhi). Gibiro jiwo dongruok mar ohelni mag  Kenya kuom gero kendo neno ni otiek kuonde ma sirkal oyango ne jo ohala mondo okonygi yudo riekni mag dongruok ma gin Constituency Industrial Development Centres (CIDC) kendo gibiro yawo Kenya National Multi-Commodities Exchange Limited (KOMEX) mondo ochak tich.

translation.en: “The submitted estimates for the financial year 2021/22 is proposing to allocate state department for trade and enterprise Sh3.3 billion of which Sh2.1 billion is for recurrent expenditure and Sh1.2 billion is for development expenditure,” read an analysis from the committee.
translation.luo: Ripot moro mar komitino ne owacho niya: “Bajet mochiw mondo otigo e higa mar  Julai 2021/Jun 2022 dwaro ni omi migawo mar sirkal mar ohala kod dongruok bilion 3.3, kae to igolo  bilion 2.1 mondo otigo e chudo ma nwoyore, to bilion 1.3  otigo e weche mag dongruok.”

translation.en: The budget estimates have been prepared against a background of a recovering global economy from effects of the outbreak and rapid spread of the Covid-19 pandemic.
translation.luo: Bajetno olos ka oket e paro ni ohelni e piny ngima eka temo chung' bang dok chien nikech masira mar Korona  ma ne olandore mapiyo ahinya mokwako piny ngima kendo.

translation.en: There is still uncertainty on when Kenya and the entire world will contain the pandemic, however, there are expectations of a vaccine powered economic recovery with continued reopening of economies.
translation.luo: Ok ong'ere gadier ni en karang'o ma Kenya kod piny mangima biro loyo masirani. Kata kamano, nitie geno ni ka osemi ji chanjo, ohelni biro chako dok e wang'e nikech pinje biro medo yawore.

translation.en: In the FY 2021/22 revenue collection including Appropriation-in-Aid (AIA) is projected to increase to Sh2 trillion (16.4 per cent of GDP) up from the estimated Sh1.8 trillion (16.6 per cent of GDP) in the FY 2020/21.
translation.luo: E higa mar Julai 2021/Jun 2022  pesa mibiro chul sirkal moriwo ma migawo mag sirkal oyudo kata Appropriation-in-Aid (AIA) biro medore machop trilion 2 ( ma en pasent 16.4 mar yuto duto mag sirkal), kendo mano en medruok mar  (pasent  16.6 mar yuto duto mar sirkal ) kopim gi ma higa mar Julai 2020/Jun 2021 ma ne en gimoro trilion 1.8.

translation.en: CS Ukur Yatani at The National Treasury before proceeding to Parliament Building to present the 2020/2021 Budget Statement.
translation.luo: Jatend sirkal Ukur Yatani, ka en National Treasury, kapok odhi e Od Piny Owacho mondo ochiw bajet mar higa  2020/2021.

translation.en: resident Uhuru Kenyatta government has proposed to allocate the state department of industrialisation Sh6.8 billion in the 2021/2022 financial year, in line with his 'Big Four Agenda'.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi chenrone mar 'Big Four Agenda', Ker Uhuru Kenyatta dwaro miyo migawo mar sirkal mochung' ne dongruok mar kembe bilion 6.8 e higa mar Julai 2021/Jun 2022.

translation.en: According to a report by the National Assembly committee on Trade and Industrialisation, the figure proposed by the National Treasury Cabinet Secretary Ukur Yatani is to be unveiled in the next budget early next month before Parliament.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi ripot mar komiti mar Od Bura mar Piny e wi migawo mar Ohala kod Dongruok mar Kembe, pesa mokwa gi Ukur Yatani ma en Jatend tij Sirkal e Mgawo mar National Treasury  ibiro ter e nyim Piny Owacho e chak dwe manyien sama isomo bajet maluwo.

translation.en: Of the amount, Sh2.2 billion is for recurrent expenditure and Sh3.7 billion is for development expenditure.
translation.luo: Kuom pesano, bilion 2.2 en mar chudo ma nwoyore to bilion 3.7 en mar timo dongruok.

translation.en: The proposed allocation represents an increase of Sh 65.9 billion from the Budget Policy Statement (BPS) approved ceiling.
translation.luo: Pesa mikwayono ohingo pesa monego okwa  gi bilion 65.9 kaluwore gi chike matayo bajet kata Budget Policy Statement (BPS).

translation.en: An analysis by the committee states that the key outputs for the coming financial year and Medium Term period will be the promotion of Industrial development and investments, standards and business incubation, development of Athi river textile hub and development of Special Economic Zones (SEZs).
translation.luo: Komitino wacho ni kuonde mibiro tiyoe gi pesa moloyo e higa mabiro kendo e kidieny mar dongruok ma wantiereni en tego dongruok mag kembe maloso gik moko, tego chenro mag konyo jo ohala manyien, keto chike matayo ohelni, kendo gero Athi River textile hub kod Special Economic Zones (SEZs).

translation.en: The department is also expected to modernize the foundry plant at Numerical Machining Complex (NMC), a one-stop-shop centre for investment facilitation, modernization of Rivatex machinery and cotton extension subsidy and provision of credit to MSMEs.
translation.luo: Migawono bende onego okel dongruok manyasani e kambi mar loso chuma man Numerical Machining Complex (NMC), ma en kama itimoe gik mang'eny dichiel; ikonyo ng'ato chako ohala, itimoe lokruok manyasani kuom masinde mag Rivatex, iskonyogi ng'iewo pamba kendo ikonyogi gi chenro mar yudo pesa mar chako ohala, bed ni gin ohelni matindo tindo kata madiere(MSMEs).

translation.en: Other key output areas will be the construction and equipping of industrial research laboratories in Nairobi and upgrading and completion of stalled infrastructural projects at KITI.
translation.luo: Dongruok mamoko biro riwo gero kendo keto gik madwarore e laboratori man Nairobi mag timo nonro mar loso gik moko e kembe, Keto lokruok manyasani, kendo tieko gedo moko mosechung' kuom kinde e kolej mar Kenya Industrial Training Institute (KITI).

translation.en: In the next financial year and over the medium term, the state department for cooperatives will implement one programme- co-operative development and management.
translation.luo: E higa mar bajet ma biro, kendo e kidieny mar dongruok ma wantiereni, migawo mar sirkal mochung' ne cooperatives biro chako chenro moro achiel; chenro mar kelo dongruok e cooperatives kendo chung'negi e yo maber.

translation.en: Key targeted outputs include registration of SACCOs, rehabilitation of Coffee Cooperatives, Restructuring of the Kenya Farmers Association and a Co-operative share trading platform
translation.luo: Gima gidwaro timo ahinya en ndiko piny nyinge SACCO duto, loso weche mosebedo ka obam e  Coffee Cooperatives. Kelo lokruok e Kenya Farmers Association kendo loso  Co-operative achiel mariwo ohelni duto mag Cooperative mopogore opogore.

translation.en: The single programme in the 2021/2022 Financial Year also includes increasing coffee production, value addition technologies adopted by co-operatives, modernization of new KCC processing plant and completion of Co-operative Management Information System (CMIS).
translation.luo: E higa achielno, programno dwaro medo kahawa ma ipidhoga, gidwaro kelo teknoloji manyasani mondo omi tije mag cooperative omed tire maber, gidwaro kelo lokruok manyasani e kambi manyien mar KCC kendo gidwaro tieko loso chenro mar timo kwano mar cooperative e intanet kata Co-operative Management Information System (CMIS).

translation.en: Zadock Matara displays his fruits at Suneka market in Kisii County.
translation.luo: Zadock Matara usoga matunda e chiro ma Suneka e kaunti ma Kisii.

translation.en: The ACEA Buyer-Seller Platform aims to connect agribusiness players from the East Africa Community.
translation.luo: Riwruok miluongo ni Agribusiness Confederation of East Africa  (ACEA) matudo jo ohelni ma East Africa Community mondo giyudre gi jowetegi matimo ohala mar pur mondo gitim ohala kanyachiel.

translation.en: An online agribusiness market to help farmers in the East Africa Community sell agricultural produce has been unveiled.
translation.luo: Osechak chenro ma jopur manie East Africa Community nyalo uso gigegi e intanet.

translation.en: Agribusiness Confederation of East Africa (ACEA) has launched the online agribusiness market to help sellers in the region find markets for their green produce.
translation.luo: (ACEA) Ochako chenrono mondo gikony jo ohala e pinjego mondo giyud kama ginyalo usoe gik mawuok e puodho.

translation.en: Dubbed the ACEA Buyer-Seller Platform, it aims to connect agribusiness players in the agriculture value chains from the East Africa Community.
translation.luo: Iluonge ni ACEA Buyer-Seller Platform, gima duong' modwaro chopo en tudo joma uso kendo ng'iew gik mawuok e puodho e  East Africa Community.

translation.en: East African countries produce a lot of agricultural products but the challenge remains market for these products.
translation.luo: Pinjego puro chiemo mang'eny. Pek ma giyudo en ni ok giyud kuonde ma ginyalo usoe gik ma gipidhogo.

translation.en: Through the platform which is free to register, farmers are able to market their products to all potential clients, such as wholesalers, importers, exporters and supermarkets around the region that already use the platform and exchange contacts for further business transactions.
translation.luo: Chenroni idonjoe nono. E chenroni jopur nyalo tudore ja ohala moro amora ma dipo ka ong'iepo kuomgi, ginyalo bedo jo mauso ne jo ohala mamoko, joma kelo gik moko kowuok e pinje ma oko, joma uso gik moko ne pinje ma oko, ginyalo kata tudore gi jo supa maket e chenroni.

translation.en: ACEA is the regional apex body for private sector associations and federations in the agribusiness sector.
translation.luo: ACEA  en riwruok moyiedh e East Africa Community ma ochung'ne riwruoge ma ok mag sirkal motudore gi ohelni mag pur. Gichung' bende ne riwruoge mamoko mag pur moriwo pinje mopogore opogore.

translation.en: It is the main voice and representative of the private sector agribusiness stakeholders in the East African Business Council.
translation.luo: En e dwol mawuoyo e lo weg ohelni ma ok mag sirkal e  East African Business Council.

translation.en: Speaking from Rwanda in an event launched virtually in Nairobi, Robert Rukundu Chairperson of Agricultural Exporters Association of Rwanda said the country produces a lot of agricultural produce but lack information on markets.
translation.luo: E romo moro ma ne otim Nairobi, e yor intanet, Robert Rukundu ma en jakom mar Agricultural Exporters Association of Rwanda  ne owacho ni Rwanda puro chiemo mang'eny en mana ni ok ging'eyo kuonde ma ginyalo usoe gik ma gipidhogo.

translation.en: “The platform will offer us good opportunity to penetrate markets as we share information regarding which markets for which product,” he explained.
translation.luo: Ne owacho niya: “Chenroni biro miyowa thuolo maber mar yudo kuonde ma wanyalo usoe nikech wabiro konyore mondo wang'e kuonde ma gik mopogore opogore dwaroree.

translation.en: He said ACEA will not interfere or get involved in the logistics, business transactions between buyers and the sellers who connect through the platform.
translation.luo: Owacho ni ACEA ok bi donjore gi weche mag ohala e kind jo uso gi jo ng'iepo matiyo gi chenroni.

translation.en: Victoria Sekitoleko, from the Uganda business community, said though local farmers have produced plenty of agricultural produce, lack of market has forced them to sell through brokers who offer poor prices.
translation.luo: Victoria Sekitoleko, ma en achiel kuom jo ohala ma Uganda, wacho ni jopur ma Uganda puro chiemo mang'eny to nikech onge kama ginyalo usoe gikgigo, joma kawo gigo mondo odhi ous kuonde mamoko kawo gi neng'o mapiny ahinya.

translation.en: “Ugandans are happy with the formation of the platform. They will do even better when they have the system,” she said.
translation.luo: Ne owacho niya: “Jo Uganda mor gi chenroni. Ohendnigi biro dhi maber ka chenroni ochopo Uganda.”

translation.en: Dr Kevit Desai, Principal Secretary, State Department of East African Community, lauded the platform saying it is a remarkable step towards digitisation of intra-regional trade.
translation.luo: Dr Kevit Desai, ma en Jatelo Maduong' mar  State Department of East African Community, ne opwoyo chenroni ahinya ka owacho ni tudo ohelni mag alworani e kompyuta, en okang' maber ahinya.

translation.en: He challenged the stakeholders as they launch the portal, is important to reflect on the status of the agricultural sector and the underlying factors that have impeded regional trade such as low-level agricultural activities, extension systems, inadequate value addition and declining soil utility.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ne onyiso weg chenroni ni kata obedo ni gichako chenroni, dwarore ni giket e paro kaka weche pur ni chien e alworani. Ginon weche mosedwoko pur chien. Gigo oriwo;  pidho mana gik matin michamo gi joot,  bedo maonge tiegruok malong'o e weche pur, yudo mana ohala matin kuom gik ma gipuro, kod bedo gi low ma ok nyag chiemo.

translation.en: “We need to influence the formulation and implementation of policies and strategies for the improvement of agriculture value chains, and promote common interests of individual agriculture businesses in the East region,” he said.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni “Onego wachiw paro kendo wariwre e loso chike kod chenro makonyo e kelo dongruok e yore milosogo gik mowuok e puodho mondo gigo okel ohala momedore kendo wakel dongruok e ohand pur  e pinje duto mag  East Africa.”

translation.en: The PS added that to improve intra-regional trade, in the agricultural sector there is a need for data.
translation.luo: Ne omedo ni mondo ohala manie kind pinjego odhi maber, nyaka kan nonro moko sie.

translation.en: The stakeholders reiterated that the greatest struggle is revolutionising a traditional sector through new technologies.
translation.luo: Weg chenrono ne owacho ni en adier ni pek maduong'ie moloyo ma gin-go en tiyo gi teknoloji manyasani e ohala ma ji osetimo aching' a nyaka nene.

translation.en: Fortunately, the new generations of agriprenuers are helping this narrative, as they are open to innovative platforms and applications.
translation.luo: Gima ber en ni, tieng' ma sani mar joma donjo e ohala mar pur ong'eyo wach teknoloji kendo girwako chenro manyien-go.

translation.en: Dr Bimal Kantaria, Chairman, Agribusiness Confederation of East Africa and Agriculture Sector Network (ASNET) lauded the platform saying it will bridge the gap between the buyers and sellers.
translation.luo: Dr Bimal Kantaria ma en jakom mar Agribusiness Confederation of East Africa and Agriculture Sector Network (ASNET) pwoyo chenrono ka owacho ni obiro tudo jong'iepo gi jouso.

translation.en: “...coming together, trying to reduce duplication within the region and focus on agriculture and agribusiness might help increase banking investments in agriculture sector,” he said.
translation.luo: ne owacho ni “...ka uriworu, mi utemo mondo kik usikru e gimoro achiel uduto, kendo uketo pachu e pur kod ohand pur ubiro miyo bengi omed siro weche pur.

translation.en: Jacqueline Mukindi, from Tanzania, said they are happy to formalise agribusiness trade in the East African region.
translation.luo: Jacqueline Mukindi, mawuok Tanzania, wacho ni  sirkandgi oyie pwodho ohand pur mariwo pinje mag  East Africa.

translation.en: “The millions of Tanzanians engaged in farming are excited about the new platform as it will help in regional agriculture trade,” she said.
translation.luo: Owacho ni “Jo Tanzania tara gi tara ma gin jopur oil ahinya gi chenro manyien-ni nikech obiro konyo e ohala matimore e kind pinje mag East Africa.”

translation.en: Rajan Shah, from the Kenya Association of Manufacturers, said the platform will put farmers and buyers into direct contact with each other, removing the middleman.
translation.luo: Rajan Shah, ma ja Kenya Association of Manufacturers, ne owacho ni chenroni biro tudo jopur kod jong'iepo achiel kachiel ma onge ng'at machielo mabiro e kindgi.

translation.en: “The middleman has been filling the gaps of inefficiencies, but putting buyer and seller together is going to bring in more price transparency,” he said.
translation.luo: Ne omedo niya: “En adier ni joma tudo jong'iepo gi jouso osekonyo e yore moko, kata kamano, sama oket jong'iepo gi jouso mondo otudre achiel kachiel mano biro konyo ja ohala ng'eyo nengo sie mar gimoro."

translation.en: Rajan explained that when the buyer and seller are in direct contact there is better communication of the expectation of the product quality and the standardization.
translation.luo: Rajan ne owacho ni sama omi jang'iepo kod jauso thuolo mar tudore achiel kachiel, ginyalo winjore maber  e wi kit  gima ng'ato dwaro ng'iewo  kata kaka onego olos gimoro mondo ochop e okang' midwaree.

translation.en: He is optimistic the ACEA Buyer-Seller Platform will trigger players like banks and insurance companies to play effective roles in unlocking capital.
translation.luo: En gadier in chenro mar  ACEA Buyer-Seller Platform biro miyo bengi kod kod kembe mag insuarans ochiw pesa ne joma timo ohala mag pur.

translation.en: Peter Mathuke, Secretary-General, East African Community who was the Chief guest praised stakeholders behind the portal saying they are critical in influencing business policy at regional level.
translation.luo: Peter Mathuke ma en  Jatelo Maduong' mar  East African Community, kendo ma ne en wendo modhial e nyasino ne opwoyo weg chenrono kowacho ni gikonyo ahinya e fwenyo chike mowinjore oket mondo ota ohala e kind pinje mag East African Community.

translation.en: “Article 105, of the treaty clearly provides for a scope of cooperation and promotion of agriculture within East African Community. It calls for partner states and players to come up together and coordinate and come up with a clear framework on how to promote agriculture in East Africa. And this is what you are doing as ACEA,” he said.
translation.luo: Ne owacho niya: “Chik namba 105 e winjruok mar pinjegi, nyiso maler ni pinjegi nyalo riwore e weche pur kendo gikel dongruok e kindgi. Chikno dwaro ni pinje manie riwruogni kod joma tudre kodgi oriwre kendo gibed gi chenro mong'ith mar kelo dongruok e weche pur e pinje mag East Africa. To mano e gima utimo gi chenrou mar  ACEA.”

translation.en: Mathuke highlighted that an important pillar for a very successful seller-buyer platform is to ensure there is two-way communication between those participating communities.
translation.luo: Mathuke ne owacho ni gima duong' ma konyoga chenro kaka mar ACEA odhi maber ahinya en ka jouso gi jong'iepo nyalo wuoyo achiel kachiel.

translation.en: “The communication should be clear in terms of what is required and specifications. But also respect for those who are providing services from those producing and consuming,” he said.
translation.luo: “Onego uler adimba gima dwarore, bende Jong'iepo gi jouso bende nyaka mi weg chenrono luor.”

translation.en: He challenged ACEA stakeholders to consider applying for observer status within the East African Community that will give them a better platform to engage with all the policymakers.
translation.luo: Ne onyiso weg ACEA mondo gikwa  thuolo mar  riwore gi East African Community e gik ma gitimo mondo giyud thuolo mar tudruok gi joma loso chike matayo ohelni e pinje mag East Afrika.

translation.en: RBA Chief Executive Officer Dr Nzomo Mutuku: Kenya has a very good retirement benefits regulatory framework that provides a safe environment for saving for retirement
translation.luo: Dr Nzomo Mutuku ma en Jatelo mar Retirement Benefits Authority, RBA: Kenya nigi chenro maber kendo migeno makonyo ji kano pesa ma gibiro tiyogo ka giseritaya.

translation.en: The Retirement Benefits Authority (RBA) is celebrating 20 years at a time when Kenya’s Pension Industry growth is on an upward trajectory with pension assets hitting Kshs 1.4trn as of December 2020 up from less than sh100bn two decades ago.
translation.luo: Riwruok mar Retirement Benefits Authority (RBA) timo rapar mar tiyo kuom higni 20. Gitimo kamano sama ohala mar kano ne ji pes ritaya medo dhi maber. Desemba higa mokalo noyudo ka gin gi mwandu maromo trilion 1.4 . Mano dongruok maduong' nikech higni 20 mokalo ne gin gi pesa matin ne bilion 100 higni.

translation.en: The Authority’s target is to grow assets to Kshs 2.4trn and expand pension coverage to 30 per cent of the labour force by 2024 from the current 22 per cent and 10 percent in 2000.
translation.luo: Riwruokno dwaro ni chop higa mar 2024, gibed gi mwandu maromo trilion 2.4 kendo girwak pasent 30 mar jotich e chenrogi mar kano pes ritaya. Mano biro bedo medruok nikech gie sani gikeno ne pasent 22 mar jotich,  to e higa mar 2000 ne gikeno mana ne pasent 10 mar jotich.

translation.en: When the Covid-19 pandemic hit the country, pension schemes, just like other sectors of the economy, experienced challenges.
translation.luo: Kane masira mar Korona ogoyo Kenya, chenro mag kano pes ritaya bende ne oyudo pek mana kaka ohelni mamoko.

translation.en: Employers shut down operations, retrenched staff or sent them on unpaid leave.
translation.luo: Joma ondiko ji e tich noloro tije, kembe moko ne oriembo jotich, to jotich moko ne ochun gi rusa ma ok chulgie gimoro.

translation.en: Some employers, though still operating, were forced to temporarily suspend their contributions to pension schemes.
translation.luo: Kembe moko kata obedo ni pod ne tiyo, ne ok nyal chiwo pesa ritaya ma gijochiwo dwe ka dwe mondo okan ne jotich.

translation.en: Investments by pension schemes were affected due to the high volatility in the capital markets.
translation.luo: Mwandu mag riwruoge mag ritaya ne odok chien nikech ohelni madongo ne ochochni.

translation.en: Meetings such as scheme Annual General Meetings had to be postponed or shifted to online channels.
translation.luo: Ne ochunogi chwalo nyime kata timo e intanet chokruogegi kaka ma gitimoga higa ka higa,   Annual General Meetings.

translation.en: It is through the Authority’s implementation of strong risk management measures that ensured pension schemes sustained their operations and the impacts were minimised.
translation.luo: Riwruogni nigi chenro motegno mar siro jokeno kata ka weche riwruok ok dhi maber ahinya. Omiyo ne gidhi nyime chulo joma ne okeno kodgi, kendo tije riwruogno ne odhi nyime maonge chochni maduong'.

translation.en: We are now confident that as the pandemic eases the industry will bounce back stronger than before and allow the affected pension scheme members to continue growing their kitties.
translation.luo: Wan gadier ni kaka masira mar Koronani dhi ka rumo, riwruogwani biro  chung' motegno kendo obiro medo timo dongruok mi omi joma chenrogi mar keno ne ochochni thuolo mar dhi nyime keno kendo aguchgi omed pong'.

translation.en: One key lesson that we must never forget from the pandemic is the need to prepare for emergencies and retirement since no one knows when their income can be cut off.
translation.luo: Puonj maduong' ma wayudo e masira mar Koronani en ni dwarore ni waikre ne weche ma apoya kendo waikre ne ritaya nimar onge ng'at mong'eyo chieng' ma tije norum kata yutone nong'adre.

translation.en: When Covid-19 struck and some workers found themselves suddenly retrenched, those who had earlier been saving for retirement had a critical cushion that they could count on.
translation.luo: Ka ne masira mar Korona otuch, jotich moko ne olalo tijegi apoya, kata kamano, joma ne kanoga pes ritaya ne oyudo gima ne gisirorego e kinde matekno.

translation.en: Those who had not been saving were in a truly desperate situation.
translation.luo: Joma ne ok ken, ne ochandore ahinya.

translation.en: Whether formally employed or self-employed, anyone earning an income can join a pension scheme and start saving towards their retirement.
translation.luo: Bed ni ng'ato ondik tich kata otimo mana tijene owuon, onyalo donjo e chenro mar kano pes ritaya, tek mana ni nitie pesa ma oyudoga.

translation.en: The Authority has licensed over 35 individual pension plans to cater for the self-employed and workers whose employers have not established pension schemes.
translation.luo: RBA nigi chenro mokalo  35 mag keno manyalo konyo joma tiyo tijegi giwegi kod jotich ma joma ondikogi ok otimo chenro mar kanonegi pes ritaya.

translation.en: Specifically, the Authority is targeting to have more people in the informal sector join pension schemes.
translation.luo: Ahinya ahinya, riwruogno manyo joma tiyo tijegi giwegi mondo girwakgi e chenrogi mar keno.

translation.en: In our 2019-2024 strategic plan, we have outlined the strategies we will use to achieve this goal and the key entails the design of products suitable for the informal sector and leveraging on technology to make them accessible to all Kenyans.
translation.luo: E chenrowa mar 2019-2024, ne wandiko gik ma ne wachano timo mondo wayud medruok ma wadwaro. Gima dwarore moloyo en bedo gi chenro mag keno mowinjore gi joma ok ondik tich. Bende, dwarore ni oti kod teknoloji mondo tiyo gi chenrogo bedo mayot ne jo Kenya duto.

translation.en: Already individual pension schemes have rolled out products that allow seamless saving through mobile phones with flexible entry and exit for members to fit the lifestyle and taste of informal sector entrepreneurs and workers.
translation.luo: Gie sani, riwruoge mamoko ma kano ne ji pes ritaya oseketo chenro mag keno  e simu. Gin chenro mowinjore gi kit ngima kod dwaro mag joma tiyo tijegi giwegi. Ginyalo donjo e chenrogo mayot bende ginyalo wuokie mayot.

translation.en: Over the two decades of RBA’s existence, the number of pension industry service providers has increased.
translation.luo: E higni 20 ma RBA osebedo katiyo, kwan riwruoge ma kano ne ji pes ritaya osemedore.

translation.en: The industry now has 31 administrators, 24 fund managers, 11 custodians and more than 50 fully qualified actuaries.
translation.luo: Gie sani, RBA nigi jotelo 31 mochung' ne tije mopogore opogore, jotich 24 mochung' ne kaka pesa tiyo e riwruogno, jotich 11 mochung' ne rito pesa mokan, kod jotich 50 mochung' ne nonro mag kwano.

translation.en: Some of the remarkable changes the Authority has overseen across the 20 years include the introduction of individual pension schemes for the self-employed and those in the informal sector; umbrella pension schemes for employers; post-retirement medical fund to cater for medical needs after retirement; income drawdowns (before this retirees could only take lump-sum amounts or annuities) and use of pension funds in mortgages (initially, assigning 60 percent of pension funds to access mortgage and now use of 40 per cent of these funds to directly buy a house).
translation.luo: Moko kuom lokruoge mabeyo ma RBA osetimo e higni 20 mokalo gin kaka loso chenro mopogore opogore mag keno, kaka: chenro mar kano pes ritaya ne joma tiyo tijegi giwegi kata joma timo ohelni matindo tindo, chenro ma riwruoge kata kembe mopogore opogore nyalo riworee mondo gikan pes ritaya ne joma gindiko tich, chenro ma ng'ato kanoe pes thieth mobiro tiyogo bang' ritaya, chenro ma ng'ato nyalo goloe pesane mosekano kodgi kinde ka kinde kaka osara (Chon ng'ato ne nyalo mana kawo pesa mang'eny dichiel kata kawo pesaneno kinde ka kinde bang' ritaya), chenro mar tiyo gi pesa ma ng'ato osekano e ng'iewo ot michulone dwe ka dwe.( Chon ne onyalo tiyo gi pasent 60 mar kenone e chudo ne ot mosmos, to gie sani onyalo tiyo gi  pasent 40 mar kenone e ng'iewo ot achiel kachiel)

translation.en: Additionally, the guidelines issued by RBA have aided industry players to operate under clear rules.
translation.luo: E wi mano, chike ma RBA oseketo osemiyo tich obedo mayot ne riwruoge  ma kanone ji pes ritaya nikech gin gi  chike mawinjore maler kendo matayogi  achiel kachiel.

translation.en: These include good governance, treating customers fairly, scheme expenses, income draw-down and post-retirement medical fund guidelines.
translation.luo: Chikego mulo gik moko kaka tayo jotich e yo maber, timo ne kastembe kaka dwarore, chudo ne tije ma RBA timo, chike matayo kaka ng'ato golo pesane kinde ka kinde, kod chike matayo kaka ichulo pes thieth bang' ritaya.

translation.en: I want to assure the public that Kenya has a very good retirement benefits regulatory framework that provides a safe environment for saving for retirement.
translation.luo: Daher nyiso Jo Kenya ni kenya nigi chenro maber ahinya ma rito pesa ma ji kano ne ritaya.

translation.en: The checks and balances that ensure good governance in the industry support its growth.
translation.luo: Nitie okenge moket ma neno ni ikano pesago kaka owinjore, kendo nikech mano, riwruogni timo dongruok maber.

translation.en: Trustees, custodians, fund managers, administrators and RBA all have their roles and the rules they must observe are clearly spelt out.
translation.luo: Joma nie bod, joma omi ting' mar rito pesa, joma ochung' ne kaka pesa tiyo, joma ochung' ne tije mopogore opogore e riwruogego, kod RBA nigi migepe sie ma omigi kod chike ma nyaka girit.

translation.en: The reforms we have carried out in the industry over the two decades have been positive with the latest being the rules on mortgages that now allows pension scheme members to use up to 40 percent or Kshs 7.0 million of their pension savings to purchase a residential house.
translation.luo: Lokruoge ma wasebego kuom higni 20 mosekalo osekonyo ahinya. Lokruok ma wasetimo machiegnini en kaka ng'ato nyalo tiyo gi kenone e ng'iewo ot, koro ng'ato nyalo kawo pasent 40 mar pesane kata milion 7 mondo ong'iewgo ot modakie.

translation.en: With the enactment of this amendment and the regulations, pension schemes - through their trustees - have until September 2021 to amend scheme documentation accordingly to facilitate members enjoy this benefit.
translation.luo: Lokruok ma wasetimo e chike matayo riwruoge ma kano pes ritaya osemiyo riwruogego nyaka Septemba 2021 mondo gin be kokalo kuom jo bod mag riwruogegigo  gitim lokruogni e chenrogi mag keno  mondo joma keno kodgi bende okonyre gi lokruokni.

translation.en: We expect many Kenyans who belong to retirement schemes to seize the opportunity and use their pension savings to buy homes as part of securing a comfortable life in retirement.
translation.luo: Dwaher ni Jo Kenya mang'eny manie chenro mag kano pes ritaya oti gi thuoloni mondo ging'iew udi sani, mondo bang' ritaya weche obednegi mayot.

translation.en: With the secure regulatory framework under the 20-year-old RBA, the introduction of new schemes easily accessible to the informal sector, the tax incentives given by the Government for saving through retirement benefits schemes, great value additions such as post-retirement medical and mortgage access and learning from the lessons of the Covid-19 pandemic there is no reason why any Kenyan should not be saving for retirement.
translation.luo: Jo Kenya duto onego obed gi chenro mar kano pes ritaya nikech gik maluwogi: RBA mosetiyo kuom higni 20 osetimo chenro mong'ith ma neno ni pes ji orit maber, oselos chenro manyien mamiyo joma timo tijegi giwegi nyalo keno mayot, sirkal  osedwoko chien osuru ma gikawo kuom pesa mokan, kendo ng'ato nyalo bedo gi chenro mabiro konye yudo thieth bang' ritaya, to mogik, masira mar Korona opuonjowa kaka keno nyalo mako ne ng'ato kama duong'.

translation.en: A former banker fired by his employer over an allegation that he caused it to lose Sh140 million has been awarded Sh17 million.
translation.luo: Jal ma yande tiyo gi bengi to ne oriemb e tich nikech ne iwacho ni omiyo bengi olalo milion 140, ochul milion 17.

translation.en: John Wanjohi had worked for the National Bank of Kenya for 29 years before he was kicked out in 1999.
translation.luo: John Wanjohi noyudo osetiyo ne National Bank of Kenya kuom higni 29 kane iriembe e tich e higa mar 1999.

translation.en: He had joined the bank on March 11, 1970 as a clerk and rose through the ranks to a branch manager.
translation.luo: Ne ochako tich gi bengino kaka karan, Mach tarik 11, 1970, mosmos ne oidho ng'as mobedo jatelo mar bengi.

translation.en: He was summarily dismissed following an allegation that he caused the bank to lose Sh140 million between 2007 and 2009.
translation.luo: Ne oriembe e tich kanyo gikanyo ma ok ochule gimoro amora nikech ne owach ni omiyo bengi olalo milion 140 e kind higni mag  2007 gi 2009.

translation.en: Aggrieved, Wanjohi sued NBK arguing that he was a victim of a witch-hunt.
translation.luo: Wanjohi ne okecho kendo ne odonjo ne NBK e kot kowacho ni mano ne ok en adier. Ni ne gimanyo mana yo mar gole e tich.

translation.en: He claimed the bank’s management was hell-bent to get rid of its old staff and he was a victim.
translation.luo: Owacho ni jotelo mag bengi ne timo gimoro amora mondo gigol joma gineno ni oseti e tich, kendo mano emomiyo ne giriembe e tich.

translation.en: “I was dismissed without notice in an exercise that was malicious and purely meant to save the defendant financial expenses,” he testified.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ne kot niya: “Ne giriemba e tich ma ok gimiya notis moro amora, ne gitimo kamano mondo bengi kik chula pesana.”

translation.en: Labour Court Judge Nduma Nderi found that he was not given a chance to rebut the allegations, adding that the bank had an option to retire him and pay his pension but did not.
translation.luo: Nduma Nderi ma en Jang'ad Bura e Labour Court ma en kot makedo ne ratiro mag jotich ne oyudo ni ne ok omi Wanjohi thuolo mar nyiso ni weche ma ne iwacho kuomego ne ok gin adier. Nderi bende wacho ni bengi ne nigi thuolo mar nyiso Wanjohi ni oritaya kae to gichule pes ritaya to ne ok gitimo kamano.

translation.en: According to the judge, the loss allegation was false.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi jang'ad Burano, lal ma bengi ne wacho ni ne giyudo ne ok en adier.

translation.en: He noted that it was an embarrassment for a senior employee to be unceremoniously kicked out after diligently serving the bank for 29 years.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni ne gikwodo wi Wanjohi ahinya kuom riembe e tich kamano nimar ne oyudo osetiyo matek ne bengino kuom higni 29 kendo gie kindeno, ne en jatich mang'ongo.

translation.en: According to Nderi, Wanjohi suffered financial loss being the effect of the sacking, developed diabetes due to stress and suffered loss and damage associated with the sudden loss of income and non-payment of pension dues that had accrued over a 29-year period.
translation.luo: Nderi wacho ni nikech ne oriemb Wanjohi e tich, ne olalo yutone, wachno ne okelone parruok mang'eny moyudo tuwo ma sukari. Kendo nikech ne oriembe e tich apoya wechene ne okethore kendo ne oyudo lal maduong' nikech ne ok omiye pesane mar ritaya ma ne osekunore kuom higni 29.

translation.en: The bank had accused Wanjohi of, among others, deliberately making false and misleading returns and records of transactions involving the bank and third parties.
translation.luo: Moko kuom ketho ma bengi ne owacho ni ne giyudo kuom Wanjohi ne gin ni ne ochiwo ripot mag miriambo e wi osuru ma ne bengi chulo kendo ne ochiwo kwan ma ok kare e wi pesa ma ne wuotho e kind bengi kod joma oko.

translation.en: Maana Lifestyle Supermarket attendant arranges bread at Luanda town in Vihiga on April 11, 2020.
translation.luo: April tarik 11, 2020 Jatich moro matiyo Maana Lifestyle Supermarket chano mkate Luanda taon, Vihiga.

translation.en: Bakers have criticised the government’s move to introduce value-added tax (VAT) on bread and its products.
translation.luo: Jolos makate ywak ni sirkal otimo marach keto osuru mar VAT e makate kod gik mamoko miloso gi ngano.

translation.en: The Bakers Association of Kenya (Bake) says the tax is inhumane, considering the economic downturn the sector has suffered since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic last year.
translation.luo: Bakers Association of Kenya (Bake) wacho ni nikech sirkal ong'eyo kaka ohand makate osedok chien nyaka masira mar Korona chakre higa mokalo, keto osuru ma kamano e makate en tim juok.

translation.en: It argues that introducing the tax will deny majority of Kenyans access to quality food.
translation.luo: Giwacho ni keto osuru ma kamano e makate biro miyo ng'eny jo Kenya kik yud chiemo madwarore.

translation.en: “The introduction of 16 per cent VAT on this commodity will further increase the average price of a 400g loaf of bread by approximately Sh8, making it unaffordable to the majority of Kenyans,” said Bake in a letter to the National Treasury.
translation.luo: Bake ne owacho niya e barua ma ne gioro National Treasury; “Keto osuru mar pasent 16 mar VAT kuom makate biro medo gi siling 8 nengo mar makate gram 400, to nengono ohingo ng'eny Jo Kenya.

translation.en: This will be in violation of the fundamental right to affordable food.
translation.luo: Kendo mano en ketho ratiro mar dhano mar yudo chiemo monyalo ng'iewo.

translation.en: The planned tax comes a few months after manufacturers increased the price of bread by Sh5 following a jump in global wheat prices.
translation.luo: Osuru midwaro medno biro e tok jolos makate medo nengo makate gi siling 5 nikech nengo ming'iewogo ng'ano e piny ngima ne omedore.

translation.en: The price of bread has remained stable over the years due to zero-rating on tax, with manufacturers competing for the small margins buoyed by economies of scale.
translation.luo: Nengo mar makate ok osemedre ahinya e higni mang'eny mosekalo nikech ok ketga osuru e makate. Mano osemiyo jolos makate medo nengo makate mana matin kendo gitimo kinda mar loso makate mang'eny mondo oumnegi lal moro amora.

translation.en: The government, however, argues that it needs to find ways to support its 2021-2022 budget.
translation.luo: Sirkal to wacho ni nyaka gimany yore mag yudo pesa mondo gisir bajet mar 2021-2022.

translation.en: Treasury has estimated that it will borrow about Sh1.5 trillion by July.
translation.luo: Treasury wacho ni gibiro holo gimoro trilion 1.5 chop Julai.

translation.en: However, most of the revenue-collection measures highlighted in the Finance Bill, 2021 are generally aimed at deepening the tax bracket rather than widening it.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, kaluwore gi Chenro mar Kelo Lokruok e Osuru mar 2021 kata Finance Bill, sirkal dwaro medo osuru moyudo oseketo, to ok keto osuru e gik ma yande onge osuru.

translation.en: The key targets are fuel, alcoholic drinks, betting, cigarettes and financial transactions, with bread and milk formula slapped with 16 per cent VAT.
translation.luo: Gik ma gidwaro medone osuru gin  gik moko kaka petrol, kong'o, betting, ndawa kod pesa michulo ka ng'ato okawo kata oketo pesa kamoro. Makate kod chak molos ne nyithindo to oketne VAT mar pasent 16.

translation.en: Kenya Power and Lighting Company's technical team at KPLC Huruma Sub-station, Nairobi.
translation.luo: Jotich lwedo mag Kenya Power and Lighting Company's ka gin  KPLC Huruma Sub-station, Nairobi.

translation.en: Kenya Power (KPLC) is set to lay off employees in a planned turnaround strategy that also seeks to push more staff from offices to the field in a bid to align its resources with its needs.
translation.luo: Kenya Power (KPLC) dwaro kelo lokruoge madongo e kambigi. Gidwaro riembo jotich moko kae to gigolo jotich moko matiyo e ofise mondo oti tije ma oko. Gitimo kamano mondo pesa ma giyudo ochop dwaro mag kambi.

translation.en: The company is searching for a consultancy firm to develop a comprehensive transformation strategy and, once it is approved by the board, assist in its implementation.
translation.luo: KPLC manyo kambi ma tije en ng'ado ne jo ohala rieko mag dongruok.  Gidwaro ni olosnegi chenro mong'ith mabiro kelonegi lokruok makonyo, kendo ka bod oketo seyi e chenrono, gidwaro ni kambino okonygi tiyo gi paro ma gichiwogo.

translation.en: Among the areas of focus by the consultant, Kenya Power said, would be a strategy on a gradual reduction in its workforce.
translation.luo: Achiel kuom gik ma Kenya Power diher ni kambino okonygigo, en chenro mar dwoko chien kwan mar jotich mosmos.

translation.en: The firm currently employs over 10,000 people.
translation.luo: Gie sani, Kenya Power ondiko ji mokalo 10,000.

translation.en: “The transformation strategy will be focused on the value creation levers and will comprise of… phased reduction in workforce to ensure KPLC remains competitive and provides the right levels of service, and bring this into line with best benchmarks in Sub-Saharan Africa,” said Kenya Power in a document published on its website.
translation.luo: Kenya Power ne owacho kama e websait margi: “Lokruok ma wadwaro kelo e KPLC  gin lokruok madhi medo ohala ma KPLC yudo...gidhi dwoko piny mosmos kwan jotich mondo KPLC omed timo ohala maber kendo giti kaka owinjore mi gipiem gi kembe stima  mabeyo moloyo man Sub-Saharan Africa.”

translation.en: The electricity distributor recently experienced a reduction in employees to 10,479 in the financial year to June 2020, from a high of 11,295 in 2017.
translation.luo: E higa mar Jun 19 nyaka Jun 2020 Kambi machiwo stimani ne odwoko piny kwand jotich mi odong' gi jotich 10,479. Ne en gi jotich 11,295 e higa mar 2017.

translation.en: It has also been undertaking a restructuring, which has seen it deploy “extra workforce drawn from office-based staff countywide to enhance our field presence”.
translation.luo: Bende, KPLC osebedo katimo lokruok ei kambigi, gisegolo "moko kuom jotich manie ofis kendo giterogi e kaunti mopogore opogore mondo KPLC ong'e gik matimore oko."

translation.en: This is aimed at enabling a focus to customers as well as seal revenue leaks attributed to different factors, including illegal connections.
translation.luo: Gitimo kamano mondo gitudre achiel kachiel gi kastembegi kendo gigeng' ohala ma gisebedo ka gilalo nikech weche mopogore opogore, kaka joma ywayo stima ma ok giluwo chik.

translation.en: Increasing field staff is expected to help the firm in its new county-focused strategy, in which it has transformed counties into business units.
translation.luo: Medo kwan jotich matiyo oko igeno ni biro konyo kambi e chenrone mar pogo tich e kaunti ka kaunti. Ikwano kaunti achiel kaka ohala mochung' kende.

translation.en: Kenya Power said the consultant will factor in the ongoing efforts to turn around the company in the transformation strategy.
translation.luo: Kenya Powerwacho ni kambi mabiro ng'adonegi riekono, biro keto e paro lokruoge ma KPLC dhi nyime timo gie sani.

translation.en: Other areas that the strategy seeks to address include the government’s Last Mile Connectivity Project, which has to an extent been a drain to the firm.
translation.luo: Chenro manyien-no bende onego onon chenro mar sirkal madwaro ni chop higa mar 2020 jo Kenya duto obed gi stima kata Last Mile Connectivity Project. KPLC wacho ni chenrono oseterogi asara.

translation.en: The project, which has been pushing universal electricity access and hooks up homes to power as long as they are within a 600-metre radius from a transformer, has in the past been partly blamed for the company’s financial woes.
translation.luo: Chenrono dwaro ni ji duto obed gi stima. Gitudo ne ng'ato stima tek ni ode en gimoro mita 600 gi transfoma. Wachore ni chenrono en achiel kuom gik ma osemiyo ohand KPLC odok chien.

translation.en: Kenya Power now hopes the consultancy can develop a strategy that will “resolve the financing of ongoing rollout and maintenance of last-mile electrification” including how to “immediately ring-fence and take off-balance-sheet if possible”.
translation.luo: Kenya Power geno ni kambi ma dhi ng'adonegi riekono biro keto chenro " manyiso kaka ibiroga chul  ne tij last-mile electrification. Tich ma KPLC osebedo ka timo kendo podi dhi nyime timo. Gigeno bende ni kanyalore, chenro mibiro losno, biro pogo mapiyo piyo pes KPLC gi pesa mitiyogo e last-mile electrification. Bende digiher ahinya mondo ogol kuomgi ting' mar last-mile electrification.”

translation.en: It also said another role for the consultant will be to come up with a strategy for the renegotiation of power purchase agreements (PPAs).
translation.luo: Giwacho bende ni digiher mondo kambino olos chenro mondo KPLC otim winjruok manyien mar ng'iewo stima gi kembe maloso stima, power purchase agreements (PPAs).

translation.en: The PPAs with power producers have been a key concern for the company, with many of them requiring payment even when the producers have not fed power to the electricity grid.
translation.luo: Winjruok ma ne gitimo gi kembe maloso stima en achiel kuom gik mosechando KPLC ahinya. Ng'eny kembego oketo ni nyaka chulgi kata ka KPLC ok oywayo stima.

translation.en: The structure of the agreements are such a concern, particularly their impact on the cost of power, that President Uhuru Kenyatta recently formed a task force to look into the contracts.
translation.luo: Winjruogego miyo nengo stima idho ahinya mochopo kama Ker Uhuru Kenyatta ne owalo grup moro mondo onon wachno.

translation.en: Kenya Power also hopes the transformation strategy will chart a way to reduce electricity losses to between 10 and 12 per cent.
translation.luo: Kenya Power bende geno ni chenro manyien-no biro konyogi ng'eyo kaka ginyalo geng'o gi pasent 10 -12 ohala ma gilalo nikech stima.

translation.en: System losses have been on the rise, standing at 23.5 per cent in the year to June 2020 from 18.7 per cent in June 2017.
translation.luo: Lal ma gisebedo ka giyudo nikech masinde ok ti maber osebedo ka medo idho. Chop Jun 2020 ne en pasent 23.5  kowuok e pasent 18.7, Jun 2017.

translation.en: Reprieve for Lake Basin Mall suspects after court suspends trial
translation.luo: Kot ochungo kes mar Joma ne odonjne gi wach Lake Basin Mall

translation.en: Several accused persons in the Sh4.1 billion Lake Basin Development Authority (LBDA) Mall scandal got a reprieve after the High Court temporarily stopped their prosecution.
translation.luo: Ji mang'eny ma ne odonjnegi nikech mibadhi e wach gedo mar Lake Basin Development Authority (LBDA) Mall  ma ne dhi kawo bilion 4.1, oyueyo matin bang' Kot Mamalo chungo kesgi kuom kinde.

translation.en: Justice James Wakiaga ruled that directors of Erdemann Properties Ltd which was contracted to construct the LBDA Mall in Kisumu had made a strong case against their prosecution to warrant the orders suspending the trial.
translation.luo: Jang'ad Bura James Wakiaga ne ong'ado ni jotelo mag Erdemann Properties Ltd ma ne otimgo winjruok mar gero LBDA Mall, Kisumu ne okwedo e yo malong'o weche ma ne odonjnegigo, kendo weche ma giwachogo omiyo kot ong'ado ni ochung kesno kuom kinde.

translation.en: “I find that the applicants have established grounds for grant of the order to stop the trial based on the evidence they have submitted. The court will be failing in its constitutional mandate of protecting the rights of the applicants if it does not stop the prosecution,” ruled Wakiaga.
translation.luo: Wakiaga ne ong'ado niya: “Weche ma joma odonjnegi okelo e kot gin weche mosir maber kendo inyalo chung kesni kaka gikwayo. Ka po ni kot ok ochungo kesni, ok obi  rito ratiro mag joma odonjnegi kaka chik dwaro.”

translation.en: Although the orders were issued following an application by Erdemann Properties Ltd and its directors Zeyun Yang and Zhang Jing, it will also apply to their 17 co-accused whose trial will also be suspended.
translation.luo: Kata obedo ni ne ong'ad ni kesno ochung' nikech kwayo mar  Erdemann Properties Ltd kod jotelo mag Zeyun Yang kod Zhang Jing, weche ma kot ong'adogo biro tiyo kuom ji  17 ma ne  odonjne kaachiel kodgi.

translation.en: The accused include Bobasi MP Innocent Momanyi, former Kisumu County Assembly Speaker Onyango Oloo and former LBDA Managing Director Peter Abok.
translation.luo: Joma ne odonjnegigo oriwo Innocent Momanyi ma en Jabunge ma Bobasi, Onyango Oloo ma en Jatend Od Bura ma Kisumu Kaunti, kod Peter Abok ma ne ochung' ne LBDA.

translation.en: Others are LBDA Board of Directors George Odawa, Anthony Kiprono, David Oyosi, John Mango, John Onyango, Boniface Simba, William Omoding, Jimmy Nabwera, Alex Mukabwa, Mary Micheka, Kennedy Musebe, Michael Obora, Joash Odhiambo, Dennis Mulaa and Josiah Okumu.
translation.luo: Joma moko gin Jo bod mag LBDA George Odawa, Anthony Kiprono, David Oyosi, John Mango, John Onyango, Boniface Simba, William Omoding, Jimmy Nabwera, Alex Mukabwa, Mary Micheka, Kennedy Musebe, Michael Obora, Joash Odhiambo, Dennis Mulaa kod Josiah Okumu.

translation.en: Justice Wakiaga ruled that the company’s directors had proved that their prosecution is illegal given that their involvement in the LBDA Mall was a contractual agreement approved by the Attorney General that should not warrant criminal prosecution.
translation.luo: Jabura  Wakiaga ne ong'ado ni jotend kambino ne onyiso maler ni okang' mar donjonegi e kot ok luwre gi chik nikech kane pok gichako tich  ne gidonjo e winjruok ma ne oketie seyi gi Attorney General. Omiyo ok onego odonjnegi ka joma ne oketho chik.

translation.en: “The issue at the end of the day would be as to whether they are being prosecuted as a result of their demand for settlement of their dues and whether the government is using the prosecution to frustrate them from seeking the contractual amount,” Wakiaga said.
translation.luo: Wakiaga ne owacho niya:“Ka kesni odhi nyime, chalo ka gima idonjone jogi nikech gikwayo ni ochulgi kaka ne giwinjore. Biro chalo ka gima sirkal tiyo gi kotni mondo  kik gichul jogi  kaka ne giwinjore.”

translation.en: Zeyun and Zhang challenged the prosecution arguing that the charges were illegal and meant to intimidate and stop them from pursuing their balance owed.
translation.luo: Zeyun kod Zhang ne owacho ne kot ni weche ma odonjnegigo ok luwre gi chik kendo idwaro mana bwoggi mondo giwe bandho pesa mapok ochulgi.

translation.en: Through lawyer Wilfred Lusi, they argued that they had delivered the complete Mall which had already been put to commercial use and were surprised when the prosecution recommended the charges when they demanded the payments.
translation.luo: Kokalo kuom okil Wilfred Lusi, ne giwacho ni ne gigero Mall migitieko kaka ne giwinjore kendo ji osechako timo ohala kuno, omiyo ne gibwok kane odonjnegi e kot  nikech gikwayo ni ochulgi.

translation.en: “The charges against the directors were actuated by the desire to punish them for pursuing what they had worked for. They were legally awarded the tender after a successful bid, and nothing in the contract suggests they were engaged in corruption,” said Lusi.
