translation.luo: Lusi ne owacho niya: "Odonjne jogi e kot mondo osandgi nikech gikwayo ratichgi, nikech gikwayo pesa ma ne gisetiyone. Ne gikwayo tich e yo maluwore gi chik kendo gin ema ne omigi tijno e kind jomamoko nikech ne giromo gi tich. Winjruok ma ne gitimo ne oluwre gichik ma onge mibadhi kata achiel.

translation.en: According to Lusi, the issues which formed the basis of charging the company directors should have been referred to arbitration as was provided in the contract.
translation.luo: Lusi wacho ni weche ma ne omiyo odonjne jotelogo e kot gin weche ma ne onego gilos e kindgi mana kaka winjruok ma ne gitimono nyiso.

translation.en: He added that the AG had also rendered a legal opinion on the validity of the contract which authorised the payment of the sums and prove that there was no fraud involved.
translation.luo: Ne omedo bende ni bedo ni AG ne oketo seyi mare e winjruokno mano nyiso ni winjruokno ne luwore gi chik kendo ne owinjore ni ochulgi kaka ne gindiko kendo onge kuo ma ne otimore.

translation.en: Justice Wakiaga agreed with the submissions, ruling that it will be unfair to continue with the trial when the directors had raised valid questions about their prosecution which should be determined first before the corruption case proceeds.
translation.luo: Wakiaga ne oyie gi gima kot ne ong'ado kowacho ni ok en kare dhi nyime gi kesno nikech  jotelogo osenyiso maler ni ok ne owinjore mondo odonjnegi. Ne owacho ni kot onego onon mokwongo weche ma jotelogo ne owacho kapok ging'ado mar dhi nyime gi kes mar mibadhi ma odonjnego jogo.

translation.en: The directors alongside the other suspects were last year charged with several counts of conspiracy, with the prosecution’s case being that they conspired to defraud public funds by inflating the cost of constructing the mall from Sh2.4 billion to Sh4.1 billion.
translation.luo: Higa mokalo, ne odonj ne jotelogo kaachiel gi jomamokogo ni ne giwinjore e yore mang'eny mondo gikwal sirkal kuom medo nengo mar gero mall kowuok bilion 2.4 nyaka bilion 4.1.

translation.en: Eight out of 10 German businesses in Kenya have cited travel restrictions as the major negative effect of the Covid-19 pandemic.
translation.luo: Kuom ohelni mag Jo Jerman  man Kenya,  8 kuom 10  wacho ni rido chike mag wuoth e gima duong' moloyo mosedwoko ohala piny e kinde masira mar Koronani.

translation.en: Due to this, 70 per cent of them said depressed demand was the greatest risks to their economic development, according to a survey by the Delegation of German Industry and Commerce for Eastern Africa (AHK), a business lobby.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi nonro mar riwruok makedo ne ratiro mag jo ohala, miluongo ni Delegation of German Industry and Commerce for Eastern Africa (AHK), mano omiyo pasent 70 mar ohelnigo wacho ni gima dwokogi chien ahinya en ni kwan jong'iepo odok piny.

translation.en: The Covid-19 pandemic has reduced economic activities owing to the containment measures that have been implemented by various governments to curb the spread of the disease.
translation.luo: Masira mar Korona osedwoko ohelni chien nikech okenge ma sirkande mopogore opogore osekawo mondo gigeng' landruok mar tuwono.

translation.en: Nonetheless, a good number of the businesses, 45 per cent, were satisfied with their current situation even as a third described their position as good.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ohendni mogwaro, madirom pasent 45 mor gi kaka weche koro dhi kendo achiel kuom adek wacho ni koro weche beyo.

translation.en: The survey was conducted in the first weeks of April.
translation.luo: Ne otim nonrono e chak April.

translation.en: Maren Diale-Schellschmidt, a delegate of the lobby, said the numbers showed how the German businesses in Kenya are set for successful operation.
translation.luo: Maren Diale-Schellschmidt, ma en achiel kuom joma nie riwruokno wacho ni kwan-no nyiso kaka ohelni mag jo Jerman biro dhi maber.

translation.en: “German companies are here to stay and even grow their business further. What is especially encouraging is that we notice less mention of shortage of skilled workers as a hindering factor,” said Diale-Schellschmidt.
translation.luo: Diale-Schellschmidt wacho niya: “Ohelni mag jo Jerman gin ohelni masiko Kenya kendo gibiro medo timo dongruok. Gima morowa moloyo en ni kembegi yudo jotich molony kenya, kendo ok giywag ni nok mar jotich dwokogi chien.”

translation.en: German Ambassador to Kenya Annett Guenther said the recent German investments in pharmaceutical, manufacturing, insurance and after-sale service centres are signs of increased interest in Kenya.
translation.luo: Annett Guenther ma en Ja Mbetre ma sirkand Jerman ooro Kenya, wacho ni ohelni ma Jerman nyocha okelo Kenya; mag thieth, kembe maloso gik moko, insuarans kod kuonde minyalo konyie joma oseng'iewo gik moko, nyiso ni Jerman ohero Kenya.

translation.en: The interest, she added, was despite the strains brought on businesses by the coronavirus pandemic.
translation.luo: Ne omedo ni gichiwo gik ma kamago kata obedo ni gin bende masira mar Korona ne odwoko ohendnigi piny.

translation.en: “The German government accompanies these efforts by German businesses with a co-operation that aims at improving the business environment in Kenya as well as the employability of Kenyan youths in TVET (technical and vocational education and training) centres of excellence,” Ms Guenther said.
translation.luo: Ms Guenther ne owacho niya:  “Sirkal mar Kenya riwo lwedo kinda ma jo ohala ma Jerman osetimo mondo gimed miyo ohendni mag Kenya odhi maber kendo gikony rowere ma Kenya man e kolej mong'ith mag TVET (technical and vocational education and training) oyud tich.

translation.en: Allianz, an insurer, is the latest German company to enter the Kenyan market after it completed the purchase of a 66 per cent stake in Jubilee General Insurance Kenya from the parent company Jubilee Holdings, which will retain a 34 per cent stake.
translation.luo: Allianz, ma en riwruok mar insuarans, e kambi ma odonjo Kenya machiegnini bang' ng'iewo pasent 66 mar kambi mar Jubilee General Insurance Kenya kowuok kuom kambi mar Jubilee Holdings, ma koro odong' gi pasent  34.

translation.en: In the survey, 36 per cent of the firms cited cancellation of orders as a concern while 33 per cent listed problems in the supply chain.
translation.luo: E nonro ma ne otimno, pasent 36 mar kembego ne owacho ni gima duong' ma osedwokogi chien en ni ji ok ng'iew gik ma ne gisekwayo ni okelnegi. to pasent 33 wacho ni pek ma gibedogo e yudo gik ma gidwaro ema osedwokogi chien.

translation.en: Most of the companies do not expect the Kenyan economy to return to the pre-Covid-19 level until next year.
translation.luo: Ng'eny kembegi neno ni weche biro dok kaka yande gin kapok masira mar Korona otuch mana higa manyien, to ok higani.

translation.en: About 49 per cent said they expect the recovery to happen in 2022 and 36 per cent later.
translation.luo: Pasent 49 ne owacho ni giparo ni weche biro dok e wang'e e higa mar 2022, to pasent  36 ne owacho ni mano biro timore bang'e.

translation.en: Only nine per cent expect the economy to recover in 2021, and six per cent do not expect a full recovery at all.
translation.luo: Mana pasent ochiko paro ni ohelni biro dok e wang'e e higa mar 2021, to pasent auchiel wacho ni weche ok nodog e wang'e ngang'.

translation.en: This week, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) reviewed downwards Kenya’s economic outlook to 6.3 per cent from 7.6 per cent, citing the continuing effects of the pandemic.
translation.luo: Jumani, riwruok mar  International Monetary Fund (IMF) ne owacho ni dongruok mar Kenya odok chien kopim gi piny mangima gi pasent 6.3 kowuok e pasent 7.6. Giwacho ni mano otimore nikech pek mag masira mar Korona.

translation.en: “IMF staff now project the economy to expand by 6.3 per cent in 2021. The coronavirus shock has unfortunately also reversed some of the poverty reduction gains Kenya achieved in recent years and debt remains elevated,” said the leader of the IMF delegation to Kenya, Mary Goodman.
translation.luo: Mary Goodman, ma ne otelo ne grup ma IMF ne ooro Kenya ne owacho niya: “Jotich ma IMF neno ni dongruok mar Kenya biro medore gi pasent 6.3 e higa mar 2021. Giwacho ni masira mar Korona bende osedwoko chien moko kuom dongruok ma Kenya nosetimo e dwoko piny dhier kendo gowi ma Kenya nigo pod ni malo.”

translation.en: Safaricom paid Sh28.2 billion in commissions to M-Pesa agents last year, up from Sh23.8 billion that it paid in 2019.
translation.luo: Safaricom ne ochulo joma timo ohand M-Pesa bilion 28.2 higa mokalo, kopim-gi bilion 23.8 ma ne gichulogi e higa mar 2019.

translation.en: The company last year recorded Sh82.5 billion in M-Pesa revenue, two per cent lower than the Sh84 billion made in 2019, with the firm attributing this drop to the waiver of fees on cash transfers and Lipa Na M-Pesa transactions of below Sh1,000.
translation.luo: Higa mokalo kambino ne oyudo ohala mar bilion 82.5 e ohala mar  M-Pesa, mano ne ni piny gi  pasent 2 nikech e higa mar 2019 ne giyudo bilion 84. Giwacho ni mano ne otimore nikech ne gigolo pesa ma ng'ato chulo e wi oro kata golo pesa matinne 1000. Bende  ne gigolo pesa ma ng'ato chulo e wiye kapo ni ochulo pesa matinne 1000 gi Lipa Na Mpesa.

translation.en: The telco said the first half of the financial year saw an increase in activity on the M-Pesa system as customers took advantage of the free transfers and Lipa na M-Pesa transactions.
translation.luo: Kambino wacho ni ohala mar M-Pesa  ne omedore e dweche auchiel mokwongo nikech chudo ma ne ogol mar oro pesa kod Lipa na M-Pesa.

translation.en: “Total M-Pesa transaction value grew 58 per cent year-on-year to Sh22.04 trillion, while the volume of transactions grew 29.8 per cent year to 11.68 billion,” said the firm in its latest financial results.
translation.luo: E ripot moro ma Safaricom ogolo machiegni, giwacho ni, “Pesa duto ma ne ochul M-Pesa ne omedre gi pasent 58 e higano mochopo trilion 22.04, to kwan mar kinde ma  ne oor kata ogol pesa e higano ne omedore gi pasent 29.8  mochopo bilion 11.68.”

translation.en: Overall, person-to-person transfers rose by 36 per cent from Sh2.6 trillion at the end of December 2019 to Sh3.6 trillion last year, with deposits and withdrawals standing at Sh3.7 trillion and Sh2 trillion respectively.
translation.luo: Kwan ma ji ne oorogo pesa ng'ato ne nyawadgi ne oidho gi pasent 36 kowuok trilion 2.6 giko Desemba  2019 mochopo trilion 3.6 e higa mokalo. Kwan mar pesa ma ji ne oketo e Mpesa ne en trilion 3.7, to kwan pesa ma ne ogol ne en trilion 2.

translation.en: Deputy President William Ruto interacting with professionals, political and business leaders from Bungoma, Kakamega, Busia and Vihiga counties during a consultation meeting at his Karen Office, Nairobi.
translation.luo: Jalup Ker William Ruto wuoyo gi josomo molony, jotelo mag siasa kod jotelo mag ohala mowuok e kaunti mag Bungoma, Kakamega, Busia kod Vihiga e chokruok moro ma ne gitimo e ofise ma Karen, Nairobi.

translation.en: Deputy President William Ruto will retreat to the Coast for two days to champion his economic empowerment blueprint.
translation.luo: Jalup Ker William Ruto biro dhi Pwani kuom ndalo ariyo mondo owuo gi ji e wi chenro ma en-go mar konyogi timo  dongruokgi giwegi e weche ohala.

translation.en: The DP is expected to meet local leaders and professionals alongside his economic strategists in a hotel in the afternoon before they go into plenary.
translation.luo: Jalup Ker biro romo gi jotelo ma Pwani kod josomo molony ma kuno kaachiel gi joge matimone chenro mag dongruok e otel moro godiechieng' kapok gidhi e chokruok moriwo ji duto.

translation.en: This comes after Dr Ruto held a similar meeting at his Karen residence, Nairobi, yesterday, where he hosted Western leaders and professionals led by Mumias East MP Benjamin Washiali.
translation.luo: Mano timore e tok chokruok ma kamano ma Dr Ruto ne obedogo nyoro e dalane ma Karen Nairobi. Nyoro oromo gi  jotelo kod josomo molony mowuok Western kotelnegi gi Benjamin Washiali ma en jabunge ma Mumias East.

translation.en: Ruto’s tour of the Coast comes a day after he skipped the official launch of the Lamu Port by President Uhuru Kenyatta.
translation.luo: Ruto limo gweng' mar Pwani mana odiechieng' achiel bang' bare e nyasi ma Ker Uhuru Kenyatta ne yawoe Pot ma Lamu.

translation.en: He is scheduled to issue his address at 3pm before the meeting transitions to plenary discussions ahead of a joint communique to be issued tomorrow.
translation.luo: Onego ogol twak mare kiny saa  9 godiechieng' kapok ji duto oriwore kodgi e chokruok. Kae to gibiro golo lendo moro ka gin kanyachiel.

translation.en: "The DP will be in the Coast region for two days to meet with the leaders and professionals on their economic empowerment agenda. He will be accompanied by economic experts led by David Ndii," said the DP's Director of Communication Emmanuel Talam.
translation.luo: Emmanuel Talam, ma en Jatelo Mochung'ne Tudruok mag Jalup Ker ne owacho niya, "Jalup Ker biro limo alwora mar Pwani kuom ndalo ariyo mondo orom gi jotelo kod josomo molony ma kuno mondo owuo kodgi e wi chenro margi mar timo dongruok e alworagi. Obiro wuotho gi grup mar josomo molony e weche mag dongruok motelne gi David Ndii."

translation.en: He added," He will wind up on Saturday and deliver a joint communique with the region's leadership."
translation.luo: Ne omedo niya: " Obiro tieko limbeneno chieng' Jumamos kae to gikone obiro golo lendo moro ka en kaachiel gi jotelo mag Pwani."

translation.en: A section of Coast lawmakers recently deliberated on key projects they expect to present to the DP.
translation.luo: Moko kuom okil mag Pwani nyocha owuoyo e wi chenro mag dongruok ma gidwaro kelo e nyim Jalup Ker.

translation.en: The leaders identified investing in the special economic zones, the blue economy, mining, housing projects as well as the thorny issue of job opportunities at Mombasa port.
translation.luo: Jotelogo ne owuoyo e wi wach timo ohala e alwora mitayo gi chike mag ohala ma ok orid, kaka inyalo tim ohala mar Nam e yo maber ma ok ochid pi kod alwora, wach kunyo kite ma nengogi tek, wach gero ute ma jidakie kod wach ma iye otwere mar ndiko ji tich e Pot ma Mombasa.

translation.en: In attendance were MPs Owen Baya (Kilifi North), Mohammed Ali (Nyali), Aisha Jumwa (Malindi), Khatib Mwashetani (Lungalunga), Faisel Baidel (Msambweni), Benjamin Tayari (Kinango), Senators Anwar Loitiptip (Lamu) and former Senator Hassan Omar, among others.
translation.luo: Joma ne nie chokruogno ne gin: Jobunge kaka, Owen Baya (Kilifi North), Mohammed Ali (Nyali), Aisha Jumwa (Malindi), Khatib Mwashetani (Lungalunga), Faisel Baidel (Msambweni), Benjamin Tayari (Kinango), Seneta Anwar Loitiptip (Lamu) kod Seneta machon Hassan Omar, kaachiel gi joma moko.

translation.en: The agenda of such forums has revolved around politics and the economy, with the DP making a case for what he has termed a “bottom-up” approach.
translation.luo: E chokruogego, gisebedo ka giwuoyo e wi siasa kod dongruok. Jalup Ker wacho ni chenro ma en-go en machako piny kadhi malo.

translation.en: Ruto's charm offensive has seen him meet leaders from Kajiado County, Mt Kenya and Western.
translation.luo: Chenro ma Ruto tiyogoni mondo oywago ji kore osemiyo oromo gi jotelo ma Kajiado Kaunti, jotelo ma Mt Kenya kod jotelo ma Western.

translation.en: Yesterday, the DP met stakeholders from Bungoma, Busia and Kakamega counties at his Karen residence.
translation.luo: Nyoro Jalup Ker ne oromo gi jotelo mawuok e kaunti mag Bungoma, Busia kod Kakamega e dalane ma Karen.

translation.en: The meeting that brought together business professionals and politicians was convened by Washiali.
translation.luo: Washiali ema ne ogudo jo ohala mosomo kod josiasa ne chokruogni.

translation.en: Others who attended the meeting were Daniel Wanyama (Webuye West MP), John Waluke (Sirisia) and former Sports Cabinet Secretary Rashid Echesa.
translation.luo: Joma moko ma ne nie chokruogni ne oriwo Daniel Wanyama (Webuye West MP), John Waluke (Sirisia) kod Rashid Echesa ma ne chon en  Jatend sirkal Mochung'ne weche Spot.

translation.en: “The reason I requested this meeting was because I wanted to explain myself to you and to persuade you that I have a plan worth implementing. That plan is not complete and I want it enriched by you people,” Ruto said.
translation.luo: Ruto ne owachonegi niya; “Gimomiyo aluongo romoni en ni mondo alernu chenro moro ma aseloso manyalo kelo dongruok e alworau, kendo anyisu gimomiyo en chenro minyalo gen kendo manyalo tiyo. Chenroni ok oting'o weche duto, adwaro ni umedie weche mamoko kendo umed berogo.”

translation.en: Mr Washiali said the meeting discussed the economic interests of the Western region with a view to incorporate it into Ruto’s overall manifesto.
translation.luo: Mr Washiali ne owacho ni ne giwuoyo e wi dongruok madwarore e alwora mar Western mondo gine kaka inyalo so chenrogino e chenro maduong' ma Ruto biro manyogo ombulu.

translation.en: Top on the agenda, he said, was improving economic activities such as farming, Jua Kali and boda boda industries.
translation.luo: Owacho ni gik madongo ma ne giwuoyoe en kaka ginyalo kelo dongruok e weche mag pur, ohala mar Jua kali kod ohala mar boda boda.

translation.en: “Our farmers have been working hard over the years and yet they have nothing to show for it,” he said, adding that the respective counties would work through committees to identify their different priorities.
translation.luo: Ne owacho niya: “Jopur ma thurwa osebedo katiyo matek kuom higni to onge gima long'o ma gisetimo." kae to omedo ni kaunti mopogore opogorego biro loso komiti e kauntigi ma gibiro tiyogo e fwenyo kuonde minyalo timie dongruok e kaunti ka kaunti.

translation.en: He added, "Our agenda will be the creation of wealth, jobs and opportunities as well as supporting enterprises and decriminalising the business environment. A deliberate government intervention that will put resources in small businesses will be the focal point of the bottom-up approach of our economic model."
translation.luo: Ne omedo niya, "Chenro marwa biro riwo gik moko kaka, loso mwandu, miyo ji tije, miyo ji thuolo mamoko mag yuto, konyo ohelni matindo timo dongruok kendo tieko mibadhi e weche ohala. Chenrowa mar chako piny ka wadhi malo, biro neno ni sirkal okawo okang' ma achiel kachiel mondo gine ni joma timo ohelni matindo tindo oyudo konyruok."

translation.en: Washiali said the DP gave them two weeks to come up with a paper to help him formulate a blueprint for the economic development of Western.
translation.luo: Washiali ne owacho ni Jalup Ker ne omiyogi jumbe ariyo mondo gindikne chenrogi mar dongruok mondo okonye e loso chenro mar dongruok e alwora mar Western duto.

translation.en: “Let us commit ourselves to an implementation plan so that we stop a government that is government for the sake of government,” Ruto told the leaders.
translation.luo: Ruto ne owacho ne jotelogo niya: “Watimuru kinda mondo chenroni oti mondo wabed gi sirkal ma sirkal.”

translation.en: Last Friday, Ruto ally Eliud Owalo convened a meeting of Nyanza leaders to craft the economic strategy of the region.
translation.luo: Tich Abich mokalo, Eliud Owalo ma en osiep Ruto ne ochoko jotelo moko ma Nyanza mondo gilos chenro mar dongruok mar alworano.

translation.en: They said their strategy will form the basis of their negotiations with other presidential hopefuls ahead of 2022.
translation.luo: Ne giwacho ni chenrono ema gibiro keto e nyim  jomamoko ma bende biro dwaro ombulu mar Ker kuomgi e higa mar 2022.

translation.en: Mr Owalo said anyone seeking the support of the region will have to enter into a pre-election economic pact with them.
translation.luo: Mr Owalo ne owacho ni ng'ato ang'ata mabiro dwaro ni giriwe lwedo nyaka donj e winjruok kodgi motelo ni obiro timo kaka onyis e chenrono.

translation.en: Those who attended the meeting include former Kisumu Governor Jack Ranguma, former Rongo MP Dalmas Otieno and former Rangwe MP Martin Ogindo.
translation.luo: Joma ne nie chokruogno ne oriwo Jack Ranguma, ma en Gavana machon ma Kisumu, Dalmas Otieno, ma en Jabunge machon ma Rongo kod Martin Ogindo, ma en Jabunge machon ma Rangwe.

translation.en: KPA slashes rates by half to lure importers to Lamu Port
translation.luo: KPA dwoko chudo chien gi nus mondo giywa joma kelo gik moko kowuok e pinje ma oko obi e Pot ma Lamu.

translation.en: Ships and importers at the Lamu Port will now pay half of the cost they incur at the port of Mombasa.
translation.luo: Meli kod kembe mamoko ma golo gik moko kowuok e pinje ma oko kendo kelogi e Pot ma Lamu biro mana chulo nus pesa ma gisegabedo ka gichulo e Pot ma Mombasa.

translation.en: In the new tariffs published by the Kenya Ports Authority (KPA) in a bid to lure traders to use Lamu port, stevedoring charges have also been reduced by 40 per cent.
translation.luo: List manyien mar nengo mar Kenya Ports Authority (KPA) nyiso ni gidwoko piny nengo mar golo kata keto gik moko e meli kata stevedoring gi pasent 40 mondo giywa ji obi e Pot ma Lamu.

translation.en: Stevedoring is the loading or offloading of cargo from the ship.
translation.luo: Stevedoring en keto kata golo osike e  meli.

translation.en: In a notice signed by KPA acting Managing Director Salim Rashid that was released on Thursday, the loading and unloading of motor vehicles will cost 40 per cent less.
translation.luo: Notis moro ma ne ogol Tich Ang'wen, kendo ma ogo seyi gi Jatelo mar  KPA  Salim Rashid, nyiso ni nengo golo kata keto mtokni e meli ibiro dwok piny gi pasent 40.

translation.en: Shore handling and wharfage services, which involve loading and discharging of domestic and transit cargo, will also attract a 40 per cent discount.
translation.luo: Golo kendo gonyo gik mabiro Kenya kata mitero e pinje ma oko bende ibiro dwok piny gi pasent 40.

translation.en: Goods dropped at Lamu by big ships before they are transported to other small ports will enjoy a 30 per cent free storage period.
translation.luo: Nengo mar kano mwandu ma owe Lamu gi meli madongo dongo mondo oter e pot matindo ibiro dwok piny gi pasent 30.

translation.en: "A 20-foot container will be charged Sh920 (USD10) from 31-60th day while 40ft container will attract Sh1,840 (USD20),” reads the tariff notice which indicated that transit cargo will enjoy a 30-day free period.
translation.luo: Notisno wacho ni, "Kontena mar fut 20 ibiro chulne siling 920 (USD10) e kind odiechieng' mar  31-60 to mar fut 40 ibiro chulne siling 1,840 (USD20),” mano nyiso ni kontena mikano kanyo biro bet kanyo nono ma ok ochulnegi gimoro kuom odiechienge 30.

translation.en: Thereafter, a 20ft container and 40ft container will attract Sh3,680 (USD40) and Sh7,360 (USD80) respectively.
translation.luo: Bang' mano kontena mar fut 20 ibiro chulne siling 3,680 (USD40)  to kontena mar fut 40 ibiro chulne 7,360 (USD80).

translation.en: Domestic cargo will enjoy 15 free storage days. Between the 16th and 18th day, USD30 will be charged for a 20ft container while a 40ft container will attract USD 60.
translation.luo: Mwandu mag Kenya to ibiro kan nono kuom ndalo 15. E kind odiechieng' mar 16 kod mar 18 gibiro chulo USD30 ne kontena mar fut 20 to kontena mar fut 40 ibiro chulne USD 60.

translation.en: Containers staying for 27 to 35 days will attract USD40 and USD80 for 20ft and 40ft containers respectively. Thereafter, importers will pay ShSh4,140 (USD45) and Sh8,280 (USD90) for 20ft and 40ft containers respectively.
translation.luo: Kontena mibiro kan kuom ndalo 27 nyaka ndalo 35 ibiro chulnegi USD40 ka en fut 20, to ka en fut 40 ibiro chulne USD80. Bang' mano joma kelo gikgi kowuok e pinje ma oko biro chulo siling 4,140 (USD45)  ka en kontena mar fut 20 to siling 8,280 (USD90) ka en kontena mar fut 40.

translation.en: Imports and committed export empty containers will enjoy a 15-day free storage period and thereafter will attract Sh1,380 (USD15) and Sh2,070 (USD22.5) for 20ft and 40ft respectively.
translation.luo: Kontena ma koro ni nono mowuok e pinje ma oko kod kontena mamoko mopwodh to koro ni nono ibiro kan nono kuom odiechienge 15. Bang' mano, kontena mar fut 20 ibiro chulne siling 1,380 (USD15) to fut 40 ibiro chulne siling 2,070 (USD22.5).

translation.en: Domestic motor vehicle will enjoy 15 days free storage period while transit and transhipment will enjoy 15 days and 30 day free storage period respectively.
translation.luo: Mtoka mokel Kenya ibiro kan nono kuom odiechienge 15 to mtokni mibiro riemb kadhi  kuonde mamoko ibiro kan nono kuom ndalo 15, to mtokni mibiro ket e meli mamoko mondo oter kamachielo ibiro kan nono kuom ndalo 30.

translation.en: KRA has installed both the Integrated Customs Management System (iCMS) and Simba Systems to ensure the 24-hour clearance.
translation.luo: KRA oseketo chenro mag  intanet miluongo ni Integrated Customs Management System (iCMS) kod Simba Systems mondo ochulne osike kendo  ogonygi gidhi kapok seche 24 okalo.

translation.en: KRA chairman Francis Muthaura said they will also give highly concessionary rate in a bid to attract business to the new facility.
translation.luo: Francis Muthaura ma en Jakom mar KRA wacho ni gibiro keto nengo maber ahinya mondo giywa ohendni obi e Pot ma  Lamu.

translation.en: He said paperless customs clearance will ensure the decision-making process is quick, transparent and simplified thereby reducing the time and cost of doing business.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni timo wechego e kompyuta ber nikech ibiro ng'ad weche mapiyo,  e yo manenore ayanga, maonge mibadhi kendo  mayot. Mano biro dwoko chien nengo kod kinde mar timo tijego.

translation.en: Lamu Port has officially opened for business after President Uhuru Kenyatta Thursday unveiled its first berth promising to launch two other berths before the end of this year.
translation.luo: Pot ma Lamu oseyaw mondo ochak tich bang' Ker  Uhuru Kenyatta yawo kama meli gowoe mokwong tiek, kendo wacho ni ibiro yaw kuonde ariyo mamoko kapok higani orumo.

translation.en: The transhipment port targets to link Kenya to South Sudan, Ethiopia and the middle belt of Africa.
translation.luo: Pot madwaro tiyo kaka kama meli madongo kelo osikegi kae to ilokogi e meli matindo mondo otergi kama gidwaroree, dwaro ni otud Kenya gi  South Sudan, Ethiopia gi alwora mar Nigeria man yo nyandwat.

translation.en: “I am hopeful that before the end of the year in October we will invite regional leaders and other stakeholders for the full launch of the port after completion of the second berth in July and the third berth in October,” said the President.
translation.luo: Ker Uhuru ne owacho ni “An gi geno ni kapok higani orumo, gimoro Oktoba kama, wabiro gwelo jotelo mag pinjego kod jo ohala mamoko mondo wayaw Pot mabiro yudo oserumo, nimar ibiro tiek kamachielo ma meli gowoe e dwe mar Julai kendo kamachielo Oktoba. Wabiro bedo gi kuonde adek ma Meli gowoe.

translation.en: “This project will open up opportunities in trade, tourism and create jobs not only in Lamu County but across the country,” he said.
translation.luo: “Projectni biro miyo ji thuolo mag timo ohala, obiro miyo welo mawuok e pinje mamoko obi oba Kenya, kendo obiro miyo ji mang'eny tije ok mana joma nie Kaunti ma Lamu to joma wuok e Kenya mangima.

translation.en: The President challenged the Lamu County government to be aggressive in looking for investors to provide facilities such as houses that would complement the project.
translation.luo: Ker ne onyiso sirkal ma Kaunti ma Lamu ni gitim kinda e manyo jo ohala manyalo gero gik moko kaka udi mondo gisir Pot migerono.

translation.en: He promised to improve the road network in the area.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni obiro loso nderni makanyo.

translation.en: The President expressed optimism that the new port will inspire Turkana Oil investors on State commitment to improving infrastructure.
translation.luo: Ker Uhuru ne owacho ni en gadier ni Pot manyien-no biro miyo  kembe madwaro ywayo  mo man Turkana obed gadier ni sirkal biro riwogi lwedo kuom loso nderni mana kaka gisesingo.

translation.en: The country’s second commercial port after Mombasa received its first ship on Thursday, a milestone for the corridor, which has ambitions of being a key gateway for eastern and central Africa.
translation.luo: Mombasa e Pot mokwongo mar Kenya mitimoe ohala, to Lamu  en Pot mar ariyo. Chieng' Tich Ang'wen, meli mokwongo ne ogowo Lamu kendo mano ne en okang' maduong' ne yo manyien moyaw  mar Lamu-South Sudan-Ethiopia madwaro sokore matut mondo oyaw  ochak tim ohala gi   pinje mag Eastern kod Central Africa.

translation.en: The corridor has a short term target of serving Ethiopia and South Sudan.
translation.luo: Gie sani chenrono dwaro ni  oyud ohala ma Ethiopia kod South Sudan.

translation.en: While there is optimism that the port will bring about the renewal of Lamu, there are concerns about the degree of connectivity between the county and the rest of the country.
translation.luo: Igeno ni yo manyien moyawno biro konyo Lamu gerore kendo. Kata kamano, ji wacho ni wuoth mawuok e Kaunti ma Lamu ka dhi e kaunti mamoko ok yot.

translation.en: The corridor itself is expected to have roads, rail and pipelines connecting the port to the hinterland, going as deep into the region as South Sudan and Addis Ababa.
translation.luo: Yo ma iyawono idwaro ni obed gi nderni mamoko matindo, ndach reru, kod paip mag mo machopo nyaka e chuny pinje mag  South Sudan kod Addis Ababa.

translation.en: “The Lapsset Corridor is primed to be the most competitive corridor in the region,” said Lapsset Authority in a statement, adding that currently there are options for businesses using Lamu Port to evacuate or bring cargo to the port.
translation.luo: Riwruok mar Lapsset Authority ne owacho niya: “ Lapsset Corridor idwaro ni obed ndara ma ohala berie moloyo e alworani.” Kae to ne omedo ni gie sani ohelni man Lamu Pot nyalo wuok kanyo kata ginyalo kelo osike e pot ma Lamu.

translation.en: It added that there are a number of critical roads that are currently being constructed, which will significantly improve access to the port.
translation.luo: Owacho ni gie sani, nitiere nderni madwarore ahinya migero, to ka girumo, gibiro konyo ji chopo e potno mayot.

translation.en: These are expected to lure businesses importing and exporting to and from South Sudan and Ethiopia.
translation.luo: Igeno ni ndernigi biro ywayo ohelni makelo gik moko kata magolo gik moko South Sudan kod Ethiopia.

translation.en: Currently, Lamu Port connects to Ethiopia through a 1,425km road – the Lamu-Garsen-Garissa-Kilimambogo-Isiolo-Moyale (Ethiopia border) route, of which 1,075km is paved, while the balance is under construction and expected to be complete in the course of this year.
translation.luo: Gie sani, ndara mar Lamu-Garsen-Garissa-Kilimambogo-Isiolo-Moyale (Ethiopia border) ma en kilomita 1,425 ema tudo Pot ma Lamu gi Ethiopia. Kilomita 1,075 mar ndarano oselos, gidhi nyime loso kuonde modong', kendo igeno ni obiro rumo higani.

translation.en: The authority said this journey would reduce to 832km once a number of roads such as the Lamu-Garissa road are completed.
translation.luo: Riwruokno wacho ni wuodhno biro bedo mana kilomita 832 bang' kosetiek nderni mamoko kaka mar Lamu-Garissa.

translation.en: It is also the case for South Sudan, which though Lamu offers a much shorter route compared to using Port Sudan, over 2,700km from Juba, a poor road network might hamper access to Lamu Port.
translation.luo: Obiro konyo South Sudan, nikech ka gitiyo gi yo ma Lamu wuoth bedo machuok kopimgi wuoth mawuok Port Sudan nyaka Juba ma en kilomita 2,700. Kata kamano, ndara nyaka bed maber mondo chopo Lamu Pot obed mayot.

translation.en: Parliament has backed Treasury’s plans to exempt Kenya Airways (KQ) from paying minimum tax in a move that offers a reprieve to the loss-making firm.
translation.luo: Od Piny Owacho oyie gi chenro mar Treasury mar gonyo Kenya Airways (KQ) kik chul osuru manyien miluongo ni  minimum tax mondo KQ mosebedo kadhi asara oyud kaka digikonyre.

translation.en: The tax became effective January this year and firms are required to pay it or normal corporate tax, whichever is higher and whether making profit or loss.
translation.luo: Ne ochak ng'ad osuruno Januar higani kendo ne onyis kembe mondo ochul osuruno kata gichul osuru mar kembe ma gisegabedo ka gichulo. Ne onyisgi ni gichul osuru mang'eny kuom osuru ariyogo, bed ni giloso ohala kata gidhi asara.

translation.en: The National Assembly’s Committee on Delegated Legislation attributed KQ’s exemption to the devastating effect that Covid-19 has had on the global aviation industry.
translation.luo: Komiti mar  National Assembly Committee on Delegated Legislation ne owacho ni KQ ok chul osuruno nikech masira mar Korona ne odwoko ohand ndege chien ahinya e piny mangima.

translation.en: This, they noted, hurt “the already ailing company that made a loss of Sh36.2 billion."
translation.luo: Giwacho ni wachno ne omedo hinyo riwruok ma noyudo ok dhi maber kendo ne oselalo bilion 36.2.

translation.en: The committee said “the minimum tax will render KQ’s operations unsustainable”.
translation.luo: Komitino ne owacho ni “minimum tax biro konyo KQ mondo odhi nyime tiyo.”

translation.en: In March this year, National Treasury Cabinet Secretary Ukur Yatani exempted the carrier from paying minimum tax, charged at one per cent minimum tax on revenues.
translation.luo: Mach higani, Ukur Yatani ma en Jatend Tij Sirkal e migawo mar  National Treasury ne owacho ni KQ ok bi chulo minimum tax ma en pasent achiel mar osuru mikawo e ohala ma kambi oloso.

translation.en: The notice was taken to parliament and referred to the Committee on Delegated Legislation, which has recommended that KQ be exempt from paying the tax.
translation.luo: Wachno ne oter e Od Bura Owacho kae to ne gitere ne Committee on Delegated Legislation, ma ne owacho ni KQ kik chul osuruno.

translation.en: “The Committee recommends that the House approves the said statutory instrument (regulations) in accordance with section 13(2) of the Income Tax Act,” said the report by the committee.
translation.luo: Ripot mar komitino ne owacho niya: “Komitino kwayo  Od Piny Owacho mondo oti kod chik namba 13(2) mar Income Tax Act kaka okwagi mondo gitim.”

translation.en: The report is among the issues that were up for consideration during the parliament’s special sitting yesterday.
translation.luo: Ripotno en achiel kuom weche ma ne Od Piny Owacho owuoyoe nyoro sama ne gitimo chokruok makende.

translation.en: The committee said it had considered the key role played by the carrier in supporting economic sectors such as “marketing of Kenya as a tourism destination, trade facilitation job creation among others”.
translation.luo: Komitino ne owacho ni ne giketo e  paro kaka KQ "omako kama duong' e yore mang'eny. Gisungo ne pinje ma oko kaka Kenya en piny maber bayoe, gikonyo ohelni moko mondo odhi nyime kendo gikonyo ji yudo tije.”

translation.en: “It is prudent to grant the exemption from minimum tax to support the firm continue its operations until its returns to profitability,” said the committee chaired by William Kassait.
translation.luo: William Kassait ma ne en jakom mar komitino ne owacho niya,  “En gima riek walo ne KQ osuruno mondo wasire nyaka chop kinde mobiro chako loso ohala kendo.”

translation.en: The Co-operative Bank of Kenya (Coop Bank) has posted a reduced profit of Sh3.46 billion in the first quarter of this year owing to the negative effects of the Covid-19 pandemic.
translation.luo: Bengi mar  Co-operative Bank of Kenya (Coop Bank) ogolo ripot manyiso ni ohalagi odok chien kendo giloso mana bilion 3.46 e dweche adek mokwongo mag higani nikech pek ma masira mar Korona okelo.

translation.en: This represents a drop of 3.6 per cent compared to a profit after tax of Sh3.59 billion that the lender made in the first three months of 2020.
translation.luo: Gidok chien gi pasent 3.6 kopim gi ohala mar bilion 3.59  ma ne giyudo e dweche adek mokwongo mag higa mar 2020.

translation.en: The lender put aside a big chunk of its revenue as insurance against possible defaults.
translation.luo: Bengino ne owalo tenge ohala mang'eny ma ne giyudo mondo obednegi insuarans manyalo rese ka ji ok ochulo lon maggi.

translation.en: “The group prudentially increased loan-loss provisions to Sh2.3 billion in the first quarter of 2021 in appreciation of the challenges that businesses and households continue to face due to the economic effects of the pandemic,” said Co-operative Bank Chief Executive Officer Gideon Muriuki.
translation.luo: Gideon Muriuki ma en achiel kuom jotelo mag bengino ne owacho niya; “Bengi notiyo girieko kendo e dweche adek mokwongo mag  2021, ne gimedo pesa miketoga tenge mondo oumne lon ma ok ochul, mi pesano ochopo bilion 2.3. Ne ging'eyo pek ma ohelni kod ji achiel achiel ne nyagorego nikech  chochni e yore mag yuto ma obedoe nikech masira mar Korona.”

translation.en: This even as Moody’s, a global rating agency, affirmed the listed lender’s B2 rating citing “solid capital levels.”
translation.luo: Ne gitimo kamano kata obedo ni riwruok mar Moody's, ma en riwruok manono kaka ohelni dhi e piny mangima ne oketo bengino e namba B2, kendo ne owacho ni bengino oritore maber gi pesa.”

translation.en: In the three months of this year, the lender recorded increased revenues from its lending activities with its net interest income growing by over a third from Sh7.5 billion to Sh9.8 billion.
translation.luo: E dweche adek mag higani, bengino nomedo ohala moyudo kowuok kuom holo ji pesa. Mano ne omedo ohala mane oyudo kuom pesa michulo e wi lon. Ohala ne omedore kowuok bilion 7.5 mochopo bilion 9.8 ma en medruok mar achiel e wi adek.

translation.en: The lender’s total revenue - interest and non-interest income - grew by 15 per cent to Sh14.4 billion from Sh12.5 billion, a sign that despite the ravages of the pandemic, a good number of the borrowers were able to service their loans.
translation.luo: Ohala ma ne bengino oyudo, moriwo ohala mowuok e pesa mochul e wi lon kod ohala mamoko ne omedore gi pasent 15 mochopo bilion 14.4 kowuok bilion 12.5. Mano nyiso ni kata obedo ni masira mar Korona ne ochando ji ahinya, ji mang'eny ne odhi nyime chulo lon maggi.

translation.en: Meta Electric General Manager Mr Brian Chege (R), showcases the electric charging car features for the T3 Van to Neo Kenya CEO Mr Douglas Kuria (L) during the launch of Kenya's first electric van held on April 29, 2021, at the Apex Business Park in Nairobi.
translation.luo: Mr Brian Chege (R) ma en Jatelo mar Meta Electric, nyiso Mr Douglas Kuria (L) ma en jatelo mar Neo Kenya, kuonde mopogore opogore e mtoka mar stima miluongo ni T3 Van. Ne otimo kamano April tarik 29, 2021 kane ipwodho mtoka mokwongo mar Kenya maringo kod stima. Ne gin Apex Business Park, Nairobi.

translation.en: It is getting increasingly clear that the future of the automobile industry is in electric vehicles - at least before flying cars take over.
translation.luo: Nenore maler ni mtokni ma kinde mabiro biro bedo mag stima kendo mtoknigo ema biro kelo ne kembe maloso mtokni ohala, to mana kapok ochak los mtokni mafuyo!

translation.en: Countries such as the United Kingdom are already in the race to get rid of petrol and diesel-powered cars by 2030 to reduce pollution levels.
translation.luo: Pinje kaka United Kingdom timo kinda mondo higa mar 2030 oyud ka ok giriemb mtokni matiyo gi petrol kata disel. Gidwaro dwoko chien chilo manie kor yamo.

translation.en: Such moves by big economies leave Kenya helpless in the decision to go electric, yet the adoption of electric vehicles is dragging.
translation.luo: Ka pinje madongo  kawo okang' kaka mano, Kenya bende nyaka luw aluwa ranyisigi. Kata kamano, Kenya yware ahinya e wach chako tiyo gi mtokni mag stima.

translation.en: “It is a chicken and egg situation where for us to have infrastructure on charging electric cars, we have to have vehicles on the road; and for us to have vehicles on the road we need to have infrastructure around charging,” says Brian Chege, general manager of Meta Electric, a machinery dealership.
translation.luo: Brian Chege ma en jatelo mar  Meta Electric, ma en kambi ma uso masinde, wacho niya.“Wan kama tek. Mondo wabed gi gik madwarore mondo mtokni stima oringi, nyaka wakwong bedo gi mtoknigo, to mondo wabed gi mtoknigo, nyaka wakwong bedo gi gik madwarore mondo giring."

translation.en: Meta Electric is one of the firms seeking to speed up adoption of electric vehicles. The firm in November last year imported two BYD T3 electric vans, one which has been leased to transport company Neo Kenya Mpya to be used for parcel delivery.
translation.luo: Meta Electric en achiel kuom kembe madwaro konyo e miyo mtokni mag stima ochak ringo Kenya mapiyopiyo. Novemba higa mokalo kambino nokelo mtokni ariyo mag stima miluongo ni BYD T3. Kambi mar Neo Kenya Mpya ochulo ne mtoka achiel mondo gitigo e ting'o osigo kuom kinde.

translation.en: “The main purpose of the venture is to help businesses save money by reducing their operating costs through replacing their petrol or diesel vehicles with electric,” said Mr Chege.
translation.luo: Mr Chege wacho niya: “Gima duong' ma wadwaro timo en konyo jo ohala mondo odwok piny pesa ma gitiyogo e mtokni. Wadwaro ni gichak tiyo gi mtokni maringo gi stima kar tiyo gi maringo gi petrol kata disel.

translation.en: “We are looking at trucks, buses, public service vehicle buses, matatus and in the near future we hope to replace all of Nairobi vehicles with electric ones.”
translation.luo: “Wadwaro uso loche, bus, mtokni ma ting'o jowuoth, kod matatu, to machiegnini dwaher ni mtokni duto maringo Nairobi obed mag stima.”

translation.en: Chege said there is a substantial interest from businesses to adopt electric vehicles, especially from firms dealing with fast-moving consumer goods.
translation.luo: Chege wacho ni jo ohala mogwaro diher chako tiyo gi mtokni mag stima, to moloyo kembe ma uso gik ma usre mapiyo piyo.

translation.en: “If you are able to give a solution that is 80 per cent cheaper, and runs on clean energy and also helps sustain the environment it is definitely a win-win for us,” he said.
translation.luo: Omedo niya: “Wan- gadier ni ohandwani biro dhi maber nikech nengo mar riembo mtoka mar stima kopim gi nengo mar riembo mtokni mamoko en piny gi pasent 80, stima ler kendo miyo alwora siko kaler.”

translation.en: The low maintenance and operating cost is the key selling point of electric automobiles, whether motorcycles or vehicles.
translation.luo: Nikech nengo mar rito kata tiyo gi mtokni kata pikipiki mag stima ni piny, usogi ok tek.

translation.en: For example, Chege says for every 100 kilometres an electric vehicle will cost Sh300 while one running on petrol or diesel will dent the pocket by Sh1,400.
translation.luo: Kuom ranyisi, Chege wacho ni mtoka mar stima kawo siling 300 mondo oring kilomita 100, to mtoka maringo gi petrol to kawo siling 1400.

translation.en: Electric motorcycles cut the cost by 90 per cent compared to the conventional ones, according to Ecobodaa Chief Executive Victor Kimosop.
translation.luo: Victor Kimosop ma en Jatelo mar Ecobodaa wacho ni pikipiki maringo gi stima dwoko nengo chien gi pasent 90.

translation.en: It costs between Sh1,500 and Sh3,000 to service a petrol bike, which is done every two weeks, he said.
translation.luo: Owacho ni inonoga kendo ilosoga gik mokethore (timo savis) e pikipiki mar petrol bang' jumbe ariyo ka jumbe ariyo, kendo ng'ato chulo kind siling 1,500 gi  3,000.

translation.en: “We realised compared to petrol-powered bikes, we save 30 per cent daily on fuel and up to 90 per cent in three months for services,” said Mr Kimosop.
translation.luo: Mr Kimosop wacho niya: “Wasefwenyo ni kopim gi pikipik mag stima, wakungo pasent 30 mar nengo petrol kod pasent 90 e savis mitimo bang' dweche adek."

translation.en: Ecobodaa was started in March 2020 and has been monitoring the reception of the bikes in preparation for commercial launch this year.
translation.luo: Ne ochak kambi mar Ecobodaa Mach  2020. Gisebedo ka ginono kaka ji rwako pikipiki mar stima, kapok gichako usogi higani.

translation.en: Kimosop said they target a business partnership with Kibera Bodaboda Association and an unnamed transport firm on food delivery.
translation.luo: Kimosop wacho ni gidwaro riwore gi Kibera Bodaboda Association kod kambi moro materoga chiemo, to ok ne ohulo nying kambino.

translation.en: The lithium ion battery fitted in the bike has a range of 60 to 75 kilometres on full charge while the battery in the T3 BYD electric van can run between 250 and 300 kilometres.
translation.luo: Betri mar lithium ion moket e pikipikino nyalo ringo e kind kilomita 60 gi 75 ka osechaje mopong' to betri mar T3 BYD moket e mtoka mar stima to nyalo ringo kind kilomita 250 gi 300.

translation.en: This short range is the downside that could make potential buyers get cold feet.
translation.luo: Nikech ginyalo mana ringo kilomita matin kamano kapok ochajgi kendo mano miyo ji oluor ng'iewogi.

translation.en: Once the battery is depleted it has to be recharged, which takes longer compared to the about five-minute stop at the petrol station.
translation.luo: Ka betrino orumo nyaka chaje kendo, to timo kamano nyalo kawo seche, ok ochal gi dakika abich ma ng'ato nyalo kawo e stesen mar petrol.

translation.en: The least time one can take to charge the T3 BYD van is one-and-a-half hours using direct current (DC) but eight hours using alternating current (AC). For a business, eight hours is a whole day, which may limit the profit one can make.
translation.luo: Ka tin ahinya, chajo mtoka maT3 BYD nyalo kawo saa achiel gi nus to mano ka ng'ato otiyo gi stima miketoga e betri, direct current (DC) to okawo seche aboro ka ng'ato otiyo gi stima ma itiyogo e weche mapile alternating current (AC).

translation.en: Chege said if one chooses to use DC, a converter is needed to adjust voltage level from AC current to DC. This costs about Sh100,000.
translation.luo: Chege wacho ni ka ng'ato dwaro tiyo gi DC, nyaka ong'iew converter mabiro lokone karomb stima mar AC mondo obed mar DC. Nengo converter en gimoro siling 100,000.

translation.en: These dynamics raise the question on how the vehicles will be used not only for carrying consumer goods but also in large sectors such as matatus.
translation.luo: Wechegi miyo ji paro nyadiriyo ka be mtoknigi nyalo tiyo ok mana e ting'o mwandu, to e okenge malach kaka e ohand matatu.

translation.en: Kimosop said this has already been addressed through battery swapping, considering this is the most expensive part of the bike.
translation.luo: Kimosop wacho ni giseyudo yo mar loyo pekno. Gin gi chenro mar loko betri ne jo pikipiki nimar betri e gima nengone duong'ie moloyo e pikipiki.

translation.en: “The biker pays a fee and we exchange his battery for a fully-charged one. It takes five hours to charge,” he said.
translation.luo: Ne owacho niya: “Wuon pikipiki chulo pesa moro kae to wamiye betri mopong'. Chajo betri kawo seche abich.”

translation.en: “The battery is the most expensive part of the bike and we do not want to give the biker the headache of replacing it every three years as this costs Sh70,000.”
translation.luo: “Betri ema nengone ng'enyie moloyo e pikipikino, en siling 70,000, to ok wadwar miyo wuon pikipiki wich bar mar ng'iewo betri manyien bang' higni adek ka higni adek, nimar mano pesa mang'eny.”

translation.en: Neo Kenya Mpya CEO Douglas Kuria is optimistic that they will adopt electric buses, but he is not going “all money in” at the moment.
translation.luo: Douglas Kuria ma en Jatelo mar Neo Kenya Mpya wacho ni en gadier ni gibiro chako ting'o ji gi bas mag stima, kata kamano owacho ni gie sani, ok gibi chuno ni nyaka giyud ohala mang'eny.

translation.en: He says the reason behind using the BYD T3 van is not necessarily to maximise profits but to get knowledge on how electric vehicles work.
translation.luo: Owacho ni gie sani, gimomiyo gidwaro tiyo gi mtoka mar  BYD T3 ok en ni mondo giyud ohala mang'eny. Gidwaro mana ng'eyo kaka mtokni mag stima ringo.

translation.en: Neo Kenya Mpya manages over 170 matatus plying Nairobi, Machakos and Kiambu counties, and also has courier services.
translation.luo: Neo Kenya Mpya ochung'ne matatu mokalo 170 maringo  e kaunti mag Nairobi, Machakos kod Kiambu. Gin nyaka gi mtokni makowo osike.

translation.en: “We are starting with this vehicle for courier services. We want to have electric buses too, so this is for us to have the knowledge and gain experience,” Mr Kuria said.
translation.luo: Mr Kuria ne owacho niya “Wachako gi mtoka mating'o osike. Wadwaro ni wabed gi bas mag stima. Omiyo mtoka ma wakawoni biro konyowa ng'eyo kaka mtoknigi mag stima maber kendo lony kodgi.

translation.en: “We feel towards 2024 we need to have partnerships like this towards what we want to achieve.”
translation.luo: “Waneno ni kaka wachomo higa mar 2024, wadwaro ni wariwre gi kembe ma kamagi mondo  ohandwa ochop kama wadwaro.”

translation.en: He, however, would not say when the company will go fully electric.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ne ok owacho ni en karang'o ma mtoknigi duto biro bedo mag stima.

translation.en: “Even the first world countries have not really fully replaced theirs (for electric), that is why we have a research and improvement arm, ‘Transport for Tomorrow’ purposed to drive our logistics to a different level.”
translation.luo: “Kata mana pinje mosetimo dongruok mang'eny pok oloko mtoknigi duto mondo obed mag stima, mano  emomiyo wan gi migawo mar 'Transport for Tomorrow' matimo nonro kendo manyo yore mag bero mtokni. Migawono biro konyo chenrowa mondo odhi maber.”

translation.en: Kuria said the idea of converting their buses to electric is also not viable.
translation.luo: Kuria ne owacho ni ok ginyal loko base mondo obed mag stima.

translation.en: “When it comes to technology we do not want to have a barrier on what it (technology) can do, but we believe the best way around it is to have a new bus that is fully electric rather than a conversion,” he said.
translation.luo: “Kodok korka wach teknoloji, wang'eyo ni teknoloji nyalo timo gik mang'eny. Kata kamano, waneno ni ber moloyo ka wang'iewo bas manyien molos mana mondo otigi stima, kar loko bas machielo mondo obed mar stima.

translation.en: Electric motoring has been on Kenyan roads for some years now, though in the form of hybrid cars.
translation.luo: Mtokni matiyo gi stima oseringo Kenya kuom higni, en mana ni gin mtokni matiyo gi stima kod petro kata disel.

translation.en: A hybrid car is powered by both fuel and electricity. It is fitted with an electric motor and an internal combustion engine for diesel and petrol use.
translation.luo: Mtoknigo tiyo gi petrol kod stima. Gin kod mota kata masin maringo gi stima kod injin mar disel kata petrol.

translation.en: These two work together interchangeably depending on how much power the car needs at the time.
translation.luo: Gik moko ariyogi tiyo kanyachiel. Giwilore kaluwore gi teko ma  mtoka dwaro.

translation.en: But in an electric car, the vehicle is fully powered by electric motors.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, mtoka mar stima nigi mota mag stima kende.

translation.en: The recent bilateral talks between President Uhuru Kenyatta and his Tanzanian Counterpart Suluhu Hassan that eased cross border maize trade has seen a drastic drop in the produce prices.
translation.luo: Mbaka ma nyocha obedoe e kind Ker Uhuru Kenyatta kod Ker wadgi ma Tanzania Suluhu Hassan ne omiyo kalo gi bando e boda ma Tanzania gi Kenya obedo mayot, kendo mano osemiyo nengo bando odok piny ahinya.

translation.en: Farmers in North Rift region claimed yesterday that there is an influx of maize grains from the Eastern Africa Community region that had seen a reduction in prices from Sh2,800 per 90 kg bag last month to Sh2,300 currently.
translation.luo: Jopur ma North Rift nyoro owacho ni bando osedonjo mang'eny kowuok e  alwora mar Eastern Africa Community kendo mano omiyo nengo gunia achiel mar bando ma en kilo 90  olwar kowuok siling 2800 dwe mokalo mochopo siling 2300  gie sani.

translation.en: The cereals producers who held a meeting in Eldoret now want the Government to consider increasing allocations to Agriculture ahead of the National budgetary estimates expected to be jointly released next month in within the EAC member states.
translation.luo: Jopur mag cham ma ne obedo gi chokruok Eldoret koro dwaro ni Sirkal omed pesa mowalone migawo mar Pur kapok osom Bajet mar Kenya dwe mabiro. Ibiro som bajetno e kinde achiel gi mag pinje man e EAC.

translation.en: They want the sector to be allocated at least 10 per cent of the national budget saying the gesture, would create an equal level playing ground in agribusiness within EAC member countries.
translation.luo: Gidwaro ni ka tin, omi Migawo mar Pur pasent 10 mar pes bajet mar piny. Giwacho ni ka otim kamano, ginyalo timo ohand pur maber kaachiel gi pinje mamoko man e riwruok mar EAC.

translation.en: Farmers representatives including Uasin Gishu large scale farmers Thomas Korgoren, Barnabas Kibos, Kimutai Kolum and Kenya Farmers Association Director Kipkorir Menjo said an improved allocation to agriculture would assist address high cost of inputs, ease taxation of farm implements and machinery hence lowering operational costs.
translation.luo: Joma ochung' ne jopur moriwo jopur madongo ma Uasin Gishu,Thomas Korgoren, Barnabas Kibos, Kimutai Kolum kod Kipkorir Menjo ma en Jatelo mar Kenya Farmers Association  ne owacho ni ka omed pes migawo mar Pur, mano nyalo konyogi e ng'iewo gik mitiyogo e pur, mano nyalo dwoko piny osuru mar masinde mitiyogo e pur, kendo mano biro dwoko chien pesa ma gitiyogo e pur.

translation.en: They said high agricultural production costs in the country was disadvantaging farmers from achieving good returns compared to their counterparts in the region who sell produce at lower prices.
translation.luo: Ne giwacho ni nikech gitiyo gi pesa mang'eny e pur, mano miyo ok giyud ohala maber kopim gi ohala ma jopur e pinje ma EAC yudo, nimar jopurgo tiyo gi pesa matin e pur.

translation.en: The farmers said producing a 90 kg bag of maize in Kenya costs on average Sh2,800 hence by selling at Sh2,300 in the market amounts to a loss and that most farmers had been discouraged from venturing into agri-business.
translation.luo: Jopurgo wacho ni mondo giyud gunia achiel mar kilo 90 gitiyo kod gimoro siling 2,800 omiyo uso bando siling 2,300 miyo gidhi asara. Omiyo ng'eny jopur chunygi otho kendo ok gidwar timo ohand pur.

translation.en: “We have realised challenges in the agriculture sector due to underfunding in the National budget estimates. The cost of fuel, fertiliser, transport have gone up while taxes are still high. We urge the Government to consider increasing the budget for agriculture and also zero-rate taxes for inputs,” said Menjo.
translation.luo: Menjo ne owacho niya: “Waseyudo pek e weche pur nikech imiyo migawo mar Pur pesa matin e bajet mar Piny. Nengo petrol, manyiwa, kod wuoth oseidho, kendo osuru pod ni malo. Wakwayo Sirkal mondo omed pesa mar Pur kendo gine ni ok ket osuru kuom gige pur sama ing'iewogi.”

translation.en: He added: “The Government should create a conducive environment to enable local farmers to be competitive and reap from cross border trade that was recently harmonised by President Uhuru and Suluhu.”
translation.luo: Ne omedo niya: “Sirkal onego okony jo pur mondo gin bende gikonyre gi ohala matimore e kind pinje ma wagoyogo tong' , ohala ma nyocha Ker Uhuru kod Ker Suluhu owinjoree.”

translation.en: Kolum urged MPs in agricultural regions to press for additional allocations to the Agriculture ministry to ease high cost of inputs.
translation.luo: Kolum ne onyiso Jobunge ma ochung'ne alwora mipuroe e okang' malach mondo gitim kinda e kwayo sirkal mondo omed pesa mimiyo migawo mar Pur mondo okonygi nyagore gi nengo mamalo mar gige pur.

translation.en: Comarco Tag boat towing barge carrying two Rubber Tyred Gantley cranes under Kenya Revenue Authority mobile scanner spotted at the Likoni Ferry Channel on Monday, 17 May 2021, while leaving the port of Mombasa to the port of Lamu.
translation.luo: Yie maywayo gik moko molos gi jo Comarco, ywayo crane  ariyo (gik mitiyogo kuonde gedo mondo otergo gik moko kaka simit e gorofa mamalo). Gin crane molos gi kambi miluongo ni Rubber Tyred Gantley.  Kenya Revenue Authority luwre gi wuodhgi e yor intanet mar simu. Ne one yieno Wuok Tich tarik 17, 2021 ka owuok e Pot ma Mombasa kendo odhi e Pot ma Lamu.

translation.en: The towing tag will be cruising at a speed of 5 to 6 knots and is expected to arrive on Tuesday early afternoon. President Uhuru Kenyatta will commission the new Lamu Port on 20th May 2021.
translation.luo: Yieno biro dhi e ng'wech mar kind knots 5 kod 6. Onego ochop Lamu Tich Ariyo godiechieng'. Ker Uhuru Kenyatta biro yawo Pot manyien ma Lamu Mei tarik 20, 2021.

translation.en: Lamu Port starts operations  with the arrival of two vessels - Mv Cap Carmel and Mv Seago Bremerhavel.
translation.luo: Pot ma Lamu ochako tich gi Meli ariyo ma odonjo, iluongo gi ni, Mv Cap Carmel kod Mv Seago Bremerhavel.

translation.en: Both ships will arrive from Mombasa and Dar-es-Salaam ports and dock at the new harbour today (Thursday).
translation.luo: Meli ariyogo biro chopo kowuok e pot mag Mombasa kod Dar-es-Salaam, kendo gibiro gowo e Pot manyienno kawuono, Tich Ang'wen.

translation.en: President Uhuru Kenyatta will lead government officials and players in the maritime industry in commissioning the first berth as minimal operations start.
translation.luo: Ker Uhuru Kenyatta biro telone jotend sirkal kod joma moko manie ohala mar nam e yawo kidieny achiel mosetiek mar kama yie gowoe. Potno biro chako gi tich matin.

translation.en: This signals the start of commercial activity at the Lamu Port, known for its deep and long berths that can accommodate big ships.
translation.luo: Mano nyiso ni ohala dwaro chakore e Pot ma Lamu , dho wath tut kendo olandore omiyo meli madongo nyalo gowo kuno.

translation.en: The port has opened up a whole new transport corridor.
translation.luo: Potno oyawo alwora manyien mar  timo ohala.

translation.en: The two vessels, owned and operated by Maersk Shipping and Logistics, the world’s largest shipping line, will be carrying avocados and an assortment of goods.
translation.luo: Meli ariyogo biro ting'o abokado ko mwandu mamoko. Gin meli mag kambi mar  Maersk Shipping and Logistics ma en riwruok maduong' moloyo mar meli, kendo kambino ema ochung'negi.

translation.en: Tucked in the Manda Bay area, Lamu port is part of the ambitious Lamu South Sudan Ethiopia Transport (Lapsset) corridor.
translation.luo: Pot ma Lamu ni e alwora miluongo ni Manda Bay. En achiel kuom gik midwaro ni osir ohala maduong' mitudo gi chenro matudo Lamu South Sudan Ethiopia Transport (Lapsset) corridor.

translation.en: It is expected to transform regional economies through increased trade and regional inter-connectivity spanning South Sudan and landlocked Ethiopia.
translation.luo: Igeno ni obiro kelo dongruok maduong' e pinje mokwako kuom timo ohala momedore kendo medo tudruok mawuok South Sudan nyaka Ethiopia ma en piny ma ok otudre gi Indian Ocean.

translation.en: Captain Godfrey Namadoa, Kenya Ports Authority (KPA) senior marine pilot who has been overseeing shipment of cargo-handling equipment from the Port of Mombasa to Lamu, is upbeat about the project.
translation.luo: Kapten Godfrey Namadoa, ma tiyo gi Kenya Ports Authority (KPA) kendo en jariemb meli molony mosebedo ka ochung'ne osike mawuok e Pot ma Mombasa kitero Lamu, mor gi gedo mar Pot ma Lamu.

translation.en: “It is a port expected to grow transshipment cargo owing to its capacity to handle bigger vessels that can drop cargo there for redistribution by smaller ships to ports around the region such as Mombasa and Dar-es-Salaam,” he said.
translation.luo: Ne owacho niya: “Potni biro kelo dongruok e ohala ma meli madongo loko osikegi mondo meli matindo oter kuonde mopogore opogore kaka  Mombasa kod Dar-es-Salaam.”

translation.en: “Already established global transshipment and maritime hubs such as  the Port of Salalah  in Oman and the  Port of Durban in South Africa have taken interest in Lamu.’’
translation.luo: “Pot mamoko ma ohandgi oselandore e piny mangima kendo osegurore e ohalani kaka Pot ma Salalah man Oman kod Pot ma Durban man  South Africa osewacho ni digiher timo ohala gi Pot ma Lamu.’’

translation.en: The port’s berths are 400 metres long and are designed to handle 30,000 Deadweight Tonnage (DWT) for general cargo and 100,000 DWT of container cargo.
translation.luo: Moro ka moro kuom kuonde molos mondo meli ogowie nigi bor mar mita  400, kendo nyalo ting'o meli mar osike en 30,000 Deadweight Tonnage (DWT) kata  meli moting'o kontena ma pekne en 100,000 DWT.

translation.en: This compares to Mombasa Port whose berths are less than 350 metres long and 15 metres deep. Big ships cannot pass through the Mombasa shipping channel.
translation.luo: Kuonde ma meli gowoe e Pot ma Mombasa nigi bor mar mita 350 kendo tutgi en mita 15. Meli madongo ok nyal kalo e pige ma Mombasa.

translation.en: Once complete, the port will have 32 berths.
translation.luo: Potno ka orumo obiro bedo gi kuonde 32 ma meli gowoe.

translation.en: It will be the largest in sub-Saharan Africa.
translation.luo: Obiro bedo Pot maduong'ie moloyo e sub-Saharan Africa.

translation.en: Already a number of firms in the maritime industry have indicated their readiness to move to Lamu.
translation.luo: Gie sani, kembe mang'eny matimo ohala mar Nam  osewacho ni digiher daro ohandgi kendo kelogo Lamu.

translation.en: Skyline Shipping and Logistics Company is one of the firms intending to set up base.
translation.luo: Skyline Shipping and Logistics Company en achiel kuom kembe madwaro tiyo Lamu.

translation.en: Toyota Kenya has already built showrooms along the road to the new port.
translation.luo: Toyota Kenya osegero duke mag mtokni e ndara madhi e pot manyienno.

translation.en: Mombasa’s Premier Hospital is opening a branch in Lamu Island.
translation.luo: Mombasa’s Premier Hospital bende yawo osiptal machielo e chula mar Lamu.

translation.en: The offices of the governor and county commissioner have been moved from Lamu Island to Mokowe.
translation.luo: Ofise mag Gavana kod komisona bende osegol Lamu Island moter Mokowe.

translation.en: Solomon Wao, the Skyline Shipping and Logistics managing director, said Lamu Port is the new investment hub and the company is eager to start operations there.
translation.luo: Solomon Wao ma en Jatelo e kambi mar  Skyline Shipping and Logistics ne owacho ni Pot ma Lamu en kama ohala biro dhi maber kendo kambigi dwaro tero ohalagi kuno.

translation.en: The Kenya Ships Agents Association (KSAA) said the port will complement Mombasa Port.
translation.luo: Riwruok mar  Kenya Ships Agents Association (KSAA) ne owacho ni pot manyienno biro siro Pot ma Mombasa.

translation.en: Vice chair Sylvester Kututa said the port will open up Northern Kenya.
translation.luo: Sylvester Kututa ma en Jalup Jakom ne owacho ni potno biro yawo alwora man yo Nyandwat ma Kenya.

translation.en: Lamu Port aims to serve Kenya, Ethiopia and South Sudan.
translation.luo: Pot ma Lamu dwaro tiyone Kenya, Ethiopia kod South Sudan.

translation.en: The number of super-rich individuals in Kenya is one of the fastest-growing in the world.
translation.luo: Kwan mar joma omew mokalo awacha e piny Kenya medore e okang' mamalo ahinya kopim kod kwan mag pinje mamoko e piny ngima.

translation.en: These are the people who have created remarkable successful businesses or had lucrative careers and investments.
translation.luo: Magi gin joma ohendnigi kata tijegi osedhi maber ahinya.

translation.en: It is predicted that the number of millionaires will grow by 80 per cent over the next 10 years, with 7,500 new millionaires set to be created.
translation.luo: Iwachoni kwan joma nigi milionde biro medore gi pasent 80 e higni apar mabiro. Iwacho ni ji 7500 biro bedo joma nigi milionde.

translation.en: While many factors play a role in the making of a successful business person, learning some of the secrets of successful CEOs locally and internationally, will lift the trajectory of your career and speed your progress in business:
translation.luo: En adier ni nitie gik mang'eny mamiyo ng'ato dhi maber e ohala, kata kamano, ng'eyo weche ma osekonyo joma kamago e piny Kenya kata e pinje ma oko nyalo konyi dhi maber mapiyo piyo e tiji kata e ohandi:

translation.en: “Television is not real life. In real life, people actually have to leave the coffee shop and go to jobs.” - Bill Gates
translation.luo: Bill Gates wacho niya: “Ngima ok dhiga kaka inyisoga e televison. E ngima mapile, ji nyaka dhi e tich, ok gisik e otende mag kahawa.”

translation.en: What we watch on television or social media make entrepreneurship look like an easy and exciting journey.
translation.luo: Gik ma waneno e televison kata e intanet miyo ji paro ni chako ohala en gima yot, ni ochalo wuoth moro mar bayo.

translation.en: Don’t get caught up in the narrative around self-employment.
translation.luo: Kik ng'ato wuondi ni tich mindokorie kendi yot.

translation.en: It’s going to take a lot of discipline to make your dreams a reality.
translation.luo: Mondo ichop kama idwaro, nyaka itim kinda kendo ituonri gik mang'eny.

translation.en: “Work like there is someone working 24 hours a day to take it all away from you.”- Mark Cuban
translation.luo: Mark Cuban wacho niya: “Ti ka gima nitie ng'at malawre kodi, ng'at matiyo seche 24, kendo odwaro mayi tiji.

translation.en: Billionaire Mark Cuban is the owner of Dallas Mavericks.
translation.luo: Mark Cuban, jal ma nigi bilionde e wuon  Dallas Mavericks.

translation.en: Yet he still wakes up early and stays up late working.
translation.luo: To ema podi omondo chiew mondo oti kendo odhi nindo molewo nikech tich.

translation.en: We are constantly told not to compare ourselves with others or to only be in competition with ourselves.
translation.luo: Inyisowaga ding'eny ni kik wapimre gi jomamoko  kata ni kik wapiem gi jomoko, to watim mana ma wanyalo.

translation.en: In reality, it is easier said than done. Cuban offers this hack, because if your success could be taken by someone else, wouldn’t you double down to earn what’s yours and protect everything you’ve worked so hard for?
translation.luo: Adiera en ni, mano en gima yot wacho, to otek timo. Cuban chiwo paroni, 'ka ing'eyo ni gima isetiyone matek inyalo kaw gi ng'at machielo, donge ibiro timo kinda ahinya mondo kik mayi luchi?'

translation.en: That is the mogul’s answer to what makes for a successful business.
translation.luo: Mano e gima jamwanduno wacho ni miyo ng'ato dhi maber e ohala.

translation.en: This is not about selflessness but self-discovery.
translation.luo: Ok en mana  ni ichiwori achiwa chuth ne tich, en ni ifwenyo gima in gadier.

translation.en: When Oprah asserted that she’d “only do shows that were in alignment with [her] truth,” she became truly successful.
translation.luo: Kane Oprah ong'ado ni mbaka mobiro bedogo e programne mar televison biro mana  “bedo gi mbaka mowinjore gi adiera mochung'ne,” tije ne odhi maber ahinya.

translation.en: She references best-selling author Gary Zukav, who believes that you have to be aware of what you’re good at and what you’re therefore meant to do.
translation.luo: Owacho gima Gary Zukav nowacho, Gary en jandiko ma rahuma. Owacho ni nyaka ifweny gima iberie, tich mowinjore kodi.

translation.en: That’s what you’re in service of.
translation.luo: Mano e tich monego itim.

translation.en: “Don’t bother to have a plan at all. All that stuff about planning -- throw that out.”- Eric Schmidt, former CEO and current executive chairman of Google
translation.luo: Eric Schmidt  ma en Jakom mar Google wacho niya:  “We chandori giloso chenro. Weche mang'eny ma ji wacho e wi bedo gi chenro gin manono. Werigo!"

translation.en: “It seems to me that it’s all about opportunity and making your own luck. You study the most successful people, and they work hard and they take advantage of opportunities that come that they don’t know are going to happen to them. You cannot plan innovation, you cannot plan invention. All you can do is try very hard to be in the right place and be ready,” he says.
translation.luo: Owacho niya: “An aneno ni gima timore, en  ni ng'ato neno thuolo mar timo gimoro kae to otimo atima gino. Ka inono joma ohelnigi osedhi maber ahinya ifwenyo ni gitiyo matek, to ka gineno thuolo mar timo gimoro, gitiyo gi thuolono kata obedo ni thoulono ne opoyogi apoya. Nitie thuolo mag loso gik moko masieko asieka kendgi, ok dichan mondo gibi. Gima itimo en mana tiyo matek ahinya ma ka thuolono oneno, to yudo ka in kama owinjore kendo iikori.”

translation.en: “Focus. Do your work as if it is your last because word of mouth referrals are powerful.”- Emmanuel Jambo, photographer.
translation.luo: Emmanuel Jambo, ma en jago picha wacho niya.“Ket chunyi gi pachi e gima itimo. Ti gi chunyi duto  ka gima mano e tiji mogik, nimar ka ng'ato mor gi tiji, onyalo oro ng'at machielo iri, to   mano konyo ohandi ahinya.”

translation.en: Try to constantly reinvent yourself.
translation.luo: Sik kipuonjori yore manyien mag medo bero tiji.

translation.en: “Things change and as such, it is critical to constantly evolve, keep up with new trends, in my case with style and fashion. By focusing on your craft, you could be keeping revenue flowing, and be more productive with your time,” he says.
translation.luo: Owacho niya: “Piny dhi ka lokore, to nikech nyaka in be isik ka ilokori, ng'e gik manyasani. Kuom ranyisi an nyaka ang'e fason  manyasani. Ka iketo chunyi e tiji mano nyalo miyo isik kiyudo ohala kendo ibiro tiyo maber gi secheni."

translation.en: “Draw a vision board and next to it a process map.”- Caroline Kinoti, fashion designer
translation.luo: Caroline Kinoti ma en jalos fason manyien wacho niya: “Gor picha moting'o gik ma diher bedogo kata timo, kae to e bathe gor map manyiso okenge mibiro kawo mondo iyud kata itim gigo."

translation.en: In every decision you make on how you spend your time and resources, keep checking whether you are still on the right path.
translation.luo: Sama ing'ado paro moro amora e wi kaka ibiro tiyo gi secheni kata mwanduni, ne ni ok ichocho chenro miseketo monego oteri kama idwaro chopoe.

translation.en: If you do this, you will remain unstoppable.
translation.luo: Ka ikawo okengegi, onge gima ok inyal timo.

translation.en: “Remember to keep it simple for example, I use sticky notes, write it in my own way and paste them on my dressing mirror. This way I see them every morning. When I accomplish one, I pull it out,” she says.
translation.luo: Caroline medo niya: “Ne ni iketo chenroni mayot, kuom ranyisi, andikoga gik madwaro timo e otese matindo tindo kae to abawogi e kio man e oda mang'iyoragae pile. Mano miyo anenogi gokinyi ka gokinyi. Ka achopo gimoro, to agolo otasno e kio."

translation.en: Create a realistic and achievable vision for your business, one that translates into actual growth.
translation.luo: Chan mar timo mana gik ma nyalore kaluwore gi ohandi, tim mana gik makelo dongruok madier ne ohandi.

translation.en: “Whatever ideas give you sleepless nights is something you need to do.” TerryAnne Chebet, entrepreneur
translation.luo: TerryAnne Chebet, matiyo tije owuon wacho niya: “Gimoro amora ma osiko e pachi kendo tami nindo, en gima onego itim.”

translation.en: My idea for Keyara Botanicals began as a dream but I would wake up in the middle of the night with ideas on how I wanted the product to look, what names I was considering for my products, or what solutions I wanted to create for skincare issues.
translation.luo: Ohanda mar Keyara Botanicals ne en mana gima aparo apara, kata kamano, ne anyaloga chiew dier oduor kaparo kaka daher mondo gik ma alosogo ochal, nyinge ma ne adwaro miyogi kata kaka ne anyalo loso gima tieko chandruok moko ma ji bedogo e pien dendgi.

translation.en: “Until today, everything I give my time to, whether consulting in communications, public relations or moderating a gig, these are things that I am passionate about, and I do with excellence, because I enjoy them,” she says.
translation.luo: Owacho niya: “Nyaka chil kawuono, gimoro amora ma akawo thuolona timo, aketoe chunya duto, atime e yo maber chuth nikech amorgo, bed ni adwoko penjo moko ma ipenja, awuoyo e wi gik makonyo ohanda, kata achung' ne thum moro.”

translation.en: Did you know that only half of new businesses survive for the first five years? That’s grim, right?
translation.luo: Be ne ing'eyo ni mana nus mar ohendni duto manyien mochak sikoga kuom higni abich? Donge mano gima lit?

translation.en: The statistics might be even worse - a Bloomberg research found out that of every 10 businesses, eight will fail within the first 18 months.
translation.luo: Samoro weche richo moloyo mano, riwruok mar Bloomberg notimo nonro moyudo ni kuom ohendni 10,  ohendni aboro podho e dweche 18 mokwongo.

translation.en: Many people who are attracted to the glamour of entrepreneurship tend to dismiss the reality of business failure.
translation.luo: Ji mang'eny ma ng'iyo mana ber ma oko e ohendni matindo ma jomoko osechako ok dwarga chomre tir gi wach mar ni ohelni mang'eny podhoga.

translation.en: But while positive thinking is commendable, ignoring the possibility of failure won’t make it go away. On the contrary, overlooking and ignoring the harsh realities of business ownership is a sure-fire way to become just another statistic.
translation.luo: En adier ni bedo gi geno sama wadwaro chako ohala en gima ber. Kata kamano, nyaka wang'e ni ohala nyalo podho, nikech mano e adiera. Omiyo ka ifwayo weche manyalo dhi marach e ohala midwaro chako, bed gadier ni ohandi dhi podho mana kaka ohendni mang'eny osepodho.

translation.en: If you want your start-up to have a real shot at success, there are definitely some things you should be doing, and other things that you shouldn’t be doing.
translation.luo: Ka idwaro ni ohandi ochak dhi maber mapiyo piyo, nitiere gik ma onego itim kod ma ok onego itim.

translation.en: Take note of common reasons small businesses fail and do your best to ensure you don’t make the same mistakes.
translation.luo: Ne ane gima miyoga ohendi matindo podho, kendo tim kar minyalo mondo kik itim gigo.

translation.en: Failure to deliver any real value
translation.luo: Onge ber makende mimiyo kastembeni

translation.en: All successful businesses have one thing in common – they prioritise providing real value to their customers/clients.
translation.luo: Ji duto ma ohelnigi dhi maber timoga gimoro achielni– Gineno ni nyaka gimi kastembegi ber moro makende ma ok giyud kamachielo.

translation.en: What makes your business unique, what sets it apart from its competitors?
translation.luo: Penjri ane penjogi; Ang'o momiyo ohandi ber moloyo ohendni mamoko? Ang'o moloyogo ohendni mamoko mapiem kode?

translation.en: If you don’t have a real answer to this question, your business might be heading towards failure.
translation.luo: Ka ionge dwoko ma achiel kachiel ne penjogi, nyalo bedo ni ohandi dhi kapodho.

translation.en: If your sole goal as an entrepreneur is to get rich quick, you will quickly find yourself at a dead end. Instead, think of how you can offer value to your target audience.
translation.luo: Kapo ni gimaduong' midwaro timo gi ohandi en ni iyud mwandu mapiyo, ibiro diwo mapiyo. Kar manyo mana kaka diyud pesa mang'eny, par gima inyalo timo mondo imi kastembeni ber moro ma kende.

translation.en: For example, everyone can open a barbershop and hire a few skilled barbers.
translation.luo: Kuom ranyisi, ng'ato ang'ata nyalo yawo kinyosi, kendo ondik joliedo mong'eyo tijgi.

translation.en: But the entrepreneur who thinks carefully about the kind of services that their clientele might require in that particular barbershop will have an edge over the competition.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ja ohala maparo matut e wi gik ma kastembene nyalo dwaro ni otimnegi e kinyosi moyawono, nyalo dhi maber moloyo joma moko moyawo kinyosi e alworano.

translation.en: Take a good look at the industry and determine what sets your business apart from its competition.
translation.luo: Non adimba gik ma ohendni machalo gi mari timo, kae to ne gima inyalo timo e ohandi mabiro miyo kastembeni gima opogore ma ok digiyud kuonde mamoko.

translation.en: How do you conduct business differently?
translation.luo: Sama itimo ohala, ang'o mitimoga mopogore gi jomamoko?

translation.en: What are others doing better than you?
translation.luo: Ang'o ma jo ohala weteni oloyigo?

translation.en: With this in mind, develop a unique, customised service package that presents a strong value proposition.
translation.luo: Ka iketo wechegi e paro, tim ohandi e yo mopogore gi jomoko kendo ne ni kastembeni oyudo ber moro makende ma ok ginyal yudo kuonde mamoko.

translation.en: Make sure that your brand messaging, identity, logo, colours and all visible aesthetics are in tandem with your unique value proposition.
translation.luo: Ne ni weche mindiko e gik miloso, nying mimiyo gigo, alama miketo mifwenyogigo, rangi mitiyogo kendo gik moko duto ma iberogo gima ilosono, donjo maber gi ber makende miwacho ni yudore e gino.

translation.en: Investing in value might be quite costly at the outset, but it will pay off handsomely.
translation.luo: En adier ni neno ni ohandi miyo kastembe ber moko makende nyalo kawo pesa mang'eny ka eka ichako ohala, kata kamano ibiro yudo ohala maber bang'e.

translation.en: As an entrepreneur, you have a team of employees looking up to you as their leader.
translation.luo: Sama ichako ohala,  joma indiko tich neni kaka jatendgi kendo giluwo ranyisini.

translation.en: As you deal with business challenges, you must learn how to manage the people around you, share your vision with them, and draw the best from them.
translation.luo: Sama inyagori gi pek mabedoe e ohala, puonjri bende tayo joma tiyoni, konygi mondo gine kama idwaro chopoe gi ohandi, kendo tem tiyo kodgi maber mondo giriwi lwedo gi chunygi duto.

translation.en: Many newcomers in entrepreneurship are overwhelmed by leadership expectations, which can lead to business failure.
translation.luo: Ji mang'eny machako ohala, yudo pek mang'eny e wach tayo jotich, kendo mano nyalo miyo ohala opodh.

translation.en: If you have partners or a leadership team, disagreements about how to run the business might also spell doom.
translation.luo: Kapo ni uriwru gi jomamoko e ohala, kata uloso grup moro mar jotelo matayo jotich, ywaruok e kindu nyalo miyo ohala opodh.

translation.en: Arguing with each other publicly, or giving staff contradictory instructions is not likely to inspire trust and motivate your team.
translation.luo: Ka jotelo yware e lela kata ka ok ginyis jotich gimoro achiel, mano biro miyo jotich kik gen jotelo  kendo ok gibi bedo gi siso mar tich.

translation.en: In addition, when you have challenges that require decisiveness, you will be caught up in arguments instead of resolving the issues before they cause significant damage.
translation.luo: E wi mano, ka ung'iyo gi dondoru, sama wach moro matek oneno kendo dwarore ni uriw paro kendo olose mapiyo, ubiro ketho seche e ywaruok kar loso weche ka pok gimwomo.

translation.en: The effects of bad leadership will trickle down all the levels of your organisation, including financial management, employee morale, and productivity.
