translation.en: After a while, she calls back with what turns out to be a stunning response.
translation.luo: E bang kinde moko, ne oyuayo na tol,  gi gino machalo wach duoko maber.

translation.en: I am surprised you think that the HR system at that place is broken.
translation.luo: Abuok ka iparo ni kamiti mar kanyo mandiko jotich opogre.

translation.en: There is no such thing as dysfunction in any organisation, each is aligned to achieve the results it currently gets.
translation.luo: Onge gino ma ok tii maber e riuruok moro a mora, ng'ato ka ng'ato idwaro okel nwengo ma riuruok yudo.

translation.en: “This is the myth that drives many change initiatives to the ground; that an organisation needs change because it is broken. No way. Any social system is the way it is because some people in the system want it that way, irrespective of what they may say. What you see as broken works for someone or some people in the system…your job is not to fix a broken system but to identify who the system is working for and who it is not,” she said.
translation.luo: “Mae en sigana magoyo lokruok mang'eny piny; ni riuruok dwaro lokruok nikech pogruok. Onge tiende. Riuruok mora a mora ma oriwo jii en kaka en no nikech jok moko e riuruogno dware kamano, maok odewo mawachore. Gima ineno ni otur tiyo maber ne ng'ato kata jokmoko e riuruok…tije ok en loso riuruok ma osekethore kata kamano en ng'eyo ng'ano ma riuruok tiyone kod maok otine,” nowacho.

translation.en: Kakuzi PLC has pledged to invest more than Sh400 million to boost avocado production.
translation.luo: Kakuzi PLC osingo keto mwandu ma oingo siling gana 400 e jiwo pith olemb avocado.

translation.en: Speaking during the Nairobi Securities Exchange (NSE) listed firms 93rd Annual General Meeting held virtually, Kakuzi PLC Chairman Nicholas Ng'ang'a said the firm will this year invest more than Sh400 million in capital expenditures (CAPEX) while focusing on upscaling its smallholder operations value to complement its production capacities and boost the global positioning of Kenyan avocados.
translation.luo: Ka owuoyo e yor mbui e romo 93 maduong'  mag kembe ma  ibago higa ka higa (Nairobi Securities Exchange (NSE) listed firms 93rd Annual General Meeting), jakom Kakuzi PLC Nicholas Ng'ang'a  ne owacho ni higa no kambi biro keto mwandu moingo gana 400 mag nyiewo giko manenore (capital expenditures (CAPEX)) e seche temo ting'o malo dhadhu tiye matindo  e medo romo e yor yuto kendo jiwo chung' maber mag olemb avocado e pinj ngima.

translation.en: "It's critical that the markets only receive good quality fruits from Kenya, and to achieve this, building knowledge of the market requirements amongst farmers is very important," Mr Ng'anga said.
translation.luo: "En buok ni chiche yudo olembe madhadhu gi ber kende koya e Kenya, kendo e chopo e lek ni, gero ng'eyo dwaro mar chiro e kind jopur en gima maber mokalo," Migosi Ng'anga nowacho.

translation.en: He added that the firm is also exploring value addition opportunities in a number of these crops and hope that further exciting opportunities to diversify the income stream.
translation.luo: Ne omedo ni kambi kendo manyo thuolo mar medo dhadhu koya kuom cham go kendo geno yudo thuolo moko malombo wang' e medo yore yuto.

translation.en: Strategically the company with a 2,500 strong workforce, he said, continues to invest in developing its core crops of avocado, macadamia, forestry and cattle and experimenting with the new blueberry venture.
translation.luo: E ng'ado rieko kambi kod jo orak motegno 2,500, nowacho, biero dhi nyime keto mwandu e nyago olembe kaka matr  avocado, macadamia, pith yien kod jamni ka ipimo kod ohala manyien mar blueberry.

translation.en: "The markets for Kakuzi's avocados remained solid, despite the almost complete closure of the food retail sector across our main markets. We expect that there will be some recovery in 2021, but this is not guaranteed. To mitigate this, we continue to trade with our traditional buyers as well as some key new players across 14 different countries," Ng'ang'a said.
translation.luo: "Chich olemb abakado mag Kakuzi nobedo motegno, maok odewo chieg'ni loro e sekta mag uso chiemo e kor chiche wa mapile. Wageno ni chier matin biro betie e higa 2021, kata kamano ok osingi. E geng'o ma, wadhi nyime kod timo ohala kod jo ohala wa machon kanyakla kod manyien mamoko e kor pinje 14 ma opogre," Ng'ang'a nowacho.

translation.en: At the AGM, the firm's shareholders unanimously voted for Sh18 dividends per share, representing a 28.5 per cent growth from the Sh14 dividends paid out the previous year.
translation.luo: Eromo mibago higa ka higa, weg kembi, maonge pingo, nogoyo kura kendo siro siling 18 mag pok mwandu e mwandu ka mwandu moketi, mochung'ne atamalo 28.5 mar dongruok koya e siling 14 mag pok mwandu  mochul higa mokalo.

translation.en: "The global market is responding positively to Kenyan avocados due to their high potential to provide good quality fruits but, we must work tirelessly to secure this market," Ng'ang'a said.
translation.luo: "Chich piny ngima chiwo duoko maber ne olemb abakado moya Kenya nikech nyalo gi mantie malo mar chiwo olemo maber, kata kamano onego watii matek mar nuango chiro," Ng'ang'a nowacho.

translation.en: The company he added has secured lucrative markets for Kenyan agriproducts such as avocados and macadamia and will continue adopting a shared prosperity approach by integrating smallholders.
translation.luo: Kambi osemedo yudo chiro mantie gi yuto maber ne olembe mawuok e Kenya kaka abakado kod macadamia kendo biro dhi nyime keto e tim ber ma ochiw kod riuruok mag wuog kambi matindo.

translation.en: The company has also thrived despite the ravaging effects of the pandemic on the economy.
translation.luo: Kambi bende osetimo maber maok odewo rochruok ma okel kod midhiero ne ngima mar dak.

translation.en: "I am pleased to report that the pandemic did not force us to lay off any staff member. Infact our employee numbers increased, and we managed to honour our Collective Bargaining Agreement commitment with the Kenya Plantations and Agricultural Union to further increase wages," he said.
translation.luo: "Amor chiwo ler ni midhiero ne ok ochuno wa chungo ja orak moro amora. Pare ni kwan jo orak ne omedore, kendo ne wanyalo luoro kinda wa mar winjruok mar jo orak(Collective Bargaining Agreement) kawan kod duol motelone pith chae kod pur (Kenya Plantations and Agricultural Union) e wi medo yor chudo," ne owacho.

translation.en: Three UK-based supermarket chains, last year suspended the purchase of avocados from the Murang’a agribusiness firm following human rights abuse claims by 85 individuals.
translation.luo: Riuruok mar Three UK-kanyakla mag dukni madongo, higa ma okalo ne ochungo nyiewo mag abocado kowuok e kambi ohand pur mar Murang'a kaluwore kod ywagruok e roch ratich dhano gi jokmoko 85.

translation.en: Kakuzi PLC is now focusing on agricultural production expansion and diversification projects for its macadamia, blueberry, livestock and commercial forestry business lines.
translation.luo: Kakuzi PLC sani kawo kinde ne e yawo pur kod dongruoge mopogore opogre mag macadamia, blueberry, jamni kod yore ohala mag uso  bungu.

translation.en: Safaricom CEO, PeterNdegwa (centre), with, Cabinet Secretary ICT Joe Mucheru and Acting Director General Mercy Wanjau during the launch of the 5G network at the Micheal Joseph Centre.
translation.luo: Apisa mduong' mar kambi mar Safaricom, Peter Ndegwa (diere), ga gin kod, jagoro ma ongirore e lony ma nyasani Joe Mucheru kod jachung' jamak ngai maduong' Mercy Wanjau e kinde sidho lai e yor tudruok mar 5G manotimore Micheal Joseph Centre.

translation.en: The capital markets regulator has approved Safaricom’s mobile investment product dubbed Mali.
translation.luo: Jata chicke keto mwandu kod uso osepuodho keto mwandu gi Safaricom kuendo mopogre opogre miluongoni Mali.

translation.en: In its latest report on the progress of various investment solutions in its regulatory framework, the Capital Markets Authority (CMA) said the collective investment scheme (CIS) developed in partnership with fund manager Genghis Capital could pose significant regulatory challenges.
translation.luo: E lupot masani e wi wuodh yore mopogre opogre mag keto muandu, e pend chik,  duol mar chick keto mwandu kod keno (Capital Markets Authority (CMA)) nowacho ni ranyisi mar riuruok keto mwandu (collective investment scheme (CIS) e yor alosa kod riuruok gi jata omenda, Genghis Capital ne nyalo chungo moromo pek mag chike.

translation.en: “The firm initially requested to be admitted in the sandbox for three months but subsequently requested for an extension of this period to ensure wider reach of customers,” explained the CMA in its report in part.
translation.luo: “Gi chien kambi nokwayo rueko e sandbox kuom thuolo maromo dwe adek kata kamano negi kwayo kendo meto mar kinde mondo okony e romo gi jonyiewo mantie maboyo,” CMA olero e kidienj lupodgi.

translation.en: “The firm completed running the tests and exited the sandbox and was authorised to roll out the product on a commercial scale.”
translation.luo: “Kambi notieko timo pimo  kendo chik noyienegi pedho mwandu e ratil mar ohala.”

translation.en: Other firms admitted into the regulatory sandbox include Pezesha Africa, Innova Ltd, the Central Depository and Settlement Corporation, Pyypl Group, Belrium Kenya Ltd and Four Front Management.
translation.luo: Kembni mamoko osewacho ni chike sandbox oriwo Pezesha Africa, kambi mar Innova , riuruok mar Central Depository and Settlement , Pyypl Group, kambi mar Belrium Kenya kod telo mar Four Front.

translation.en: The regulatory sandbox allows live testing of innovations under a less onerous regulatory regime and is expected to attract fintech companies and capital markets licensees such as stockbrokers, fund managers, investment advisors and CIS to test the application of technology on financial services.
translation.luo: Chike mag sandbox oyie nyiso eyor aneno theth mag pim ebuo thin ting' mar pend chike kendo e geno yuayo kembe masiro weche keno kod omenda e yore manyasani, kanyo achiel gi obok mag chiche keno kod uso kaka jous mwandu,  jotend omenda, jo ng'ad paro e weche keto mwandu kod CIS e temo yore ng'eyo manyasani kod kony mag omenda.

translation.en: Safaricom Chief Executive Peter Ndegwa last week said the firm was awaiting for approval from the regulators before commercially launching the mobile investment product.
translation.luo: Jatelo maduong' mar kambi mar  Safaricom Peter Ndegwa juma mokalo nowacho ni girito puotho koya kuom jotaa chike kapok gisidho ayanga keto mar mwandu kuonde mopogre opogre.

translation.en: CMA further raised concern that the massive numbers of investors involved could demand a review of the rules of conducting annual general meetings for the unitholders.
translation.luo: CMA nomedo keto e ng'eyo ni kwan madito mane obetie mag joket mwandu nenyalo medo chuno e ran'go kendo chike matayo romb jokanyo ma oja bagi e kor higa ka higa.

translation.en: CMA further says a large number of test subjects (50,000 investors) needed to successfully test the product was beyond the sandbox risk appetite.
translation.luo: CMA medo wacho ni kwan madong'o mag gige pimo (joket mwandu 50,000) nedwaro ni otim kare pimo mokalo lal mane inyalo kel kod gombo mar  sandbox.

translation.en: The approval means it now awaits a decision from other regulators such as the Central Bank of Kenya before it can roll out to market.
translation.luo: Puotho nyiso ni sani koro irito paro koya kuom jotaa chike mamoko kaka bengi maduong' e piny Kenya (Central Bank of Kenya) kapok odhire e chiro.

translation.en: CMA also raised concern that some of the new investment products set for introduction in Kenya’s securities exchange are too complex for the current regulatory environment.
translation.luo: CMA kendo noketo e ng'eyo ni moko kuom mwandu mawelo miketo, mochan gwelo e kar hola kod uso mwandu mar piny Kenya oridore ahinya ne chike lwasi masani.

translation.en: According to CMA, several investment products including fintech and mobile investment products in various stages of testing require oversight from multiple regulatory agencies, due to their scale in the financial sector.
translation.luo: Kaluore kod CMA, mwandu mopogre miketo manywando kembe masiro weche keno kod omenda eyore manyasani kod keto mwandu kuonde go mopogre opogre e kidienje mopogre opogre e yor pim, dwaro ng'icho matut koya kuom duonde mopogre opogre mag  jotaa chike, kaluore kod chal gi e sekta mar omenda.

translation.en: “Some of the applications we have received for admission into the Regulatory Sandbox are cross-cutting and have aspects where different regulators need to be engaged,” said CMA in its report.
translation.luo: “Moko kuom kwayo mawaseyudo e bedo e kanyo mag chike Sandbox gin makelo pogruok kendo gin kod kido ma jotaa chik mopogre opogre ,onego ono,” CMA wacho e lupode.

translation.en: CMA launched the regulatory sandbox in March 2019 and invited firms to develop and test new solutions.
translation.luo: CMA nosidho ayang'a chike mag  sandbox  e dwe mar adek higa 2019 kendo negi gwelo kembe mondo olosi kendo pimo ranyisi go manyien.

translation.en: Since then, 24 applications have been received and seven admitted to the sandbox.
translation.luo: Chakre kanyo, kwayo 24 osechopo kendo abiryo kuomgi osechual ne sandbox.

translation.en: Firms experimenting with blockchain technology and mobile investment products lead the pack.
translation.luo: Kembe e yor pimo kod ng'eyo e yoo nogo manyasani mar blockchain kod keto mwandu kuonde gogo mopogre opogre, ne otayo chenro.

translation.en: Dock Workers Union General Secretary Simon Sang (right) and executive board member Julius Nyandiko.
translation.luo: Jagoro maduong' mar Dock Workers Union Simon Sang (kor achwich) gi jatelo ma jakanyo Julius Nyandiko.

translation.en: Candidates for the Dock Workers Union (DWU) general secretary post yesterday took a swipe at each other as the campaigns for the May 20 elections hit the homestretch.
translation.luo: Jolar kom jagoro e Dock Workers Union (DWU) nyoro ne joyware giwegi eseche ma kampen mar tarik 20 due mar abich ochacho.

translation.en: As some candidates called for the postponement of the polls, General Secretary Simon Sang cancelled an earlier arrangement to have the County Labour Officer run the polls.
translation.luo: Eseche ma jomoko ne dwaro mondo ochwal nyime tarik mar yiero, jagoro maduong' Simon Sang ne odiro oko chenro mane oket mar Kanti Labour Officer tayo yiero.

translation.en: In a letter dated May 8, Sang said the last DWU National Executive Committee re-defined the role of the returning officer, saying the labour officer can oversee the election but not run it.
translation.luo: E barua mane ondiki tarik 8 due mar abich, Sang ne owacho ni DWU National Executive Committee mokala ne olero kendo tij apisa majaduoko, ka oedo ni apisa mar labour nyalo mana rango yiero to ok taye.

translation.en: He said the polls would now be conducted by an election board as directed by the registrar of trade unions.
translation.luo: Ne owachoni ni yiero ibiro taa gi board mar yiero kaka ochiki gi registrar mar oriwo mar ohala (trade union).

translation.en: “The election board under the chairmanship of Martin Oindo, you need to work with them as a team. His team will do logistical matters in full, which you are not privy to such as developing voting registers, identifying polling stations, and conducting an election,” said Sang.
translation.luo: “Board mar yiero e buwo kom mar Martin Oindo, owinjore mondo uti kod gi kanyakla. Joge biro timo weche mag pesa duto tee, ma ionge ng'eyo e kaka loso rigista mar yiero, yiero kuonde go ombulu, kod timo yiero," Sang ne owacho.

translation.en: He added that election clerks would be sourced from Kenya Ports Authority (KPA).
translation.luo: Bende ne omedo ni jondiko mag yiero ibiro gol Kenya Ports Authority (KPA).

translation.en: This has drawn both criticism and support from the other candidates.
translation.luo: Maye osekelo ywaruok gi jipo koa kuom jochung' moko.

translation.en: Yesterday, Omar Masumbuko, a candidate for the GS post, criticised Sang for “trying to change the rules in the middle of the game”.
translation.luo: Nyoro, Omar Masumbuko, maen jalar kom mar GS, ne opingo Sang kuom " temo loko chike kind mag tugo”.

translation.en: “The team lead by Sang has failed workers. It is during his reign that workers lost overtime allowances and he also failed to push for workers’ pay raise,” said Masumbuko.
translation.luo: “Oromo mosetaa gi Sang oseduoko jotich chien. En ekinde telonee majotije oselalo omenda mag tiyo seche mang'eny kendo ne orem e chwalo meto mar osara mar jotich,” Masumbuko neowacho.

translation.en: Since last year, KPA has been restricting the overtime allowance to 30 per cent of monthly salaries, hence reducing the port workers’ take-home package.
translation.luo: Koa higa mokalo, KPA osebedo ka geng'o yuto mag seche mang'eny gi ataamalo 30 mar osara, kendo osemiyo jotije  mag port dok dala gi pesa matin.

translation.en: Sang, however, said the issue of overtime would be addressed after the Collective Bargain Agreement (CBA) is signed on May 16 by the union.
translation.luo: Sang, kata kamano, neowacho ni wach chudo mar seche mang'eny ibiro riee bang keto sei e Collective Bargain Agreement (CBA) mabiro timore tarik 16 due mar Abich gi riwo.

translation.en: The CBA gives the over 4,400 unionisable staff a 10 per cent pay rise to be backdated to 16 months.
translation.luo: CBA miyo jotich ma jokanyo mokalo 4,400 mag riuruogno atamalo 10 mar meto mar osara kochakore dweche 16 mosekalo.

translation.en: The Salary and Remuneration Commission has, however, raised an objection saying KPA’s cash flow cannot sustain the pay rise.
translation.luo: Duol matayo weche osara gi meto, katamano, ose kwero KPA kagiwacho ni mol mar omenda machalo kamano oknyal rito meto mag osara.

translation.en: Another aspirant, Harry Arigi, said elections should be postponed because they coincide with the May 20 official launch of the Lamu Port.
translation.luo: Jachung' machielo, Harry Arigi, ne owacho ni yiero onegochwal nyime nikech gituomore gi yango mar Lamu Port tarik 20 due mar abich.

translation.en: He said some of the union members will be busy.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni jokanyo moko mag riuruogno biro bedo modich.

translation.en: “Several union members who are eligible to vote will be engaged in Lamu. We need all members to participate in this important exercise,” said Arigi.
translation.luo: “Ng'eny jokanyo mag riuruok mowinjore goombulu biro bedo modich Lamu. Wadwaro mondo jokanyo duto mondo oriure e yiero mochunoni,”  Arigi nowacho.

translation.en: Other aspirants are former head of container operations at the port Edward Opiyo and Mikindani MCA, who is also former chief shop steward Renson Thoya, Abubakar Mohamed, Said Chande, Alphaeus Aluoch, Jorum Kiilu, Ezra Okong’o and Fatuma Mbule.
translation.luo: Jok mamoko molapgi ndong' gin kaka jakom machon e tiye mbugru e dho wath Edward Opiyo kod jachung' mar  Mikindani MCA, mabende en jaus chiemo maduong', steward Renson Thoya, Abubakar Mohamed, Said Chande, Alphaeus Aluoch, Jorum Kiilu, Ezra Okong’o kod Fatuma Mbule.

translation.en: Majengo Warrah, Siyat Abdullahi, Moses Abebe, Kanga Maganga, Athman Athman, Mohamed Mabanda, Mohamed Ibrahim and Adenan Ondieki are also eyeing the seat.
translation.luo: Majengo Warrah, Siyat Abdullahi, Moses Abebe, Kanga Maganga, Athman Athman, Mohamed Mabanda, Mohamed Ibrahim kod Adenan Ondieki bende olapgi ndong' ne kom no.

translation.en: Meanwhile, all the KPA employees interested in the DWU seats have taken leave to participate in the election, and in case they are defeated they will still have their jobs.
translation.luo: Koweyo mano, jotich tee mag  KPA manigi gombo e kombe DWU osekawo yueyo mar bedo e yiero, kendo ponono oyombgi pod gibiro bedo ni gin kod tije gi.

translation.en: Masumbuko, a Shop Steward Council Secretary who works in logistics, confirmed that he had taken leave to campaign.
translation.luo: Masumbuko, jagoro mar riuruok mar jo us chiemo matiyo e mulo mwandu kod wuok mag mwandu go oko mar kambi, noyango ni nokuayo yueyo mar dhi lodho dwache mar chung'.

translation.en: “Sang has failed to protect the workers from exploitation. He has been unable to address the issue of workers’ overtime payment,” Masumbuko said.
translation.luo: “Sang oserem e geng'o jotich kuom sendo. Okosebedo ka onyalo wuoye wach chudo mag jotich bang tiyo e seche momedre,” Masumbuko nowacho.

translation.en: But Sang dismissed Masumbuko’s claims, saying he had fought many battles to improve the welfare of KPA workers.
translation.luo: Kata kamano Sang nokoyie gi weche Masumbuko, ka owacho ni ne osegoyo luenje mang'eny mondo ober ywagruog mag jotij  KPA.

translation.en: He said since he took over the DWU leadership the workers have been the best-paid employees in the country.
translation.luo: Nowacho ni chakre noyie telo mar DWU , jotich osebedo jo orak ma ichulo maber moloyo e piny.

translation.en: The union boss insisted that he was fighting to have the CBA registered and fully implemented, adding, “I want to concentrate and not engage in petty claims from my opponents”.
translation.luo: Jatend riuruok gano ni osebedo ka ogore mondo one ni andike mar winjruog jotich (CBA) ondiki kendo oket matut e tim, ka omedo, “Adwaro dich kendo okadwar bedo e paro achiel winjo weche manono mag jowasika".

translation.en: “I have not been campaigning because I want to make sure the CBA award of 10 per cent salary increment for my members is paid,” said Sang.
translation.luo: “Okasebedo ka akwayo ombulu nikech adwaro temo matek mondo meto mar andike winjruog ywak jotich (CBA) kod atamalo 10 e meto mar osara ne jokanyo ochul” Sang nowacho.

translation.en: James Nyabando, a banana retailer at Moitunya in Nyamira County checks out one of the bunches for sale in his make-shift shed.
translation.luo: James Nyabando, ja ohala maduong' mar rabolo Moitunya e Nyamira kanti ng'iyo achiel kuom saga minyalo uso e ode mar keno.

translation.en: Banana farmers from Kenya are set for good business from export of the product to South Korea.
translation.luo: Jopur rabolo mar piny Kenya ikre ne ohala maber mar uso mwandu oko mar kenya, ne  piny korea mamilambo.

translation.en: Seated on a wooden bench near his makeshift shed at the roadside along the Kisii-Nyamira-Kericho Highway, James Nyabando patiently waits for someone to buy his bunches of green bananas.
translation.luo: Ka obete e then mar bawo machieg'ni gi od keno mantie e bath ndara e dir ndara maduong' mar Kisii-Nyamira-Kericho, James Nyabando ma onge kiawa rito ng'ato mondo onyieu saga mag rabonde manumu.

translation.en: Since morning, he has sold only one bunch.
translation.luo: Chakre okinyi, oseuso mana saga achiel kende.

translation.en: His prices range from Sh700 for the biggest bunch weighing around 60kg to around Sh300 for the medium-sized one weighing around 30kg.
translation.luo: Beche ringo koya siling 700 ne saga maduong' mogik mapek mare machieg'ni romo kilo 60 nyaka machieg'ni romo kod mar siling 300 madit matin mapek mare chieg'ni gi kilo 30.

translation.en: Most of the customers who buy his cooking type bananas are motorists on transit from or to Kisii, Nyamira or Kericho towns.
translation.luo: Jonyieo mang'eny manyiewo rabonde mag ateda gin joriemb nyamburko mating'o mwandu moya kata mochomo bombe kaka Kisii, Nyamira kod Kericho.

translation.en: He is not a farmer himself but he buys from growers and resells at a profit margin.
translation.luo: En owuon ok en japur kata kamano onyieo kuom jopith kendo ouso kendo e yudo nueng'o maber.

translation.en: “This is not a bad business venture because I make a good margin. But today business is slow,” Nyabando tells The Standard.
translation.luo: “Mae ok en donjo e ohala marach nikech ayudo nueng'o  maber. Kata kamano ohala masani yuto ok en piyo,” Nyabando wacho ne Standard.

translation.en: One of his main suppliers of the banana is Lukas Moganda from Moitunya Village, about 50 metres from Nyabando’s roadside shed.
translation.luo: Achiel kuom jokou rabolo mapile en Lukas Moganda mar gweng' Moituny, machieg'ni romo ondamo 500 koya kar keno mantie e bath ndara mayudre Nyabado.

translation.en: Moganda has a total of over 800 stems of green bananas in his half-acre farmland.
translation.luo: Moganda ni kod kwan tee moingo yiend rabolo michamo 800 e puodho nus heka.

translation.en: On average, he can harvest up to 50 bunches every week, which he sells to local retailers like Nyabando and some brokers who transport produce to Nairobi where there is a richer market.
translation.luo: Ka rach, onyalo kayo nyaka saga 50 wik ka wik, ma ouso ne jokony e nyieo kod uso madong'o mantie machieg'ni kaka Nyabando kod jowero mating'o yuto nyaka Nairobi mantie kod chiro momio.

translation.en: But his biggest challenge is the low prices the produce fetches due to low market and exploitation from brokers.
translation.luo: Kata kamano pek maduong' ahinya en neng'o matin mayuto kelo kaluore kod chiro mantie piny kod sand mag jokony e nyieo kod uso.

translation.en: Farm prices for the biggest bunch that can weigh around 70kg range from Sh600 to Sh700 while for the small type weighing around 30kg can go for as little as Sh250.
translation.luo: Bei e puodho mag saga madong'o ahinya machieg'ni romo kilo 70 ringo ka oya siling 600 nyaka 700 e seche ma pek mar kido matin chieg'ni romo kilo 30 inyalo us matin ne siling 250.

translation.en: On his farm, Moganda grows the Ng’ombe variety of bananas, besides the Gros Michel type which are the commonest cultivars of green bananas in the region.
translation.luo: E puothe, Moganda puro kido ma opogore mag rabolo mar Ng’ombe, e padh kido mar Gros Michel ma gin gige pur mapile mag rabond ateda e aluora.

translation.en: The prices are almost similar across Nyamira and Kisii Counties where banana farmers mostly sell their produce at near throw-away prices
translation.luo: Neng'o chieg'ni ni rom e kor kantis mag Nyamira kod Kisii ma jopur thothne rabolo ahinya ahinya uso keyo margi e nang'o mayot mokalo.

translation.en: For example, Moganda’s story is not any different from that of Evans Onsinyo, a farmer from Suneka Bogiakumu whose two-acre banana plantain has not given him good cash returns due to the declining market.
translation.luo: Kuom ranyisi, sigand Moganda onge pogruok moro kod mar Evans Onsinyo, japur mawuok Suneka Bogiakumu ma puoth rabolo mare heka ariyo okosebedo ka duokone yuto maber kaluore gi rach mar chiro.

translation.en: But even with the underlying challenges the two farmers and many others could be facing, there is a glimmer of hope for them in the international market after the Korean Republic opened up a fresh market for Kenya’s green bananas and broccoli.
translation.luo: Kata kod pek, gi ma jopur ariyo gi kod kod jopur mang'eny mamoko kale, nitiere pilni mar geno ne gin, e chiro mar piny ng'ima bang Korea mamilambo yao chiro manyien mag rabolo manumu mag ateda kod broccoli.

translation.en: According to the letter from the Ministry of Industrialisation, Trade and Enterprise Development to the Council of Governors, counties have been challenged to take up the market opportunity for their farmers who grow the products.
translation.luo: Kaluore kod oboke mowuok e migao mar kembe, chiro kod dongruok mar ohelni (Ministry of Industrialisation, Trade and Enterprise Development) ne duol mar jotend kantis (Council of Governors), kantis osekwa mondo giyao thuolo mar chiro ne yuto majopur puro .

translation.en: The Ministry, in its communication to the governors, banana export volumes were still dismal and there was a need for enhanced efforts to have all counties interested in the business to do a quick follow-up on certification.
translation.luo: Migao, e wach mochim ne gabanas kata jotend kantis, chiro mar rabolo ne pinje maoko ne pod tin mokalo kendo ne nitier dwaro matek ne kantis machuny gi ne gombo donjo e ohala mondo olu mapiyo wach mar oboke.

translation.en: “For acquisition of phytosanitary conformity certifIcates (certification requirement on any farm produce meant for the export market), you are advised to refer any interested counties to the Managing Director of the Kenya Plants Health Inspectorate Services (Kephis),” the letter read in part.
translation.luo: “E nono mar oboke ma dwarore ne keyo mora amora e chiro mag pinje maoko (phytosanitary conformity certifIcates), ijiwi mondomifuar kanti moro amora mantie kod chuny ne jatelo matayo duol machiwo kendo rang'o ngima mag yedhi e piny Kenya (Kenya Plants Health Inspectorate Services (Kephis)),” pend oboke wacho.

translation.en: Such opening is a great blessing for local farmers like Moganda who otherwise were on a verge of losing hope on the crop due to lack of marketability.
translation.luo: Yauruok aila gi kelo hawi maduong' ne jopur ekor gwenge machal kod Moganda ma dine ok kamano, ne nitiere giko jok kod pur nikech koso yor chiro.

translation.en: David Orori, a chief officer for trade at Nyamira County says the opportunity has reignited a fresh need to increase the production of bananas and even ventures into broccoli farming.
translation.luo: David Orori, apisa madung' mar ohala e kanti mar Nyamira wachoni thuolono osechiero dwaro manyien mar medo keyo mar rabolo kata e chako ohala mar pur mar broccoli.

translation.en: “We have no justification why our farmers should not grab the opportunity. However, we now have to draw a major focus on sensitising them on the production of quality produces that can pass the international certification standard,” Orori says.
translation.luo: “Wa onge kod duoko ma omiyo jopur magwa ok nyal tiyo kod thuoloni. Kata kamano, sani koro onego waket wengewa e bolo pur man kod keyo manigi dhadhu manyalo kalo dwach obok kod rang'iny mag pinje maoko,” Orori wacho.

translation.en: The country has an estimated annual production of 1.1 million metric tonnes of green bananas where an estimated 390,000 small-scale farmers play a larger part in the production, according to the Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations (FAO) 2014 report titled Food Loss Assessments.
translation.luo: Kanti oseko pimo yuto mar higa mar gana 1.1  metric tonnes mag rabolo saga manumus kama mopim jopur matindo 390,000 e jokanyo marauma e keyo, kaluore kod duol mar pith kod chiemo mag pinje United Nations (Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations (FAO)) lupot mar higa 2014 nomiyo pek rango lal mar chiemo(Food Loss Assessments).

translation.en: Of the total production of bananas in the country, 60 per cent of it all is the green bananas that are mainly for cooking while the 40 per cent is the dessert variety according to Techno Serve(TNS).
translation.luo: E wi yuto tee mag rabolo e kanti, atamalo 60 mag gi gin saga mag rabolo manumu ma ahinya gin mag tet kendo atamalo 40 ma odong' en kido manyak e kuonde oro kaluore kod duol mar Techno Serve(TNS).

translation.en: While Meru County is taking lead in the production of bananas at around 40 per cent, followed by Kirinyaga and Tharaka Nithi counties at 21 and 19 per cent respectively.
translation.luo: E kinde ma kanti ma Meru otelo e yuto mar rabolo kod machieg'ni romo atamalo 40, ka iluwe kod kantis ma Kirinyaga kod Tharaka Nithi kod atamalo 21 kod 19 e luruokno.

translation.en: A FAO report shows that Kisii, Nyamira, Bungoma and Kakamega counties are the largest producers of green bananas which are now being sought after in the newly opened market in South Korea.
translation.luo: Lupod FAO nyiso ni kantis mag Kisii, Nyamira, Bungoma kod Kakamega gin jopur madong'o mag rabolo saga mag tet ma sanii ikelo kod chiro manyien mane oyau South Korea.

translation.en: The three leaders in banana production mainly venture into dessert bananas.
translation.luo: Jotelo adek e pith rabolo ahinya ahinya donjoe e pith rabolo manyak kuonde go mag oro.

translation.en: With the fresh prospects, Kenya joins the league of top African exporters of bananas behind Cote d’Ivoire and Cameroon.
translation.luo: Kod yuto mar chiro manyien, piny Kenya odonjo e grup maduong' mar jous rabolo e pinje maoko, chien mar pinje Cote d’Ivoire kod Cameroon.

translation.en: FAO’s Banana Market Review report indicated that in 2019 alone, Cote d’Ivoire exported a total of 411,000 tonnes of bananas with Cameroon also selling a total of 167,000 tonnes outside its borders.
translation.luo: E lupod ng'iyo chich rabolo motim kod FAO nonyiso ni e higa 2019 kende, Cote d’Ivoire no uso e pinje maoko maromo tan 411,000 mag rabolos ka piny Cameroon kendo uso maromo tan 167,000 oko mar tong' ne.

translation.en: Kenya on its part exported a total of 100 tonnes for two years: 2016 and 2017.
translation.luo: Kenya gi e loe nouso maromo tan 100 kuom higni ariyo: e higa 2016 kod 2017.

translation.en: Nyamira Governor Amos Nyaribo while welcoming the news of the prospective banana market said the Lake Region, Western and South Rift counties are going to be the greatest beneficiaries.
translation.luo: Gabana ma Nyamira Amos Nyaribo ka rwako weche chiro manyien mar rabolo nowacho ni kuonde go ma oluoro nam, kantis mag Yimbo kod Milambo mar hoho mar Okak dhi yudo ber moloyo.

translation.en: This is after the completion of a Sh7 billion investment of an international agricultural industrial park in the county.
translation.luo: Ma en bang' tiek keto mwandu mar tara 7 mar kar ranyisi mar gige pur mag kembe moting'o pinje maoko, e kanti.

translation.en: How Kenyans borrowed to survive Covid-19 pandemic
translation.luo: Kaka jokenya no oholo mondo odagi e kindi midhiero mar Covid-19.

translation.en: The Covid-19 pandemic pushed Kenyans to borrow for survival as the disease destabilised the country’s economy, with thousands losing their livelihoods.
translation.luo: Midhiero mar Covid-19 nodhiro jokenya mang'eny e holo e konyo e yor dak nikech tuo no norocho chal mar dak e piny, ma oneno alufu mag jii lalo ngimagi.

translation.en: An analysis by Financial Standard on data on the demand for credit from 2019 to March this year shows loans to individuals and households went up by 14 per cent.
translation.luo: E nonro mar Financial Standard e kwan jogo madwaro hola chakre higa 2019 nyaka dwe mar adek higani, nyiso ni jii jiweggi kod dhoudi ne odhi nyime kod atamalo 14.

translation.en: This compares to the pre-Covid-19 era when many Kenyans were able to comfortably meet their daily needs.
translation.luo: Mae kopim kod ndalo kapok midhiero mar Covid-19 chopo, mane jokenya mang'eny ne nyalo chopo mayot dwaro gi mapile.

translation.en: The data is contained in the Central Bank of Kenya Credit Officer Survey report, which shows in March 2019, the demand for personal and household loans stood at 39 per cent, the same as in 2018.
translation.luo: Nonro ni okan e lupod apisa mar hola mar bengi maduong' e piny kenya (Central Bank of Kenya Credit Officer Survey report), ma nyiso ni e dwe mar adek higa 2019, dwaro mar hola jii owuon kod hola mar dhoudi ne ochung' e atamalo 39, machalre kod mar higa 2018.

translation.en: This figure, however, shot up to 43 per cent in December 2019 and 53 per cent in March last year, a 14 per cent increase.
translation.luo: Kwan ni, kata kamano, ne oidho malo kod atamalo 43 e dwe mar  Desemba higa 2019 kod atamalo 53 e dwe mar adek higa mokalo, medruok mar atamalo 14.

translation.en: The figures are based on responses from senior credit officers in registered commercial banks.
translation.luo: Kwan gi yudore kod duoko koya kuom apisa madong'o mag hola e bengi machiwo hola go.

translation.en: In the March 2020 report, 38 lenders and one mortgage finance company participated in the survey.
translation.luo: E lupod dwe mar adek higa 2020, jo hol gowi 38 kod kambi achiel machiwo gowi e yor asinge (one mortgage finance company) ne obedo jokanyo e nonro.

translation.en: In the report, loans to the trade sector came in second after individual and household loans at 46 per cent followed by manufacturing at 31 per cent.
translation.luo: E lupot, hola ne sekta mar jo ohala nobiro e namba ariyo bang' hola mag jii owuon kod hola mag dhoudi kod atamalo 46 ka iluwe kod kembe marego kod atamalo 31.

translation.en: The survey covered 11 sectors of the economy.
translation.luo: Nonro ne oriwo sekta 11 mag tene dak mar oganda.

translation.en: This saw gross loans rise by 2.62 per cent from Sh2.774 billion in December 2019 to Sh2.847 billion in March 2020.
translation.luo: Mae ne onyiso idho mag hola tee kod atamalo 2.62 koya e siling tara 2.774 e dwe mar Desemba higa 2019 nyaka siling tara 2.847 e dwe mar adek higa 2020.

translation.en: “The growth in gross loans was mainly due to increased advances in the manufacturing, trade, personal/household and tourism, restaurant and hotel sectors,” reads the Credit Officer Survey Report for March 2020.
translation.luo: “Dongo mag hola ahinya ahinya ne ochual kod medruok kembe mag rego, ohendni, wuodhe aneno mag jii owuon/mag jo ot, sekta mar math kod magawa,” lupod nonro mar afisa mar hola, wacho e wi dwe mar adek higa 2020.

translation.en: “The increased demand in the two sectors is attributed to increased demand for consumer goods and services.”
translation.luo: “Medruok dwaro mag sekta ariyo okel kod medruok dwaro mag mwandu mapile mag jonyieo.”

translation.en: Consumer goods are products or utilities considered basic for a particular household.
translation.luo: Mwandu mapile mag jonyieo gin mwandu kata chudo ma ochuno pile ka pile ne dho ot ka dho ot.

translation.en: They may include clothes, electronics and even food.
translation.luo: Gi nyalo riwo lewni, gige matiyo kod tek stima kendo kata mana chiemo.

translation.en: The rise in the percentage of credit advanced to individuals and households, explained Samuel Nyandemo, a lecturer of Economics at The University of Nairobi, was in reaction to the impact of Covid-19 on the economy.
translation.luo: Medruok atamalo mag hola michiwo ne jii weggi kod dhoudi, Samuel Nyandemo nolero, japuonj kungo e mbalarieny mar Nairobi, e kwedo lokruok ma okel kod midhiero mar Covid-19 e chal ngima mar dak.

translation.en: “When Covid-19 came, many peoples’ incomes were seen to be melting,” he said.
translation.luo: “Kane midhiero mar Covid-19 chopo, yuto mag jii mang'eny no neno ka gima rumo(leny),” ne owacho.

translation.en: Dr Nyandiemo said since businesses were not bringing in profit as expected, many people were forced to take loans to survive.
translation.luo: Laktar Nyandiemo nowacho ni chakre chieng'no, ohendni ok nekel yuto maduarore, nochuno oganda mang'eny kawo hola e yor neno kaka ginyalo dak.

translation.en: “The incomes were dwindling so they had to cushion themselves from the devastating effects of Covid-19, leading to them taking loans,” he said.
translation.luo: “Yuto gi nedok piny kendo ne ochuno gigeng're gin giwuon kuom mane ikelo kod midhiero mar Covid-19, machoro gi kao hola,” ne owacho.

translation.en: This percentage of credit advanced to households and individuals, however, dropped to 31 per cent, according to the June 2020 Credit Officer Survey report, before shooting up again in September to 45 per cent.
translation.luo: Atamaloni mar hola mag udi gi jii wegi, kata kamano ne olwar nyaka atamalo 31, kaluore gi lupot mane ogol due mar auchiel gi Credit Officer Survey, kapok odok malo kendo nyaka atamalo 45 due mar ochiko.

translation.en: And while the figure remained at 45 per cent of total loans as of March this year, it was still higher compared to the same period in 2019 before Covid-19 struck.
translation.luo: Bende kane kwan ne odong e atamalo 45 e kwan duto mag hola e due mar adek higani, podi ne en malo kopim gi  higa mar 2019 e seche gogo kapok Covid-19 ne ojukowa.

translation.en: After it became apparent that the pandemic was not a passing cloud as may had thought, lending institutions became wary of advancing credit, especially the kind that had no collateral.
translation.luo: Bang fwenyoni ni midhiero ok ne en yamo makalo kaluore gi pachwa, Migepe mag hola ne oyudo buok mar medruok mag hola, moloyo ahinya maonge gi gima osingi marito kaponi hola ok ochuli.

translation.en: According to the September last year report, credit standards remained unchanged in seven economic sectors and were tightened in four sectors, including personal and household segments.
translation.luo: Kaluore gi lupot mar due mar ochiko higa mokalo, chike mag hola ne odong ma ok oloki e kidienje abiryo mag yuto kendo ne oridgi e kidienje ang'wen, moriwo kidienje jii wegi gi dhoudi.

translation.en: The others are tourism, transport and communication, and real estate.
translation.luo: Moko gin wuodh aneno, yore mag wuoth gi mag tudruok kod ohala mag udi.

translation.en: Tightened credit is the unavailability of loans for the purpose it’s being borrowed for. It may be due to new conditions set by a financial institution or regulator or the dynamics of the market.
translation.luo: Rido hola en koso holo ne gima omiyo ikwayogi. Nyalo timore nikech chike manyien moket gi duonde tayo weche omuom kata yore mag chiro .

translation.en: “Tightening of credit standards in the four sectors is attributed to the effects of Covid-19 pandemic,” reads the CBK report.
translation.luo: “Rido chike mag holo e kidienje ang'wengo luwore gi midhiero mag Covid-19,” lupot mar Bengi aduong mar CBK.

translation.en: The report also notes that the expectation regarding general economic activity and removal of interest rate capping also contributed to the tightened credit in the various sectors.
translation.luo: Lupodni bende fwenyo ni gombo mag gik yore yuto gi golo yore mag medo atamalo mag yuto bende ne okelo medruok e rido hola e sektas/kidienje mopogore.

translation.en: Owing to the fact that most personal and household loans are unsecured, Nyandemo said defaults are more likely, which explains the tightening in lending.
translation.luo: Kaluore gi adiera ni hola mang'eny mag jii wegi gi mag udi onge gi gima osingi, Nyandemo nowacho ni lewo chudo nyalre mang'eny, maye ema lero rito mag hola.

translation.en: “We will see a high degree of defaults because the economy has been affected with a lot of uncertainties given that we are told of another spike of the disease in July,” he said.
translation.luo: “Wabiro neno koso chudo mamalo nikech yore mag yuto osechach gi gigo ma ok ong'ere kaluore gi kaka iwachonwa ni midhiero mar tuwo nyalo medre e due mar abiryo,” ne owacho.

translation.en: In the September 2020 survey, 69 per cent of credit officers listed personal and household loans among the leading Non-Performing Loans (NPL), which came third after tourism and hotels (72 per cent), transport and communication (72 per cent), and real estate (67 per cent).
translation.luo: E nonro mane otimore due mar ochiko, atamalo 69 mar apisa mag hola ne okwano hola mag jii giwegi gi mag udi ekind hola ma ok chul (Non-Performing Loans (NPL), mane obedo namba adek bang wuodh aneno gi otende ma en (atamalo 72), gi ohand udi real estate ( ma en atamalo 67).

translation.en: This was a 30 per cent rise compared to 2019.
translation.luo: Maye ne en medruok mar atamalo 30 kopim gi higa mar 2019.

translation.en: “During the quarter under review, the respondents indicated that the level of NPLs remained unchanged in five economic sectors and increased in six sectors namely: trade, tourism, building and construction, personal and household, and transport and communication,” reads the September last year report.
translation.luo: “Ekinde ng'iyo gik mane otimore e kuota, joduoko ne onyiso ni rang'iny mar NPLs neodong' ma ok olokore e sekta/kidienje abich ma yore yuto kendo ne omedore e sekta auchiel magin: ohala, wuodh aneno, gedo gi orak, jii gi udi, yoremag tudruok,” lupot mar due mar ochiko higa mokalo wacho.

translation.en: This rise in the percentage of NPLs for household and personal use while linked to the general sluggish growth of the economy during the pandemic references the employment rates in the country, which dropped sharply as a result of banks becoming wary of lending as most of the laons are unsecured.
translation.luo: Medruok mar atamalo mar hola (NPLs) mag tije mag udi gi jii kata obedo ni otudore gi ywaruok mag dongruok mag yore ohala kinde mag midhiero moluwore gi chal mag andika mag jotich e piny, mane olwar kaluore gi luworo mar bengi e chiwo hola mang'eny ma ok osingi.

translation.en: The Short-term Impact of the Covid-19 Shock on Employment in Formal Firms in Kenya (PEDL) report published by Private Enterprise Development in March shows that by April 2020, overall employment in the formal sector dropped by 16 per cent.
translation.luo: Buok malang mar Covid-19 e tije andike e lupot mar Formal Firms in Kenya (PEDL) mane ondiki e ohala mag dongruok mag ji giwegi (Private Enterprise Development) e due mar adek nyiso ni karom due mar ang'wen, tije andike ne obuok gi atamalo 16.

translation.en: The data was sourced from analysing tax returns of private corporations and partnerships filing tax returns for their employees.
translation.luo: Nonro ne ogol kuom puodho yuto mag osuru mag riuruok jii giwegi kod kanyakla mar jaso yuto mag osuru, ne jotijgi.

translation.en: Anyone who has been following Kenya’s budgets over the last few years will recall headlines each year saying that the country has set its largest-ever budget.
translation.luo: Jalno ma osebedo kaluwo bajet mar kenya kuom higni matin ma osekalo biro paro weche ma imiyo pek higa ka higa kawacho ni, piny oseloso baget maduong' mapok nonenga.

translation.en: The upcoming 2021/22 fiscal year is no exception, with Treasury Cabinet Secretary Ukur Yatani announcing a budget of Sh3.6 trillion – yes, the biggest ever! A little over Sh2 trillion will come from government revenues, with approximately Sh1.8 trillion of this from tax revenues.
translation.luo: Hik omenda mabiro mar 2021/22 ok owe oko, e seche ma jatend migao mar omenda migosi Ukur Yatani lando bajet mar silings trillion 3.6  – kamano, maduong' moloyo! Matin mokalo silings trillion 2 ibiro kel kod choko mag sirikal, e machieg'ni siling trillion 1.8 mag choko gi koya e choko mag osuru.

translation.en: The balance will be borrowed – another common feature of the last few years.
translation.luo: Balang ibiro hol – kido mong'iyo kuom higni mokalo.

translation.en: This year’s budget comes amidst an economic crisis brought on by the Covid-19 pandemic, with the inherent assumption that the pandemic will come to an end before the start of the next financial year.
translation.luo: Bajet mar higani biro e diere pek mar chal mar ng'ima dak kokel kod midhiero mar Covid-19 , e paro mosebede ni midhieroni biro rumo kapok oromo chakruok mar hik omenda mabiro.

translation.en: Given surges in infections that are being seen globally, and indeed in Kenya, this assumption may well be the deal-breaker.
translation.luo: E aneno kod medruok mag kute gi e kind okanda e piny mang'ima, kaka bende e piny Kenya , paro ni kendo nyalo bedo makelo ywaruok bange pogruok.

translation.en: The Ministry of Health has already said that Kenya may see another wave of infections in July, fuelled by the Indian variant.
translation.luo: Migao mar chirth nowacho ni kenya nyalo neno okang' machielo mag kutego e dwe mar abiryo, miswero kod kudni motisi ni (Indian variant).

translation.en: This could result in more lockdowns with the associated impact on the economy and indeed revenue collections. T
translation.luo: Mae nyalo kelo kendo loro piny mabiro gi lokruok e chal ng'ima mar dak kod choko yuto mag sirikal.

translation.en: he lack of vaccines is an issue that the government must address as a matter of great urgency if the country is to get through the pandemic without further economic woes.
translation.luo: Koso chanjo en wach ma piny owacho nyaka non mapiyo, kaponi piny nyaka muom kind midhiero ni maonge chandruok mikelo kod pek mar ng'ima dak.

translation.en: While deficits in government budgets are not uncommon, Kenya seems to be annually widening the gap between expenditure and revenues.
translation.luo: Kata gope e bajede piny owacho ok thor betie kamano, kenya higa ka higa chalo ka gima yao thuolo maduong' e kind omenda mawuok godo kod mago madonjo.

translation.en: If one applies this model to their household budget, the upshot will almost certainly be bankruptcy.
translation.luo: Ponono ng'ato otiyo kod ranyisi ni e bajed dhoudi maggi, duoko biro chalo ni chieg'ni kod bedo jagowi ma ok nyal chopo dwache.

translation.en: What is actually required is curtailing recurring government expenditures, which is something that the government has acknowledged in the past with proposed austerity measures.
translation.luo: Mano e adiera madwarore e geng'o  ,edruok omenda wawuok mag piny owacho, ma en gima piny owacho oseyiego e kinde mokalo kod sir mag chike kaka maduoko chien tije omenda kendo meto mag osuru.

translation.en: The reality is that Kenya has not succeeded in doing this, and the pressure on revenue collection is exacerbated.
translation.luo: Adiera en ni piny kenya okosemuonyo e timo mae, kendo liet/achune e choko yuto mag sirikal , kelo ich wang'.

translation.en: When you add to the high level of wastage and corruption we are witnessing, the deficit will almost certainly continue to widen.
translation.luo: Ka imedo okang' mantie malo mar lal kod mibadhi mawaneno, gowi biro chalo ni chieg'ni dhi nyime medore.

translation.en: The responsibility for tax collection and enforcement lies with the Kenya Revenue Authority better (KRA).
translation.luo: Ting' mar choko osuru kod keto e tim owinjore otim kod duol matayo weche osuru (Kenya Revenue Authority better (KRA)).

translation.en: There is no doubt that the authority has improved significantly in this task since it was set up in 1995.
translation.luo: Onge kiawa ni duolno osemedore e yor tije chakre nyuolne e higa mar 1995.

translation.en: The taxman estimates that 4.4 million tax returns were filed by June 30 last year, up from 3.6 million in the previous year.
translation.luo: Jachok osuru pimo ni omenda maromo gana  4.4 mag yuto mag chok osuru ne okan e romb higa mokalo tarik 30  dwe mar auchiel, mantie malo koya gana 3.6 e higa mokalo.

translation.en: While this is a significant improvement, when compared to the country’s population, this number of returns seems unusually low.
translation.luo: Kata kamano ma en medruok mineno, kopim kod kwan jii, kwan mar yuto ni, chalo manitie piny ma ok nochan.

translation.en: The increase in the number of tax returns, is to a large extent, due to the online reporting system, iTax, and a major push by KRA through taxpayer education.
translation.luo: Medruok e kwan yuto mag osuru, duong' mokalo, nikech duoko mag osuru ma itayo e ngue yamo (iTax) , kod okang' maduong' midhiro kod duol mar KRA kokalo puonj ne jochul osuru.

translation.en: There is no doubt that the online system has made filing tax returns significantly easier and gone are the large queues of people witnessed at Times Tower on deadline day.
translation.luo: Onge kiawa e yore tayo weche osuru e ngue yamo, ma oseketo ng'eto bedo mayot miwuoro kendo wich wil gi lai mabocho mag jii mane ineno e apis mar duond choko osuru, Times Tower, chieng' giko ng'eto.

translation.en: That said, there is still much to be done to make filing returns a seamless and painless exercise.
translation.luo: Ka oweyo mano, pod nitiere mang'eny ma onego kete e tim mondo oket ng'ado osuru mayot kendo ma onge yuak.

translation.en: System downtime during filing periods is something that all of us will have experienced, although, in typical Kenyan fashion, we inevitably wait until the last day to file our returns as we do with most things!
translation.luo: Loro mag lai e seche ng'ado osuru e yor ongue yamo,en gima wan waduto waseneno, kata kamano, e kit kenya alisi, ma onge dewo wajarito chieng' giko ng'eto eka mondo wang'ad osuru kaka waja timo kod gik mang'eny!

translation.en: The spreadsheet that one uses to file a return is by no means the simplest to use.  One key issue seems to be that taxpayers are not alerted to changes in the model until they try to upload a return.
translation.luo: Oboke ma ng'ato tiyogo e duoko osuru e yore duto yot tiyogo. Wach achiel mongirore, en ni jochul osuru ok nyisi lokruok nyaka gi tem duoko osuru.

translation.en: The spreadsheet does not allow one to make it more relevant to their sources of income – in essence, it is too rigid and inflexible. KRA should be able to rectify this without too much effort.
translation.luo: Obokeni ok oyiene ng'ato lero kama yutone aye- e ratiro, otek kendo ok oyot loko. KRA owinjore loke maonge chandruok moro amora.

translation.en: Last year was unusual in that different rates of tax were applicable in the first quarter as compared to the rest of the year.
translation.luo: Higa mokalo ne nitiere pogruok kwan mag osuru mane otiigo e kuota mokwongo kipimo gi moko e higa.

translation.en: This followed the Covid-19 relief measures that were introduced in April 2020.
translation.luo: Maye neluore gi chike mag Covid-19 mane oketi e due mar ang'wen 2020.

translation.en: There was much debate about whether the changes were meant to apply for the whole year or whether some form of apportionment was needed.
translation.luo: Ni nitiere ywaruok ewi lokruok mane onego tigo e higa mangima kata kane moko kuomgi ne dwarore.

translation.en: In the end, the decision was made for apportionment.
translation.luo: Gikone paro ne ong'ad mar yiero.

translation.en: One can argue about what the correct treatment should be, but the issue was how long it took for the decision to be made and, indeed, to amend the iTax system.
translation.luo: Ng'ato nyalo baa dhoge kuom gima thieth makare en, makmana ni wach en ni ne okao kende maromo nade mondo ochiu paro, gi mondo olok yore iTax.

translation.en: The age-old notion has always been that the more complex and difficult it is to file a tax return, the more likely it will be that taxpayers simply won’t file their returns.
translation.luo: Paro machon osebedoga ni kata bedoni ng'ado osuru tek made, nyalo bedo ni jii matin ema biro ng'ado osuru.

translation.en: While the issue with the system has been resolved, there is an inherent administrative issue here that must be addressed.
translation.luo: Kata obedo ni yorego mag oselosi, nitiere weche mag tayo apisi mowinjore losi.

translation.en: KRA has to be significantly more proactive in dealing with changes in rates and law to ensure the least inconvenience to taxpayers.
translation.luo: KRA osebedo katemo geng'o lokruok e kwan gi chike e yor temo duok piny chacho jochul osuru.

translation.en: The Capital Markets Authority (CMA) has facilitated the admission of seven firms in the CMA Regulatory Sandbox since its launch in March 2019.
translation.luo: Duol mar Capital Markets Authority (CMA) osetayo rueko mar kembe auchiel e riuruok gi CMA Regulatory Sandbox nyaka noeyange e due mar adek higa 2019.

translation.en: This follows the approval of the Regulatory Sandbox Policy Guidance Note (Regulatory Sandbox PGN) in March 2019.
translation.luo: Maye en kaluore gi andika mag ratiro mag tayo duondno (Regulatory Sandbox PGN) e due mar adek higa 2019.

translation.en: The firms admitted into the Regulatory Sandbox are Pezesha Africa, Innova Limited, Genghis Capital Limited, the Central Depository and Settlement Corporation (CDSC), Pyypl Group Limited, Belrium Kenya Limited and Four Front Management.
translation.luo: Kembe moseruaki e duol mar Regulatory Sandbox gin Pezesha Africa, Innova Limited, Genghis Capital Limited, the Central Depository and Settlement Corporation (CDSC), Pyypl Group Limited, Belrium Kenya Limited gi Four Front Management.

translation.en: The regulator on Monday said it has received 24 applications in robo-advisory, blockchain technology, tokenization of real estate, providing access to global stocks, crowdfunding platforms, Electronic Know Your Customer platform, Screen-Based Security Lending and Borrowing platform, Regtech solutions and Data Analytics.
translation.luo: Chieng wuok tich duondno ne owacho ni oseyudo kwayo 24 e robo-advisory, blockchain technology, tokenization of real estate, providing access to global stocks, crowdfunding platforms, Electronic Know Your Customer platform, Screen-Based Security Lending and Borrowing platform, Regtech solutions and Data Analytics.

translation.en: ”The Authority’s commitment to the introduction of the sandbox is aligned to the Capital Market Master Plan (CMMP, 2014-2023) which identites technological innovation as one of the five centres of excellence of the Kenyan capital markets,’’ said Wyckliffe Shamiah
translation.luo: ”Dwach telo en mondo chakruok mar sandbox oriere tiir gi Capital Market Master Plan (CMMP, 2014-2023) mafwenyo lony manyasani kaka achiel kuom abich mag tiegruok e chiche mag capital piny Kenya,’’  Wyckliffe Shamiah neowacho.

translation.en: He observed that CMA’s keen interest is to proactively review its supervisory and regulatory model to take into consideration the fast-changing environment across the capital markets’ product and services design, infrastructure, and supervision.
translation.luo: Ne oyangorene ni dwach CMA en rango ahinya weche telo gi chike kagi ng'iyo aluora malokore mapiyopiyo e gik miuso e chirni (capital markets), gigetich gi telo.

translation.en: “CMA has been at the forefront of implementing initiatives to stimulate and support the growth of FinTech and innovation within Kenya’s capital markets. In line with its facilitative role, the Authority seeks to provide a conducive regulatory environment for the deployment of innovative FinTech and business models that have the potential to deepen capital markets in Kenya,’’ he added.
translation.luo: “CMA osebedo nyime mar neno ni giketo yore mag nyayo gi konyo dongruok mar FinTech gi lony eyi chirni  (capital markets) e Kenya. Mochimore gi tij techo,  telono dwaro chiwo chike mabeyo mag tayo  keto lony mar FinTech gi yore ohala manayalo yaro chirni (capital markets) e Kenya,’’Ne omedo wacho.

translation.en: The report covers some of the key milestones achieved including SMEs benefitting from funding through the crowdfunding platform operated by Pezesha Limited.
translation.luo: Lupot oting'o wuodhe mideo ma osekale kaka konyruok ne ohendni matindo kuom omenda mochiu kod jii buora ma itayo kod kambi mar Pezesha.

translation.en: It also covers the key lessons the sandbox review committee has learnt, opportunities identified so far and how these will be entrenched to make the future sandbox engagements better.
translation.luo: Kendo oting'o puonj  ahinya ma kamiti mar sandbox odeyudore, thuolo ma osefweny gi sani kod kaka mago ibiro ket e tim mondo obwe twak mag sandbox ekind mabiro.

translation.en: The Authority has also gathered insights to inform the development of a facilitative regulatory framework for Fintechs.
translation.luo: Telo kendo osechoko mago ma ideo mondo onyis dongruok pend chike ne kambi mar Fintechs.

translation.en: Green SME financing receives additional Sh2.1 billion
translation.luo: Ohendni matindo maloso chiemo katiyo kod cham, yudo medruok mar omenda tara 2.1.

translation.en: african Guarantee Fund on Monday received a capital increase of Sh2.145 billion (USD 20 million) from the Danish Investment Fund for Developing Countries (IFU) to facilitate green SME financing in Africa.
translation.luo: Duol mar singo omenda mag duongruok ne pinje mag Afrika  (african Guarantee Fund) chieng' wuoktich noyudo meto mag omenda  chako dongruok mar tara 2.145 billion (Dola gana 20) kowuok e duol mar keto omenda mar Danish ( Danish Investment Fund) ne pinje mapod dongre (IFU) e konyo e yor omenda ohendni matindo maloso chiemo kod cham e Afrika.

translation.en: The capital increase is partially financed by the Danish Government, as part of the Danish “COVID-19 Development Assistance” package.
translation.luo: Medruok mar omenda  mag chako dongruok, bathe ichiwo kod piny owacho ma piny Denmark, e bad kony mar dongruok COVID-19 mar piny (“COVID-19 Development Assistance”).

translation.en: Including the additional Sh2.1 billion, the total Danish investment in AGF amounts to Sh7.7 billion.
translation.luo: Kanyo achiel kod tara 2.1 ma omedi, kwan tee mag omenda moket kod e kido mar omenda mar AGF duto romo tara 7.7.

translation.en: The capital increment into the African Guarantee Fund will increase the Fund’s capacity to unlock financing for Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Africa. SMEs in the continent have experienced a deterioration in their creditworthiness as a result of the economic impact of Covid-19.
translation.luo: Medruok mag omenda e duol mar singo omenda ne pinje Afrika  (African Guarantee Fund)  biro medo kwan omenda michiwo ne ohendni matindo (SMEs) e Afrika. SMEs e Afrika oseneno dok chiem e rom kepo mar hola kaluore kod pek mar  Covid-19.

translation.en: The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa 2020 survey reports business closure, lack of operational cashflow and a drop in demand as the top challenges facing African SMEs as a result of the pandemic.
translation.luo: E lupot mar nonro mar Kamisen mar kungo mar United Nation mar afrika ehiga mar 2020 (United Nations Economic Commission for Africa) lando loro mar ohala, onge mar omenda mag tich, gi dok chien mar dwar kaka pek ma joafrika manigi ohendni matindo yudo kaluore gi midhiero.

translation.en: “The initial Danish capital injection into the African Guarantee Fund not only generated economic and social impact but also helped to attract more capital from other Development Finance Institutions,” said AGF’s CEO, Jules Ngankam.
translation.luo: “Ket mokuongo mar omenda mag dongruok mosingne pinje Afrika (Afrikan Guarantee Fund) gi piny Denmark ne ok okelo kende dongruok e yore mag yuto gi dak, to bende ne gi konyo e kelo omenda moko mag dongruok koa migepe moko machiwo omenda mag dongruok," apisa maduong mar AGF, Jules Ngankam ne owacho. .

translation.en: “With this capital increment, our capacity to offer more green guarantees to financial institutions is enhanced and will facilitate sustainable financing for green transition in Africa,” he said
translation.luo: “Kaluore gi medruok mar omenda, nyalo wa mag chiwo yuto mag cham ne migepe mag omenda omedre kendo biro tayo yuto mag omenda e lokruoge yuto mag cham e Afrika," ne owacho.

translation.en: “Private SMEs are vital for creating and safeguarding decent jobs in Africa, but they face huge challenges in the Covid-19 crisis. We are confident that our investment will attract other investors to exploit the proven potential of SMEs in Africa,” said IFU’s CEO, Torben Huss
translation.luo: “Ohendni matindo mag jii giwegi ochuno e loso gi girito tije mowinjore e Afrika, makmana ni giyudo pek madongo kaluore gi midhiero mar Covid-19. Wan kod chir ni keto mwanduwa biro ywayo jo ket mwandu moko mabiro nono nyalo mag jo ohala matindo e afrika," apisa maduong mar IFU, Torben Huss ne owacho.

translation.en: The ban on logging in public forests three years ago has had mixed results, environmentalists say.
translation.luo: Kum mar tong'o yiende e bunge mar piny owacho higni adek mosekalo okelo paro mopogore, jolony eweche mag aluora wacho.

translation.en: The Environment Ministry in 2018 imposed a nationwide ban on timber harvesting in all public and community forests to allow reassessment and rationalisation of the entire forest sector in the country following calls to save the main water towers.
translation.luo: Migao mar aluora, e higa mar 2018 ne oketo kum mar piny ngima e tong'o bao e bunge mag piny owacho kod mag gwenge mondo ewe mar kuro gi poko mar sekta mar bunge duto e piny kaluore kod dwaro mar kungo kuonde mag pii.

translation.en: But while it has helped improve forest cover, it has also seen the prices of timber more than double as traders cash in on increased demand amid a biting shortage.
translation.luo: Kata obedoni osekonyo emedo lach mar bungu, kendo osekonyo emedruok nyadiriyo enengo bao ka jo ohala yuto e medruok mar dwaro kaluore gi koso yien.

translation.en: According to Earth Journalism Network, an Internews and Internews Europe project, more than 100,000 hectares of the Mau Forest had been destroyed as of the year 2000.
translation.luo: Kaluore gi tudruok mar jofwambo mong'ere kaka Earth Journalism Network, dongruok mar Internews and Internews Europe, heka moingo 100,000 mar bungu mar Mau ne osekethi e higa mar 2000.

translation.en: And according to United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), up to 107,000 hectares of the Mau Forest Complex’s 416,000 hectares were destroyed between 1990 and 2001.
translation.luo: Kendo kaluore gi United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), nyaka heka 107,000 mar bungu Mau Complex, heka 416,000 ne okethi ekind higa 1990 kod 2001.

translation.en: Environmentalists also claim the initiative has not done much in boosting forest cover but has instead created a shortage that has, in turn, led to unchecked cutting down of trees in private farmlands to fill the gap.
translation.luo: Jolony eweche mag aluora bende wachoni dongruogno pok osetimo mang'eny e chwalo lach mar bungu to osekelo chuok mabende osemedo ng'eto mopondo e pouthe jii wegi, mosepong'o thuolo modong'.

translation.en: Initially, the State had planned to improve forest cover by 10 per cent by 2022, a target that now seems out of reach.
translation.luo: Echakruok, piny owacho ne ochano meto  mar lach bunge gi atamalo 10 eromb higa 2022, gombo ma neno matek chope.

translation.en: The Environment Ministry last year said Sh48 billion is needed to implement the strategy, with Environment and Forestry Principal Secretary Chris Kiptoo lamenting the lack of financial support from the National Treasury.
translation.luo: Migao mar aluora e higa mokalo ne owacho ni omenda mar billion 48 dwarore e chopo parono, ekinde ma jagoro mongirore eweche aluora kod bunge Chris Kiptoo ywago koso kony mar omenda koa kuom migao mar omenda.

translation.en: Other stakeholders say the ban has nearly doubled the demand for timber products, making Kenya a net importer of wood from countries such as Malawi, Uganda, Congo and Tanzania.
translation.luo: Jokanyo mamoko wacho ni kum osemedo nyadiriyo  dwaro mag gige bao, mosemiyo piny Kenya nyiewo bao koa pinje maoko kaka Malawi, Uganda, Congo gi Tanzania.

translation.en: Kinoro David, a Nairobi-based timber trader who imports timber from Malawi through Tanzania, said it takes him over one week to get the cargo into the country.
translation.luo: Kinoro David, maen ja ohand bao ma Nairobi manyiewo bao koa  Malawi kokalo Tanzania, neowacho ni kawe wige mokalo achiel mondo uyud msigo donjo e piny Kenya.

translation.en: “There is high demand for timber driven by the construction sector and furniture business. It is, however, a struggle to get the product following the ban; local private farms which provided an option cannot meet the demand, forcing us to rely on imports from neighbouring countries,” said Mr Kinoro.
translation.luo: “Nitiere dwaro mamalo mag bao ma ijiwo gi sekta mar kedo gi ohand bao. Kata kamano, okyot yudo bao kaluoregi kum; Puodhe jii wegi oknyal chopo konyo dwaro, machunowa geno kuom bepe ma oa oko e pinje moluorowa,” Migosi Kinoro owacho.

translation.en: “Before the 2018 ban, we sold a board foot (bf) for Sh40, but the price has more than doubled to Sh100. The time taken to get the product to the Kenyan market is another issue, making the business cumbersome.”
translation.luo: “Kapok ne ogol kum higa mar 2018,  ne wauso fut mar bao (board foot (bf)) e nengo mar Sh40, gi sani nengo osemedore mokalo nyadiriyo nyaka Sh100. Seche mikao mar kelo bao e chiro mar Kenya en wach machielo, mamaiyo ohala bedo matek.”

translation.en: Most of the imported timber includes pine, cypress and mahogany.
translation.luo: Ng'eny bao minyiewo oko  gin kaka, pine, cypress gi mahogany.

translation.en: Uganda, Malawi, and Tanzania are the key source markets for pine and cypress, while mahogany is mainly sourced from Congo.
translation.luo: Uganda, Malawi, gi Tanzania e chirni mongirore mag bepe mag pine gi cypress, ka bao mar mahogany wuok e piny mar Congo.

translation.en: The National Alliance of Community Forest Association Secretary Gerald Ngatia noted that since the implementation of the logging ban, tea factories, schools and other institutions dependent on public forests for wood products have been affected greatly.
translation.luo: Jagoro mar riuruok mar bunge e kor gwenge (The National Alliance of Community Forest Association) Gerald Ngatia noyudo ni chakre ket kum mar ng'ado yiende , kembe chai , skunde kod migepe mamoko ma otenre kuom bunge sirikal e gige bao, oseyudo lokruok maduong'.

translation.en: “Public forests produce the bulk of wood used locally. We are seeing massive harvesting of trees going on in private farms to fill the supply gap, which is still not enough,” said Mr Ngatia.
translation.luo: “Bepe mang'eny ma itiyogo e kor gweng'  yudore koya e bunge mag piny owacho. Ng'eto mag yiende mang'eny, waneno ka aye e puothe jii wegi mondo opong' dwaro mabende pod okrom,” Migosi Ngatia ne owacho.

translation.en: “Saw millers, who depended on public forests, are facing the auctioneers’ hammer.”
translation.luo: “Jo ng'ad bepe mane ogeno e bunge mag piny owacho, neno pek mar jopecho.”

translation.en: The government imposed a moratorium on logging in public and community forests in 2018.
translation.luo: Piny owacho ne oketo kum mar tong'o e bunge mag piny owacho kod mag gweng'e e higa 2018.

translation.en: The ministry of environment has implemented the ban in phases.
translation.luo: Migao mar aluora noketo kum e kidienje.

translation.en: Initially, it started as a three-month ban before it was increased to six months and later one year.
translation.luo: Mokuongo ne ochakre kaka kuom mar dweche adek kapok ne omede nyaka dweche auchiel kendo bange nyaka  higa achiel.

translation.en: Last November, Environment Cabinet Secretary Keriako Tobiko partially lifted the logging ban in public and community forests.
translation.luo: Dwe mar apar kod achiel mokalo, jatend migao mar aluora ne ochungo kum moko mag ng'ado yien e bunge piny owacho kod mag gwenge.

translation.en: The move was to allow for harvesting and disposal of mature and over-mature forest plantations for an area not exceeding 5,000 hectares.
translation.luo: Chenro no ne en mar chiwo thuolo mar keyo gi golo yiende motegno gi yiende motii e bungu e aluora ma ok okalo heka 5,000.

translation.en: “Having considered the recommendations of both the Board of Management of Kenya Forest Service..., the government has decided that the moratorium on logging in public and community forests shall continue but varied and or modified to allow for harvesting and disposal of mature forest plantations,” said Tobiko.
translation.luo: “Bang' rango dwaro mag  bod mar Kenya Forest Service..., piny owacho ne ong'ado ni kum mag tong'o yien e bunge piny owacho gi mag gwenge biro dhi nyime, to biro pogore gi kata yiere gi keyo kod golo mag yiende motegno gi ma otii e bunge,” Tobiko ne owacho.

translation.en: He said the harvesting and disposal would be oversighted by a multi-agency team.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni keyo kod golo ibiro chung'ne gi kanyakla mar multi-agency.

translation.en: Despite the partial lifting of the ban, Timber Manufacturers Association (TMA) say the industry is still bleeding from the government’s directive, with many saw millers forced to close shop amid piling debts.
translation.luo: Ka opogore gi golo kum moko, riuruok mar kembe mag bao (Timber Manufacturers Association (TMA)) wacho ni kambi pod hinyore kaluore kod chike mag piny owacho, ma ochuno jotong' bao mang'eny loro kaluore gi gope mang'eny.

translation.en: TMA Communications Secretary Clement Nyoro said the industry directly employs 50,000 people and relies on government forests for timber.
translation.luo: Jagoro mar tudruok mar TMA Clement Nyoro ne owacho ni kambe ondiko  wang' achiel jii 50,000 ma ogeno yudo bao e bunge mag piny owacho.

translation.en: He said the move had left mature trees set for harvest to rot away.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni kum no ne oweyo yiende keyo motegno mondo otou.

translation.en: He added that the industry injected close to Sh500 million annually into the economies of such towns as Njoro, Elburgon, Molo and Timboroa, which have now been left desolate.
translation.luo: Ne omedo wacho ni kembe ne oketo omenda ma chiegni romo Sh500 million higa ka higa, e yuto mag bombe kaka Njoro, Elburgon, Molo gi Timboroa, masani en lela.

translation.en: Kenya has a forest cover of 7.4 per cent of its land area compared to 12 per cent 50 years ago.
translation.luo: Piny Kenya sani nigi lach mar bunge maromo atamalo 7.4 mar aluorane kopim kod atamalo 12 e higni 50 mokalo.

translation.en: The ban restricted the extraction of timber from the forests to give KFS more time to implement measures to protect forests.
translation.luo: Kumno ne ogeng'o tongo mar bao kowuok e bunge, mondo ochiw ne KFS thuolo mar keto e tim chike mag rito bunge.

translation.en: Kebs wants all thermal guns re-calibrated
translation.luo: Kebs dwaro ni gige pimo liet (thermal guns) oketne gi ranyisi machielo.

translation.en: The standards body has asked owners of thermal guns (non-contact infrared thermometer) to re-calibrate them to improve the accuracy of their readings.
translation.luo: Duol mar rang'iny ne osekwayo weg gige pimo liet (thermal guns (non-contact infrared thermometer) mondo oketnegi kendo ranyisi machielo mondo ojiw somo.

translation.en: The gadgets are used to check temperatures in public places and hospitals in the fight against Covid-19.
translation.luo: Gige pimo go itiyogo e pimo liet e kuonde moyangre ne jii duto gi ute thieth e geng'o midhiero mar Covid-19.

translation.en: Kenya Bureau of Standards (Kebs) said the re-calibration ought to take into account any ‘drift’ or low change in the response of a gauge - in the course of their use.
translation.luo: Kenya Bureau of Standards (Kebs) ne owacho ni nwoyo keto ranyisi onego nee lokruok manyalo betie kata lokruok mapiny eduok mar rapim - ekinde ma itiyo kodgi.

translation.en: This has been occasioned by instances of faulty readings of these devices which are now mandatory in all public spaces for screening possible Covid-19 cases.
translation.luo: Ma osenere e kinde ma rapim masani ochuno ni nyaka tigo e kuonde moyangore e pimo Covid-19,  chiwo somo ma oknikare.

translation.en: Drifting on measurement gadgets occurs as part of the ageing process of some of the components of the device or changes in the environment among them humidity or temperatures.
translation.luo: Pogruok e gige pimo timore kaka achiel kuom tiyo mar moko kuom kido maggi kata lokruok mar aluora ekindgi ng'ich ekor lwasi kata liet.

translation.en: Any temperature above 37.5 degrees Celsius is considered above normal, hence a suspected Covid-19 case.
translation.luo: Liet moroamora ma malo ne digri 37.5  ineno ni ok ber, kamano mano kelo chich mar bedo gi Covid-19.

translation.en: Josephat Bangi, who heads the metrology department at the Kenya Bureau of Standards, said one sign that the thermal gun needs to be re-calibrated is when it becomes ‘erratic’ when giving readings.
translation.luo: Josephat Bangi, motelo ne migao mar korlwasi e Kenya Bureau of Standards, ne owacho ni achiel kuom madwarore e keto kendo ranyisi e rapim en ka ochiwo somo mokowinjore.

translation.en: “People have their temperature taken and it turns out to be not as expected or not specific,” he explained.
translation.luo: “E pimo liet mar del kendo duoko ok wuogi kaka iparo kata eyo maler,” ne olero.

translation.en: When you notice your thermal gun is erratic, and it gives erratic measurements, then it could be time for it to be re-calibrated.
translation.luo: Ka ifwenyo ni rapimni ok tii eyo makare kendo ochiwo somo ma ok owinjore, onego bed saa mar keto ranyisi machielo.

translation.en: Bangi says while some thermal guns have an upper limit reading of 42 degrees Celsius, some can go to 50.
translation.luo: Bangi wacho ni e kinde ma rapim moko nyalo chiwo somo mamalo mar digris 42, moko nyalo chopo nyaka digris 50.

translation.en: “Some are also affected by magnetism,” he said.
translation.luo: “Moko inyalo roch gi ywecho (magnetism),” ne owacho.

translation.en: Sometimes, he noted, depends on the manufacturer’s instructions.
translation.luo: Sechemoko, ne oneno, kaluore gi chike mag kembe malosogi.

translation.en: “What is recommended depends on the frequency of use. There are places where thermo guns measure small populations, maybe you have five people in your institution while there are other organisations where the number of people being measured in a day is so huge and the thermo gun is so busy the whole day,” he explained.
translation.luo: “Ma dwarore luore kod nyadidi mitiyo kode. Nitiere kuonde ma rapimgo pimo oganda matin, seche moko in kod jii abich e kari mar tich, e seche ma kembe moko ni kod jii mang'eny mowinjore pim e odiochieng' kendo rapim tiyo ahinya e odiochieng' alanga,” ne olero.

translation.en: Some manufacturers would recommend after a year but there are no uniform timelines as this depends on the frequency of use.
translation.luo: Kembe moko maloso rapimgo nyalo dwaro loko bang higa, kata onge kinde machal nikech ma luoregi gi kaka itiyo kode.

translation.en: While Kenya’s history is replete with economic blueprints ranging from Vision 2030 to the Big Four Agenda, there has not been clear articulation of the principles guiding the collection of revenue to fund the country’s growth plans.
translation.luo: E seche ma sigand Kenya opong' gi lek mag dongruok (economic blueprints) kochakre e Vision 2030 nyaka Big Four Agenda, pok osebete winjruok maler mag chike matayo choko yuto e gero chenro mag dongruog piny.

translation.en: And as Kenyans find themselves facing a mountain of debt and its attendant high taxation policies that touch on everything from bread to infant milk, the anger is palpable.
translation.luo: Kendo e kinde ma jokenya yudore e ohinga mar gope gi chike mapek mag osuru mamulo gimoro amora koya e makate nyaka chag nyithindo matindo, pek ng'eny.

translation.en: Now more than ever, there is a great need to have a new tax policy that outlines the principles that will guide the Kenyan economy into prosperity.
translation.luo: Sani moloyo kinde duto tee, nitiere dwaro maduong' mar keto chik matiyo tayo chal mar ngima dak e yuto maber.

translation.en: Ideas around taxation principles have been floated by various thinkers over the last few centuries.
translation.luo: Paro maluoro chike golo osuru osegol kod jii mang'eny e higni mang'eny mosekalo.

translation.en: Adam Smith wrote in the Wealth of Nations that “…the economic incomes of private people are of three main types: rent, wages and profit. Ordinary taxpayers will ultimately pay their taxes from at least one of these revenue sources.”
translation.luo: Adam Smith nondiko e Wealth of Nations ni“…yuto mar dak mag jii kendgi nitiere e kido adek madong'o: chudo mag udi, osara kod ohala. Jo chul osuru ma ok deu biro chulo osuru koya e achiel kuom yore yuto gi.”

translation.en: In his mind, Smith must have classified the entire economy into the three factors of production of land, labour and enterprise.
translation.luo: Gi pache, Smith nenore ni ne opogo chal mar ngima dak e piny mangima, e kidienje adek mag yuto kaka lowo, tich kod ohala.

translation.en: His ideas have been enriched over time and today we also include the fourth factor of production which is capital - whose income is in the form of interest.
