translation.luo: Pache oseket e tim e kinde mosekalo kendo sani wamedo kidieny machielo mar ang'wen mar yuto ma en chakruok mag dongruok- ma yuto ne nitiere e kido mar hola ma onyuol.

translation.en: In many ways, these four factors of production might be compared to the four legs of a table that give it stability and balance.
translation.luo: E yore mang'eny, kidienje ang'wen mag yuto gi inyalo pim kod tiende ang'wen mamiyo mesa chung' motegno kendo maonge mbekni.

translation.en: They are the four building blocks of the economy – emphasising one at the expense of others creates an imbalance and generates instability across the entire system.
translation.luo: Gin e oinga ang'wen magero chal mar ngima dak e piny– tiyo kod achiel ma oingo mamoko kelo yombruok kendo mbekni e lai tee mag piny.

translation.en: Of all the four factors of production, it is the entrepreneur who has borne the brunt of over taxation.
translation.luo: Ewi kidienje ang'wen mag yuto, jachak ohala ema osekelo pek mar osuru mamalo.

translation.en: From the introduction of the digital service tax targeting online businesses to the increase in VAT on fuel products, and now with the controversial minimum tax laws, the catalogue of obstacles facing the business community is alarming.
translation.luo: Chakre fweny mar chudo e yore manyasani mang'iyo ohendni ma itimo e kor yamo e medruok mar VAT ne gige moo, kendo masani ni kod pogruok e kwan mapiny mag chike osuru, nitiere ng'eny mag rageng' marocho ohendni mitimo e kor gwenge.

translation.en: All this while, the Covid pandemic is ravaging the economy, leaving many jobless and contributing to a very restless environment.
translation.luo: E kind gi tee, midhiero mar Covid muomo chal ngima mar dak, makelo rumo mang'eny mar tich kendo koso kue e aluora.

translation.en: Whereas many might hope that the full reopening of the economy will help mitigate this harsh environment, there is a wave of discontentment across the country that calls for a fundamental transformation of our economic model into one that values and promotes enterprise and innovation.
translation.luo: E seche ma ng'eny jii geno ni yauruok piny biro tieko aluora ma ok ber, nitiere luoro e kor piny madwaro lokruok mokuongo e chal ngima mar dak nyaka emano manitiere kod ber kendo majiwo ohala kod pok.

translation.en: In sharp contrast, the factor of production associated with capital appears to have been spared from the harsh taxation regime evident in the other areas.
translation.luo: E pogruok, kidieny mar chudo mar omenda mag dongruok, nenore ka gima ne onguone e chudo mar osuru kaka ineno kuonde mamoko.

translation.en: The Treasury proposal to remove the excise tax of 20 per cent on bank loans will lessen the tax load in the banking sector by up to Sh7 billion annually.
translation.luo: Dwaro migao mar omenda e golo osuru mar atamalo 20 e gope mag bengi biro duoko chien pek mar chulo osuru e sekta mag bengi nyaka madwaro romo omenda mar Sh7 billion higa ka higa.

translation.en: There was a promise that this could see banks reducing loan costs, but these claims have been impeached by evidence on the ground pointing to the contrary.
translation.luo: Nenitiere singo manemiyo bengi duoko nengo mag hola chien, kata kamano wechegi ne  othir kod ranyisi mopogore.

translation.en: Such examples reinforce a narrative that Kenya’s economic model is anchored on punishing enterprise but rewarding capital.
translation.luo: Ranyisi machalo kamgo osebedo kawachore ni chal mar ngima dak e Kenya en mar kumo ohendni kendo chiwo omenda mag dongruok.

translation.en: In the final analysis, a sense of balance and stability can only be achieved through a new tax policy that equally draws from all the factors of production.
translation.luo: E nonro mogik, Chung' motegno kendo maonge bekni inyalo chope kokalo e chike manyien mag osuru koa e kidienje mag yuto.

translation.en: Through a spirit of shared responsibility, Kenya can be able to raise enough tax revenue without one party feeling overburdened.
translation.luo: Kokalo e kanyakla mar kao ting', Kenya nyalo choko osuru moromo ma bat moro ok owinjo pek.

translation.en: A song released about 14 years ago by the group Boomba Clan, titled ‘African Timer’ talked about how Africans rarely keep time.
translation.luo: Riuruok maong'ere kaka Boomba Clan, higni 14 mokalo ne ogolo wer milungoni  'African Timer’, mawuoyo ewi kaka Joafrika tinne gi rito saa.

translation.en: But all over Kenya, the motorbikes, popularly known as bodaboda, have been an antidote to the ‘lateness syndrome’.
translation.luo: Kuonde tee Kenya, apiko, mong'ere kaka bodaboda, osebedo thieth mar 'tuwo lewo’.

translation.en: Due to their speed and convenience, the bikes have seen their popularity skyrocket, even earning their way into ride-hailing apps such as Uber and Bolt.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi ng'wech kod yot, apiko oseng'ere kendo yudo thuolo e apps kaka Uber gi Bolt.

translation.en: One thing, though, is weighing down this transport sub-sector: the cost of fuel.
translation.luo: Makmana ni nengo mar moo duoko yoregi mag wuoth chien.

translation.en: John Njeru has been in the bodaboda business in Nairobi’s central business district for the past six years and he says he has experienced a sharp rise in fuel costs.
translation.luo: John Njeru osebedo jaohala mar apiko echuny boma ma Nairobi kuom higni auchiel mokalo kendo owacho ni en gi lony mamalo e medruok  e nengo mag moo.

translation.en: “Back in 2015 when I was starting off my business, I would use Sh200 worth of petrol for a whole day. Today my fuel cost ranges Sh500 to Sh1,000,” he says.
translation.luo: “Chien e higa mar 2015 kane achako ohanda ne anyalo tiyo gi Sh200 odiechieng' e nyiewo  moo. Tinde to kwanda mar moo chakore e Sh500 nyaka Sh1,000,” ne owacho.

translation.en: Fuel consumed by the motorbikes varies with how large the engine is; more powerful engines will consume more.
translation.luo: Mafuta ma joapiko tiyogo  luwore gi duong mar injin. Injin matekone ng'eny modho mang'eny.

translation.en: “Brands such as TVS, Boxer and SkyGo consume more petrol compared to other motorbikes,” says Njeru.
translation.luo: “Nyinge kaka TVS, Boxer kod SkyGo modho moo mang'eny kopim kod apikni moko,” Njeru wacho.

translation.en: “The high consumers hold an advantage, especially here in Nairobi CBD where we do deliveries of heavy products, which need more power.”
translation.luo: “Joapiko mamodho mang'eny nitiere maber, moloyo to e chuny boma ma Nairobi kama watere mwandu madongo madwaro teko mang'eny."

translation.en: Joseph Gikaru is a young man who joined the bodaboda industry two years ago.
translation.luo: Joseph Gikaru en rawera mane odonjo e ohand apiko higni ariyo mokalo.

translation.en: He says after the recent reopening of the economy, more people are commuting and he is ferrying more customers, yet his profits have not improved.
translation.luo: Owacho ni kata bang yepo mar piny, jowuoth pod ng'eny kendo oting'o ng'enygi to yuto ok medore.

translation.en: “My bike consumes more since I do more trips but fuel cost is quite high, keeping my profits at the same level,” he says.
translation.luo: “Apikona modho man'geny nikech atimo wuodhe mang'eny kata kamano nengo moo podni malo, mapod okmed yutona,” ne owacho.

translation.en: I used to buy Sh400 worth of petrol for a day, now I use Sh600.
translation.luo: E odiechieng' ne ajanyiewo moo mar Sh400, tinde atiyo kod Sh600.

translation.en: The traffic gridlock in Nairobi has also contributed to higher bodaboda usage.
translation.luo: Jam mar Nairobi osekelo ohala maduong' ne jo apiko.

translation.en: It is a critical balance between cost of transport and convenience.
translation.luo: Osekelo mbekni e kind neng'o wuodh kod yot mar wuodh apiko.

translation.en: But with many people’s disposable income reducing from the impact of Covid-19, Gikaru has observed that a good number of commuters would rather wait in traffic in a matatu than take a bodaboda, which is costlier.
translation.luo: Kaka mag jii mang'eny ne odok chien kaluore gi midhiero mar Covid-19, Gikaru oseneno ni jowuoth mang'eny oloyo obed e nyamburko mantie e jam kar kawo apiko ma neng'o ne tek.

translation.en: Chacha Nyaigoti Bichiang'a Personal Financial expert and Coach.
translation.luo: Chacha Nyaigoti Bichiang'a jalony kendo japuonj e yore omenda.

translation.en: He is also the author of the book Mastering your money.
translation.luo: Mabende ondiko buk mar Mastering your money.

translation.en: The subject of money is emotive and controversial, especially among Africans.
translation.luo: Weche mag tije omenda kelo ywaruok ahinya ahinya e kind joafrika.

translation.en: It is the number one cause of conflicts in families and institutions.
translation.luo: En e tiend ywaruok e oganda gi migepe.

translation.en: The big question however is: Why do many people experience many problems with money?
translation.luo: Penjo malich en: Ang'o momiyo jii mang'eny yudo chandruok gi pesa?

translation.en: Personal financial coach Chacha Nyaigoti Bichiang’a argues that the main root cause of financial problems is lack of financial mastery and literacy.
translation.luo: Chacha Nyaigoti Bichiang’a, ma en japuonj mar weche omenda wachoni chakruok mar thagruok mag omenda en koso ng'eyo gi rieko.

translation.en: A past survey conducted by the World Bank showed that many people around the world are financially illiterate but the numbers are high in low-income countries.
translation.luo: Kaluore gi nonro mane otim gi World Bank nyiso ni oganda mang'eny e piny onge gi rieko mar omenda moloyo to e pinje ma yuto gi nipiny.

translation.en: The study adds that low level of financial literacy has led to adverse financial outcomes.
translation.luo: Nonro medo ni rieko matin mag weche omenda osekelo buok e weche mag omenda.

translation.en: Even so, society is still struggling to come to terms with the myths and misconceptions people have about the concept of money, which emanates from the way they were brought up.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ogendni temo mondo obed gi winjo e weche ma jii wacho e wi omenda, ma owuok e dongo gi.

translation.en: “The way we were brought up when young, relating with parents, school system, religious groups, and mass media are all agents of socialisation that have made us develop certain beliefs about money,” said Bichiang’a, a personal financial coach and author of mastering your money.
translation.luo: “Kaka nw wadongo, ng'iyo gi jonyuo, jopuonje, riuruok mag lamo, kod todruok gin yore mag ng'iyo ma osetiego pachwa e yie weche moko mag omenda,” Bichiang’a, ma en japuonj mar weche omenda kendo jandiko ma buk mar mastering your money ne owacho.

translation.en: To take stock of the evidence, Kenya has well-trained financial experts yet it has a lot of controversies concerning money.
translation.luo: Ka wang'iyo mos, Kenya nigi jolony eweche  mag omenda pogruok en ni en gi ywaruok eweche omenda.

translation.en: Talk of money-laundering, high debts and poor economic growth that forces investors to rethink their plans.
translation.luo: Wuo kuom mibadhi mag pesa, gope ma malo kod thiro dongruok eyore yuto machuno joket mwandu elimo pachgi.

translation.en: This has something to do with poor financial management.
translation.luo: Maye ikelo gi yore morem mag tayo omenda.

translation.en: Churches have fallen victim of disintegration due to the impact brought about by money.
translation.luo: Ute lamo osepogre nikech weche omenda.

translation.en: For a long time, money has been defined as a medium of exchange.
translation.luo: Kuom kinde malach, pesa osebedo kaka yoo mar loko.

translation.en: However, over the years, money has undergone a transformation.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, kuom higni mang'eny omenda oseyudo lokruok.

translation.en: Right from barter trade, metallic coins such as silver and gold, to paper money.
translation.luo: Ka oa kuom ohala mag wilo, pesa mag chuma kaka silver gi gold nyaka pesa mag oboke.

translation.en: Now we are talking about digital currencies that can also be referred to as e-money.
translation.luo: Sani walose e omenda mag lony mag yamo ma bende iluongo ni e-money.

translation.en: We can now conduct business using electronic means such as electronic funds transfer- M-Pesa, and even pay our bills using digital money.
translation.luo: Sani wanyalo timo ohala kokalo e yore mag ong'we yamo kaka- M-Pesa, kod kata chudo kokalo e yore manyasani.

translation.en: The other form of currency, which has been introduced in the country, but has not been fully accepted is Cryptocurrency.
translation.luo: Yoo machielo mar omenda mosekel to pok oyiego en mar Cryptocurrency.

translation.en: A good example is Bitcoin which even the Central Bank of Kenya has not allowed for widespread use.
translation.luo: Ranyisi maber en Bitcoin makata bengi maduong' mar Kenya poko oyie gi landruok gi.

translation.en: Money therefore can be said to be more than a medium of exchange but a store of value.
translation.luo: Omenda koro inyalo wach ni okalo yor loko kendo nyiso mwandu.

translation.en: This means that with Sh1000, you can decide to buy shares at the Nairobi Securities Exchange.
translation.luo: Mano nyiso ni gi Sh1000, inyalo nyiewo pok e Nairobi Securities Exchange.

translation.en: “You simply store the value of money in the shares. So, when you buy 100 shares of Safaricom using Sh1,000, that means the value of your money is in the shares that you have bought,” said Bichiang’a.
translation.luo: “Inyalo mana kano mwandu mar pesa e pok. Koro, ka inyalo nyiewo pok 100 mar Safaricom ka itiyo gi Sh1,000,  ngeche ni mwandu mag pesi nitiere e pok ma inyiewo,” Bichiang’a ne owacho.

translation.en: According to Bichiang’a, money can also be an idea.
translation.luo: Kaluore gi Bichiang’a, omenda bende nyaklo bedo paro.

translation.en: For one to make money, one needs to come up with an idea which can generate money.
translation.luo: Mondo olos omenda, owinjore mondo ng'ato ogol paro manyalo kelo omenda.

translation.en: And this is where creativity kicks in.
translation.luo: Kaye ema paro maliewu donje.

translation.en: Wealth can be determined by how much one is able to generate.
translation.luo: Mwandu nyalo ng'e kaluwore gi kwan mang'ato nyalo golo.

translation.en: He said even M-Pesa money transfer platform itself was an idea which has made Safaricom one of the biggest companies in East and Central Africa.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni ohala mar oro pesa gi M-Pesa owuon bende ne en paro ma osemiyo Safaricom bedo achiel kuom kembe madongo e africa Ugwe kod Madiere.

translation.en: “By coming up with an idea, it means the idea can now fade and earn income which can then be stored in properties or in valuable means of owning wealth,” Bichiang’a said.
translation.luo: “Kelo paro, en nyiso ni parono nyalo rumo kendo kelo yuto ma inyalo kan  eyore mwandu kata yore mongirore mag bedo gi mwandu," chiang’a ne owacho.

translation.en: Motorists using super petrol will have to dig deeper into their pockets after the government increased the price of the fuel by Sh3.56 per litre, pushing the cost to Sh126.37 in Nairobi.
translation.luo: Joriemb nyamburko matiyo gi super petrol biro medo tiyo gi pesa mang'eny bang piny owacho medo nengo mar moo gi Sh3.56 ewi lita, mano ne ochwalo nengo nyaka Sh126.37 e boma ma Nairobi.

translation.en: Users of diesel and kerosene were, however, spared the hike with the cost of the two products remaining unchanged for the third consecutive month.
translation.luo: Joti gi diesel gi kerosene, kata kamano, ne ok oyudo medruok e nengo e dueche adek moluwore.

translation.en: In its latest price guideline released yesterday, the Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority (Epra) also restored the margins for oil marketing companies, which had been slashed last month in a move to cushion Kenyans from a price increase.
translation.luo: E ratiro mane ogol achien nyoro, duol matayo weche teko (Energy and Petroleum Regulatory Authority (Epra)) bende ne oduoko yuto mag chich kembe mauso moo mane rik ong'adi duwe mokalo, mondo ogeng' jokenya e medruok mar nengo.

translation.en: “In the period under review, the price for super petrol increases by Sh3.56 per litre while that of diesel and kerosene remains unchanged,” said Epra in a statement signed by acting director-general Daniel Kiptoo.
translation.luo: “E kinde mag lokruok, nengo mar super petrol  ne omedore gi Sh3.56 elita ka mano mar diesel kod kerosene ne odong' ma ok oloki,” Epra ne owacho e andike mane oket sei kod e loo jatelo maduong' Daniel Kiptoo.

translation.en: Diesel, heavily used by transporters and manufacturers, will sell at Sh107.66 in Nairobi while kerosene, a lighting and cooking fuel largely for the poor, will retail at Sh97.85 in the capital.
translation.luo: Diesel, mitiyogo gi jonyambruko gi kembe maloso gik moko biro usore e nengo mar Sh107.66 e boma ma Nairobi ka kerosene, mitiyogo eneno kod tet ahinya gi jochan, biro usore e nengo mar Sh97.85 e boma maduong'.

translation.en: The hike in the price of petrol came despite a drop in the cost of crude oil in April, when the products that will be consumed in the country over the May-June pricing cycle were procured.
translation.luo: Medruok e nengo mar Petrol ne obiro kata obedoni ne nitiere dok chien e nengo moo mapok opuodhi e due mar ang'wen, kane inyiewo mwandu mag tich e due mar Mei-Jun.

translation.en: Epra may, however, have factored in the costs associated with the price stabilisation in April and that spared consumers higher prices.
translation.luo: Epra, kata kamano, ne nyalo bedo ni ong'eyo tegno e nengo, due mar ang'wen kendo mane nyalo geng'o nengo mamalo ne jonyiepo.

translation.en: At Sh126.37 per litre, petrol will be retailing at its highest since September 2018 when it reached Sh127.8 per litre after the government introduced 16 per cent value-added tax (VAT) on fuel.
translation.luo: E nengo mar Sh126.37 e lita, petrol biro bedo ni ousore e nengo mamalo,kaluwore ni  Septemba 2018 mane nengo neochopo Sh 127.8 e lita,  bang piny owacho medo osuru mar VAT e atamalo 16 kuom petrol.

translation.en: The high prices were short-lived, though, as the government reduced the VAT rate to eight per cent after yielding to public outcry.
translation.luo: Nengo mamalo go ne ok obudho kata, nikechi sirkal ne oduoko chien osuru mar VAT gi atamalo aboro bang winjo ywak jopiny.

translation.en: When it retained April-May prices at the same level as March, Epra and the Petroleum ministry had brokered a deal with the oil marketing companies to slash their margins, but later be compensated by the National Treasury.
translation.luo: Ka oweyo nengo mar due mar April - Mei  ma ok olokore kod due mar adek, Epra kod migao mar Petrol ne odonjo e winjruok mar duoko chien yuto margi gi kembe moko mag uso moo, mondo gikone ochulgi gi migao mar omenda.

translation.en: The companies took a Sh4.44 cut per litre of petrol.
translation.luo: Kembego ne orwako ng'eto mar Sh4.44 e lita mar petrol.

translation.en: The cut was less on kerosene at Sh3.47 and diesel at Sh2.28 per litre.
translation.luo: Nengono ne ni piny e kerosene gi Sh3.47 kod diesel gi Sh2.28 e lita.

translation.en: In all, it is estimated that the total amount taken from the marketers last month was Sh1.34 billion.
translation.luo: Duto, ne wachore ni e due mokalo kwano tee mane okau kuom jouso ne en Sh1.34 billion.

translation.en: While Treasury refunded the oil marketers the Sh1.34 billion, there was an extra cost of Sh0.50 per litre of fuel, said to be the administrative cost of processing and disbursing the compensation to the oil firms.
translation.luo: Kane migao mar omenda ne oduoko ne jouso Sh 1.34 billion, ne nitiere chudo moko mar  Sh0.50 e lita mar mafuta, mane owachore ni ne gin mag yore mag loso gi keyo chudo mag kembe moo.

translation.en: The amount was to be passed to the consumer and recovered over the May-June pricing cycle.
translation.luo: Nengono ne onego chwalne jonyiepo kendo yudi e dueche chudo mag Mei-June.

translation.en: The fee was due to four companies that imported fuel under the Open Tender System (OTS), who were charged with disbursing the refunds from Treasury.
translation.luo: Omendano ne odong ne kembe ang'wen mane nyiewo moo ka oa oko ebuo duol mar Open Tender System (OTS), mane omi ting mar pogo gi chudo koa migao mar omenda.

translation.en: The marketers and the Petroleum ministry officials had at an April 15 meeting agreed that the Sh0.50 per litre was a prudent cost incurred in the delivery of petroleum products to Kenyans.
translation.luo: E romo mar jotene mag jouso kod migao mar petrol mane otimore April tarik 15 ne okalo ni Sh0.50 e lita nenikare e chopo gige petrol ne jokenya.

translation.en: OTS is a Petroleum Ministry supervised system that pools the fuel needs of the oil firms and the marketers that bid to import at low prices get the job.
translation.luo: OTS en lai migao mar petrol matayo dwaro mag moo mag kembe kod jouso mayudo tich bang goyo nengo mapiny mag moo ka oa oko.

translation.en: The exhibition also displays the typewriter which he banged his famous plays on, a record player that will play his favorite vinyl records to viewers, awards scooped along the way and personal effects including his famous cowboy hat and kitenge shirt.
translation.luo: Kar nyiso gik moko bende nyiso tapreta mane ondike tukene manigi huma, thum saende ma biro wero saende mane ohero ne joyuoro, mich mane ochodho e kindene kod gigene owuon ma oriwo ogute mopedhore mar jokwath kod law kitenge mong'ere.

translation.en: Exhibition reveals Francis Imbuga’s creativity
translation.luo: Kar nyiso gik moko yango lony mar Francis Imbuga

translation.en: In air of fanfare and celebration reigned at Kenyatta International Convection Centre on Saturday evening when two renowned American music groups performed.
translation.luo: Kar romo ma Kenyatta International Convection Centre ne opong' gi muya mar nyasi chieng' Jumamos godhiambo ka ne grube ariyo mag jower ma Amerka ne goe ngolo.

translation.en: Enthusiastic audience sang along to timeless classics by American rhythm and blues maestros Blackstreet and SWV (Sisters With Voices).
translation.luo: Jowinjo mane nigi ilo ne ower e kinde mane igoyo thumbe ma ndalogi ok kal mag jothum ma iluongo ni Blackstreet kod SWV (Sisters with Voices) ma wero kit thumbe mag rhythm and blues.

translation.en: The two groups gave a spectacular performance that evoked a sense of nostalgia for the 1990's music.
translation.luo: Grube ariyogi ne ogo ngolo e yo ma ywayo ji mane omiyo giparo thumbe ma higni mag 1990.

translation.en: Performing for the very first time in Kenya the SWV trio of Coco, Lelee and Tamar set the mood with their popular song Weak in beautifully choreographed dance moves reminiscing the Kenyan disco scene of the 1990s.
translation.luo: Ka ne gigo ngolo e thuolo mokuongo e piny Kenya, jothum adek mag SWV ma gin Coco, Lelee kod Tamar ne oyawo pap gi wendgi mong'ere mar Weak ka gimiel e yo manyiso tiegruok ma malo mane kelo paro mar disko ma Kenya e higni mag 1990.

translation.en: Clad in baseball tops in green, blue and silver with golden sprinkles, the girlsdefied age with their dance moves.
translation.luo: Ka girwako lep baseball ma ralum, rambulu gi rangi fedha ma oduong'o rangi dhahabu, nyirigo ne omiel e yo ma opando hikgi.

translation.en: One could easily mistake them for the youthful musicians such as Beyonce or Lady Gaga
translation.luo: Ne yot mondo ng'ato okaw ni gin jothum ma pod rowere ka Beyonce kata Lady Gaga

translation.en: The trio sat perched on high stools as they rendered yet another classic hit, Rain which could not have come at a better time when Nairobi experienced rain after a long dry spell.
translation.luo: Nyiri adekgo ne obet e stunde maboyo ka ne giwero wer machielo mang'ula, Rain ma de ok obiro e kinde mowinjore moloyo mano ka ne koth ochue Nairobi bang' thuolo malach mar oro.

translation.en: Coco, the eldest of the three who has a grandchild poked fun at a couple who had earlier on proposed live on stage.
translation.luo: Coco, ma ema duong' negi kendo nigi nyakware ne olungo johera moko mane otelo timo singo mar kend e stej.

translation.en: "I heard someone proposed here this evening. You are getting into a whole lot of trouble," she said.
translation.luo: Nawinjo ni ng'ato nochiwo singo mar kend odhiambo ma kawuononi. Idonjo e chandruok mathoth, nowacho.

translation.en: The girls' serenading vocals were a reminder that all is not lost for soul music lovers.
translation.luo: Duond nyirigo ne rapar ni pod geno nitie ne joma ohero kit wende mag soul.

translation.en: The Valentines themed night got even better when Blackstreet came on stage to dish out red roses to ladies who attended the show.
translation.luo: Otieno mane ochan ka luwore gi Valentine nomedo bedo maber e kinde mane Blackstreet obiro e stej mondo ochiw thiepe kata maua mag rose makwar ne nyiri mane odhi neno.

translation.en: That gesture fired up the show by quartet of Chauncey Black, Dave Hollister, Mark Middleton and Terrel Philips.
translation.luo: Ranyisino nochwako iye kanyo ka wuok kuom grup mar jothum ang'wen ma gin Chauncey Black, Dave Hollister, Mark Middleton kod Terrel Philips.

translation.en: The four rocked the house with pure display of energy with amazingly original renditions of their hits including Don't Leave Me as the crowd sang and danced along.
translation.luo: Jothum ang'wen-go noyiengo odno gi teko ka giwero wendegi ma oher koriwo Don't Leave Me ka galamoro wer kendo miel kanyakla kodgi.

translation.en: Then they brought in Money Can't Buy Me Love that had an air of paradox given that the many couples dancing next to the stage had to part with a whooping Sh25,000 per ticket for the night.
translation.luo: Kaeto ne giwero Money Can't Buy Me Love ma ne chalo kitendawili nikech ng'eny johera mane miel machiegni gi stej nyaka ne chul Siling' 25,000 ne otiko achiel kuom e otienono.

translation.en: Out of this Sh1,000 went to a famine relief fund.
translation.luo: Kuom pesani, Siling' 1,000 ne dhi e agulu mar chiwo kony ne kech.

translation.en: Their depth, passion, and substance that made this group top the charts throughout the nineties were best manifested in their rendition of No Diggity.
translation.luo: E higni mag piero ochiko grubno ne siko timo maber e piem duto mag wer, kendo wendgi mar No Diggitynonyiso kaka gin jothum mang'ula  molony kendo mong'eyo gima thum en.

translation.en: But credit went to the youthful section of the crowd who seemed at ease with the songs and effortlessly sang along just like the older generation of soul music lovers.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, pwoch ne odhi ne rowere ma ne nikanyo.  Ne ging'eyo wendego kendo ne giologi mayot mana kaka tieng' machon ma ne ohero wende mag soul.

translation.en: It showed just how versatile and dynamic the so-called generation-X is that they will go for any good music, age notwithstanding.
translation.luo: Mano ne onyiso maler ni tieng' miluongo ni generation-X  (monyuol e kind  1960 - 1979) en tieng' mar josiso ma dhi kaka piny dhi. Gimor gi thum maber ma ok gidew ni jothum gin johigni adi.

translation.en: By bringing the two American greats on the same night, KICC made the night worth every dime paid, including a five-course dinner by Sarova Hotels.
translation.luo: KICC notimo maber kelo thuondi thum ariyo ma Amerka e otieno achiel.  Bende, ne gitimo chenro mondo Sarova Hotels  omi ji gago  motiap michamo e kidienji abich! Onge ng'at ma noywago ang'e nikech pes donjo ma ne ochulo!

translation.en: But the show started a slightly late, with SWV hitting the stage around 11.30pm.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, thum ne ochakore molewo matin, grup mar SWV kata Sisters With Voices ne odhi e stej  gimoro saa 5:30 motieno.

translation.en: The show was supposed to have started an hour and half earlier and with performances by Kenyan curtain-raisers.
translation.luo: Jothum ma jo Kenya ema ne onego ochak saa 4:00 motieno.

translation.en: Some members of SWV also seemed to be affected by the huge amounts of  smokescreens on stage.
translation.luo: Moko kuom jothum mag SWV ne chandore nikech  iich nyasi ma ne opoto e stej.

translation.en: According to records, SWV that was formed in early 1990's by close friends of Coco, Lelee and Tamara and had sold 25 million copies of music by 2015.
translation.luo: Kaluwore gi lupode, SWV ne ochak e higni mokwongo mag  1990 gi osiepe Coco ariyo ma gin, Lelee gi Tamara kendo ne giseuso thumbegi milion 25 chop higa mar 2015.

translation.en: "I met some fine men by the name of Sauti Sol and I wanna say I love them so much," announced Coco at the beginning of the show hinting at a possible future collaboration with Kenya's most sensational music group.
translation.luo: Kane thum chakore, Coco ne owuoyo ka gima ginyalo tiyo kanyachiel e kinde mabiro gi grub jower ma Kenya mong'ere moloyo. Ne  owacho niya; "Ne aromo gi chwo mabeyo maluongore ni  Sauti Sol, daher wacho ni aherogi ahinya."

translation.en: Blackstreet's Black said they were happy to perform in Kenya and that the show had rekindled their resolve to continue creating new music.
translation.luo: Black, ma en jathum  e grup mar Blackstreet ne owacho ni ne omor ahinya wer Kenya, kendo ni thum motienono ne ochiero gombogi mar dhi nyime loso thumbe manyien.

translation.en: On her hospital bed at the Kenyatta National Hospital in January 2015, gospel artiste Peace Mulu nearly lost hope in life after breaking her legs in an accident.
translation.luo: Bang' yudo masira mar ndara moturo tiendene ariyo e Januar 2015, jawer wende kanisa Peace Mulu ne onindo e wod Kenyatta National Hospital kendo chunye ne ool ahinya.

translation.en: Visits by her fans kept her desire to live.
translation.luo: Joma nohero thumbene ma ne lime ema ne odwoko chunye.

translation.en: Hit songs such as ‘Ombea Adui Yako’ catapulted her to national fame but despite the many years spent in the music industry, she had nothing much to show for it.
translation.luo: Wendene mong'ere ahinya kaka ‘Ombea Adui Yako’ nomiyo obedo rahuma mong'ere Kenya duto. Kata kamano, bang' wer  kuom higni mang'eny ne onge gimoro malich ma ne osetimo.

translation.en: She was still not making enough money and her hospital bill had piled to Sh870,000.
translation.luo: Pod ne ok oyud pesa malong'o kendo gowi ma ne en-go e osiptal ne osechopo siling 870,000.

translation.en: Among her visitors at her hospital bed was a man who introduced himself as Bob from Liberty Afrika, who ‘offered’ to pay the bill.
translation.luo: Achiel kuom joma ne olime e osiptal ne en Bob mawuok Liberty Afrika maneochiwore mar chulone gop osiptal.

translation.en: “I declined but in March, he came to my house accompanied by a lady called Olive and said they had been sent by their boss to promote four of my songs in exchange for money,” she recalls.
translation.luo: Peace wacho niya: “Ne atamora, kata kamano, e dwe mar Mach, ne obiro e oda kaachiel gi miyo miluongo ni Olive. Ne owacho ni jatendgi, ne oorogi mondo gimiya pesa ka ayienegi timo ohala gi wendena ang'wen."

translation.en: “I had a bill of almost a million shillings in hospital and here was someone who had a cheque of Sh450,000 and was telling me he could pay me Sh150,000 per song only if I sign a piece of paper. I agreed without thinking twice,” she says.
translation.luo: Peace medo niya: “Ne an gi gop osiptal ma dhiromo milion achiel, to ng'ato okelona chek mar siling 450,000 kendo onyisa ni obiro chula siling 150,000 ne moro ka moro kuom wende ang'wen-go ka aketo seyi e otas. Ne ayie ma ok aparo diriyo."

translation.en: Unknown to her, she had just signed off the rights and ownership of the songs to Liberty Afrika.
translation.luo: Ne ok ong'eyo. Kare Seyi ma ne oketono ne miyo Liberty Afrika ratiro duto mag wendenego, kendo gin ema koro ne gidhi bedo weg wendego.

translation.en: The company would, without informing her, upload them to Safaricom’s Skiza Tunes platform in what is shaping up to be one of the biggest disputes in the music industry.
translation.luo: Wachno ne dhi tugo lweny maduong'ie moloyo gi jothum. Kambi mar Liberty Afrika ne odhi nyime moketo wendego e Skiza Tunes mar jo Safaricom ma ok ginyiso Peace.

translation.en: Started 10 years before Ms Mulu’s accident in 2005, Skiza Tunes is a Caller Ring Back Tone (CRBT) owned by Safaricom that allows users to select a song that would entertain them as they wait for their call to be picked.
translation.luo: Skiza Tunes en gir Safaricom mamiyo ng'ato thuolo mar yiero wer ma obiroga winjo sama orito mondo ng'ato okaw simbe. E dho Ingresa iluonge ni Caller Ring Back Tone, CRBT. Nochako tiyo e higa mar  2005, higni 10 kapok Peace oyudo masira mar ndara.

translation.en: Users dial *811# to download the songs and it costs just 75 cents per tune per day which is renewed automatically at midnight.
translation.luo: Jomatiyo kod lain diyo *811# mondo giyud wende kendo gichulo otonglo 75 odiechieng' ne wer achiel. En chudo ma dhi nyime,  ma kochopo saa auchiel motieno, to nuore kende.

translation.en: On the face of it, this looks like little money for subscribers.
translation.luo: King'iyo wachno awiye awiye, inyalo wacho ni ji chulo pesa matin ahinya ne wendego.

translation.en: But with more than 10,000 songs for users to download and at least 5,000 artistes signed to the platform, this translates to millions of shillings.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ka iketo e paro ni gin kod wende mokalo 10,000 ma ji nyalo golo e intanet, kendo jower ok tin ne 5,000 inyalo fwenyo ni jo Safaricom yudo milionde.

translation.en: In May last year, the company announced it had released Sh152 million to Collective Management Organisations (CMOs) and Premium Rate Service Providers (PRSPs) for payment to artistes whose music had been downloaded on the platforms since July 2015.
translation.luo: E dwe mar Mei higa mokalo, Safaricom ne olando ni gimiyo kambi ma chokone jothum pesa, Collective Management Organisations (CMOs) kod kembe ma tugo thumbego Premium Rate Service Providers (PRSPs) milion 152 mondo gichul jothum ma ne oket wendegi e Skiza Tunes  chakre Julai 2015.

translation.en: Safaricom usually pays on a monthly basis but the money had been accumulating for 10 months due to a court order.
translation.luo: Safaricom chudoga dwe ka dwa kata kamano, pesago ne okunore kuom dweche 10 nikech kot ne ochiko kamano.

translation.en: To cushion itself from having to deal with each artiste whose content is made available for download, Safaricom outsourced content acquisition by signing Content Provision Agreements’ with PRSPs.
translation.luo: Safaricom ne ok dwar thung' gi tich mar chulo moro ka moro kuom jothum ma wendegi nie Skiza Tunes,omiyone gidonjo e winjruok gi Premium Rate Service Providers(PRSPs) ma gimiyogi ratiro mar Content Provision Agreements’ matiende ni kambino ema biroga manyonegi wende kendo ketogi e Skiza Tunesto Safaricom chulogi.

translation.en: The PRSPs receive content from producers, code it and upload on the platform and in return, Safaricom pays the PRSPs whose role is to distribute the proceeds among content producers.
translation.luo: Kembe mag PRSPs manyo wende kuom jothum, gimiyo wendego namba kae to gi ketogi e Skiza Tune. Safaricom chulo  kambino pes wendego, to kambino kawo ting' mar chulo jothum.

translation.en: This decision made when Skiza Tunes presented a new revenue stream for artists in the early days of the local pop music industry ran on auto pilot for a while.
translation.luo: Chenro mar Skiza Tunes ne okonyo jothum e kinde machon-go bedo gi yuto moro. Kindeno, jothum ne onge riwruok moro sie ma ne ochung' ne dongruok mar jothum, kendo weche thum ne itimo aoyaye.

translation.en: “I gave out my rights without knowing how much my music was worth. After all I was getting Sh50,000 every three months but now I believe I was defrauded,” says Lydia Joy Kairimu, the composer of the song ‘Mungu Najua Haujanisahau’.
translation.luo: Lydia Joy Kairimu, ma ne ondiko wer mar ‘Mungu Najua Haujanisahau.’ Wacho niya “Ne amiyogi ratiro duto mag wendena ma ok ang'eyo nengo mag wendenogo. Ne amor ni gichula siling 50,000 bang dweche adek ka dweche adek. Gie sani, aneno ni ne gikwala."

translation.en: Very few content owners were interested in knowing how much money was being made from their material as there was no data being provided about downloads.
translation.luo: Nikech ne ok migi  nonro manyisogi ni igolo wendegi e intanet nyadidi, thoth Jondik wer ne ok odich gi ng'eyo kwan pesa ma ne iloso gi wendegi.

translation.en: Desperate to make money when music was still not paying very well, many artistes, including Elizabeth Nyambere, simply gave rights to their songs away in exchange for cash.
translation.luo: E kinde ma ne thum ok kel pesa malong'o, jothum mang'eny ma ne ochando pesa, ne chiwo ratiro duto mag wendegi to ichulogi pesa duto kanyo gi kanyo.  Achiel kuom jothum ma ne otimo kamano en Elizabeth Nyambere.

translation.en: In 2011 when she was still a struggling artiste, she heard that she could make money from her songs through ring back tunes and the offer she was given by Liberty Afrika sounded like music to her ears.
translation.luo: E higa mar 2011,  kane weche pod ok dhine maber, ne owinjo ni onyalo loso pesa gi wendene e Skiza Tunes kendo ne omor ahinya gi pesa ma ne jo Liberty Africa oyie chule.

translation.en: “I was desperate. They told me they could promote my songs for one year and gave me Sh400,000,” she recalls.
translation.luo: Elizabeth wacho niya; “Ne achando pesa ahinya. Ne ginyisa ni gibiro loko ohala gi wendena kuom higa achiel kendo ne gichula siling 400,000.”

translation.en: A scrutiny of the contract by, however, shows she gave up rights for her songs for five years.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, ka inono adimba otas ma ne oketoe seyino, Elizabeth ne ochiwo ratiro duto mag wendene kuom higni abich. Ne ok ong'eyo.

translation.en: “The term of this agreement continues for a period of five years upon whose lapse it will be deemed to have been automatically renewed unless wither party issues a twelve months prior notice of intention not to renew the agreement upon the lapse of five years,” says the contract.
translation.luo: Otasno wacho niya: “Winjruokni biro dhi nyime kuom higni abich. Kata kamano, en winjruok mosiko machakore manyien kende bang' higni abich ka higni abich mak mana ka achiel kuom joma owinjorego ogolo notis mar dweche 12 ni ok odwar ni winjruokno odhi nyime bang' higni abich."

translation.en: Joan Wairimu claims she gave out the rights of her songs without knowing their true worth and now wants them back.
translation.luo: Joan Wairimu wacho ni en to ne ochiwo ratiro duto mag wendene ka ok ong'eyo pesa sie ma wendenego nyalo loso, omiyo odwaro ni odwokne ratiro duto mag wendene.

translation.en: “Even if you are a mad man do you want to say you can sell your song for just a million shillings when it is making millions in a month,” she asks. It is disputes like the one between Ms Nyambere and Liberty Afrika that would in time prove costly to Safaricom by exposing the company to legal disputes.
translation.luo: Openjo niya: “Kata ka in janeko, dius wendi ne siling milion achiel ka wendino loso milionde e dwe achiel? Ywaruok kaka ma e kind Nyambere kod Liberty Africa ema ne dhi tero Safaricom e kot kendo miyo gichul pesa mang'eny ahinya.

translation.en: Safaricom’s maintains it is an infrastructure provider that enables rights owners and their licensees to avail their music to end users and would like the issue resolved.
translation.luo: Safaricom to wacho ni gin gichiwo mana  kama inyalo usie wende. Weg  thum kod joma gimiyo lisen mar uso wendegi nyalo kelo thumbegi mondo ji owinj  sama girito mondo omak  simbegi. Giwacho ni digiher mondo otiek ywaruokgo.

translation.en: “We would like to see all the parties involved in this dispute- the artistes, CMOs and CSPs- to seek clarity on the matter and settle on a payment structure amicable to all,” the mobile operator’s Chief Executive Bob Collymore told The Standard on Sunday.
translation.luo: Bob Collymore, Jatelo Maduong' mar  Safaricom ne owacho ne The Standard on Sunday niya; “Dwaher ni ji duto manie ywaruokno, gibed jothum, CMOs,  kata  Joma keto thumbegi kuonde mitugogie (CSPs)  oket weche duto e ler. Giwinjre e kindgi kaka ibiroga chulgi ma onge ng'at ma ng'ur.”

translation.en: He maintained the company is committed to work with all stakeholders so that everyone is satisfied.
translation.luo: Ne owacho ni Safaricom  dwaro tiyo gi jogo duto e yo  mowinjore ma onge ng'at ma wang'.

translation.en: “Our hope is that the progressive gains made so far for artists will lead to desired reforms and harmonisation of the industry for the benefit of all stakeholders,” he said.
translation.luo: Ne omedo niya: “Wageno ni ohala ma jothum osebedo ka loso biro konyo e kelo lokruok mabeyo kod winjruok e kind jothum mondo ji duto manie ohand thum oyud ohala maber.”

translation.en: But after learning from its mistakes due to the case, Safaricom in 2014 began meeting stakeholders in order to find a middle ground.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, kesno ne omiyo Safaricom oneno kuonde ma ne ok gitimoe, omiyo e higa mar 2014 ne gichako romo gi joma ne nie ohand thum mondo giyud kaka ginyalo winjore.

translation.en: In August 2015, a new system was devised where three CMOs; Music Copyright Society of Kenya (MCSK), Kenya Association of Music Producers (KAMP) and Performers Rights Organisation of Kenya (PRISK) would collect royalties on behalf of artistes instead of PRSKs, which had been accused of exploiting artists.
translation.luo: Agost 2015, ne ochak chenro manyien. Ne oyier   adek ema mondo Safaricom ochul pes jothum kar miyo PRSKs, ma ne wachore ni osebedo ka gikwalo pes jower. CMOs ma ne oyier ne gin; Music Copyright Society of Kenya (MCSK), Kenya Association of Music Producers (KAMP) kod Performers Rights Organisation of Kenya (PRISK) .

translation.en: The idea was to ensure everyone who is involved in the production of content, including sound engineers, producers and composers, got a share of the cake.
translation.luo: Gima duong' ma ne gidwaro ne en ni jiduto ma okonyo e loso thum moro ma Safaricom ong'iewo oyud pesa michulogo. Jogo oriwo; jolos wer, jower kod jo go thum.

translation.en: The CMOs who were also legally mandated were to ensure that everyone who claims rights to a song was paid and also insulate Safaricom.
translation.luo: CMOs , ma koro ne omi ratiro gi sirkal, ne nigi ting' mar neno ni ng'ato ang'ato ma nigi ratiro mar wer ichulo, to komachielo ne onego gine ni ratiro mag Safaricom bende orit.

translation.en: Soon after, PRSPs Liberty Afrika and Expedia Management rushed to the Constitutional Court arguing that the authorisation of CMOs to collect money on behalf of artists was unconstitutional.
translation.luo: Matin bang'e, PRSPs, Liberty Afrika kod Expedia Management ne oringo odhi e Kot ma Rito Chik mar Piny  kata Constitutional Court  ka giwacho ni ratiro ma omi  CMOs mondo ochok pesa ma imiyo jothum gwenyore gi chik.

translation.en: Justice Mumbi Ngugi in a ruling delivered on May 4 ruled that, “There was nothing in the law that stops the CMOs from collecting and paying all artists including non-members.”
translation.luo: Jang'ad Bura, Mumbi Ngugi, ne ong'ado wachno niya Mei 4, “Onge gimoro amora e chik ma geng'o CMOs choko pesa ne jothum kendo chulo jothum kata chulo jothum ma ok nie riwruogno.”

translation.en: She also ordered MCSK to make available to all artists logs showing how much their music had earned.
translation.luo: Ne ochiko MCSK ni gi ne ni jothum duto oyudo ripot manyiso kwan pesa ma  thumbegi oloso.

translation.en: However, even before the ink had dried on her ruling, two artists Mercy Munee and Lydia Nyiva filed a case at the Malindi High Court saying they were not members of any CMO and were not intending to join one.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, kata kapok otono olaw, jower ariyo miluongo ni Mercy Munee gi Lydia Nyiva ne otero kes e Malindi High Court ka giwacho ni ok gin e riwruok mar  CMO moro amora kendo ok gichano donjo e riwruogego.

translation.en: In November 11, Justice Said Chitembwe nullified Section 30A of the Copyright Act which authorises CMOs to collect payments on behalf of owners of copyrights in the nature of performing and producing rights, contradicting Justice Ngugi’s orders and forcing Safaricom back to paying artists through PRSP’s.
translation.luo: Novemba 11, Jang'ad Bura Said Chitembwe ne orucho Section 30A mar Copyright Act  ma ne omiyo CMOs ratiro mar choko pesa ne jothum kendo chiwo ratiro mag thum. Wachno ne orucho chik ma Jang'ad Bura Ngugi ne ogolo kendo ne chuno Safaricom dok e chulo jothum kaka yande otimo kokalo kuom  PRSP’s.

translation.en: Nevertheless, data obtained by The Standard on Sunday on how the distribution of the money made from the Skiza Tunes platform is done in shocking.
translation.luo: Kata kamano, The Standard on Sunday  ne ogolo ripot manyiso kaka ipogoga pesa miloso e  Skiza Tunes. Ripodno ne omako dhog ji!

translation.en: Artists, who are the composers and rightfully the owners of the content receive the least.
translation.luo: Jothum ma ondiko wer, kendo ma gin weg weche miwerogo, ema ichulo pesa matinie mogik.

translation.en: For instance in three months between March to May of last year, Liberty Afrika, a PRSP which Ms Kamuri is signed to, received Sh1,724,355.39 from Safaricom which it was to share with her after deducting its own fees.
translation.luo: Kuom ranyisi, Ms Kamuri en jakanyo mar Liberty Afrika, ma en  PRSP. E  dweche adek chakre Mach nyaka Mei higa mokalo, Safaricom ne ochulo Liberty Afrika  siling 1,724,355.39 ma ne onego gichule bang' golo pesgi.

translation.en: Then from July 2015 to February 2016, Sh4,561,756.06 was paid out to Liberty Africa while only Sh13,473 went directly to her bank account. She is angry. “There is completely no transparency. We are living in shanties in Kangemi while people are eating on our money pretending they are assisting us sell our music,” says Ms Kamuri.
translation.luo: Kae to chakre Julai 2015 nyaka Februar 2016,  ne ochul Liberty Africa pes Ms Kamuri siling 4,561,756.06 kata kamano, siling 13,473 ema ne giketo e akaunt mar  Ms Kamuri. Wachno lit ne Ms Kamuri. Owacho niya:  “Jogi oketowa e mudho. Wadak e ute chuodho Kangemi to jomoko chiemo e wiwa ka giwuondore ni gikonyowa uso thumbewa.”

translation.en: The data indicates that what went to Ms Kamuri’s bank account after all the deductions was just Sh28,831.48.
translation.luo: Ripot nyiso ni siling 28,831.48 kende ema ne odonjo e akaunt mar Ms Kamuri bang' jogo kawo pesgi duto.

translation.en: Such exasperation would boil over on April 16 last year when MCSK led artistes in a peaceful demonstration demanding they get paid all the monies owed to them.
translation.luo: Weche malit kaka mago  ema ne opong'o kor jothum. Chop  April 16 higa mokalo MCSK ne otelo ne jothum e ng'anyo mamuol ka giramo ni ochulgi pesgi duto mosecham.

translation.en: Meanwhile after the order by the court which prompted MCSK to release logs showing how much money artists were making from downloads of their content, 14 musicians filed a case against the society, saying it had has refused to release their dues.
translation.luo: Koni, kot ne ogolo chik ma ne omiyo MCSK ochiwo ripot ma ne nyiso pesa ma jothum ne loso kowuok kuom wendegi ma ji golo e intanet. Jothum 14 ne odonjo ne riwruokno e kot ka giwacho ni gitamore chulogi pesgi.

translation.en: Through lawyer Gikunda Miriti, the musicians claim Safaricom had paid them their monies but MCSK was withholding holding it.
translation.luo: Kokalo kuom Okil Gikunda Miriti, jothumgo ne owacho ni Safaricom ne osechulogi to  MCSK ne otamore miyogi pesgi.

translation.en: Expedia Management Limited has declined to respond to our questions on the matter but Charles Mwalimu, a lawyer, says the artists failed to exercise due diligence when they entered into the contracts.
translation.luo: Expedia Management Limited otamore dwoko penjowa e wi wachno, kata kamano okil miluongo ni  Charles Mwalimu wacho ni jothumgo ne ok okawo okenge ma ne dwarore ni gikaw kane gidonjo winjruok gi jogo.

translation.en: Also enjoined in the case was Expedia, which court papers said had changed its name from Liberty Africa limited.
translation.luo: Kesno omako nyaka Expedia, ma kot wacho ni yande gin Liberty Afrika limited, to giloko nyinggi.

translation.en: “There is a general lack of disseminating information to artists when they sign any deal and because most of them are broke, when they get their first offer they rush into signing,” he says.
translation.luo: Owacho niya: “Ng'enyne ok nyis jothum weche duto mowinjore gi ng'e sama giketo seyi e winjruogego. Thothne jothumgo ochando pesa kendo girikni keto seyi ka gineno anena pesa ni i. Ok ginon weche.”

translation.en: “Most contracts are designed by lawyers and it would be prudent if you discuss any deal you get with a lawyer before putting pen to paper,” he says.
translation.luo: Omedo niya: “Ng'eny winjruogegi indikoga gi okil, en gima riek wuoyo gi okil kapok iketo seyi e winjruok ma kamago.”

translation.en: And although The Standard on Sunday is not at liberty to comment on the matter since it is still in court, we have established that Expedia has been dangling money to the artists by asking them to withdraw from any disputes they have with the company.
translation.luo: Kata obedo ni The Standard on Sunday ne ok nyal wuoyo e wi wachno nikech wachno podi nie kot, wawinjo ni Expedia osebedo ka liero ne  jothum gi pesa ka gihombogi mondo gigol kesgi e kot.

translation.en: “I wish to state that I have no dispute with both Liberty Afrika and Expedia Management and would like my name to be removed from the case,” says one of the affidavits which we have seen.
translation.luo: Achiel kuom afidavit ma waseneno wacho niya: “Awacho gi dhoga ni aonge ywaruok moro amora gi  Liberty Afrika kod Expedia Management kendo daher mondo ogol nyinga e kesno.”

translation.en: One of those approached is Mulu and Mary Wanjiru, who is popularly known as ‘Shiro Wa GP.’
translation.luo: Moko kuom joma osetem lomb mondo oket seyi e afidavidego gin  Mulu kod Mary Wanjiru, ma bende idendo ni ‘Shiro Wa GP.’

translation.en: “Four months ago, they called me telling me to meet them since they had realised I have a new song but I told them I was selling it to Cellulant (another PRSP),” says Shiro wa GP.
translation.luo: Shiro wa GP wacho niya: “Ne gigoyona simu dweche ang'wen mokalo ka ginyisa ni digiher mondo warom nikech giwinjo ni an gi wer manyien. An to ne anyisogi ni ne adhi uso wendno ne  Cellulant, ma en PRSP machielo.”

translation.en: “I agreed to meet them but when we met, they brought along a document for me to sign claiming it was a contract. I didn’t sign it,” she says.
translation.luo: Owacho ni, “Ne ayie romo kodgi, kata kamano, ne gikelona otas moro mondo aketie sie ka giwacho ni en kontrakt. Ne atamora keto seyi. ”

translation.en: For Mulu, she was issued a cheque of Sh371,903 on January 11 on condition that she signs the affidavit.
translation.luo: Mulu, to ne olierne chek mar siling 371,903 Januar 11, kata kamano, ne onyise ni ibiro miye chekno mana ka oketo seyi e afidavitino.

translation.en: But as the push and pull over the amount of money artists are making on what was supposed to be an alternative revenue stream continues, a majority have been left to be millionaires on paper but paupers in reality.
translation.luo: Sama ywaruok dhi nyime e wi pesa monego bed ni jothum yudo e yo machieloni, ng'eny jothum nigi milionde mana e otas, to adiera en ni gidhier.

translation.en: It is evident that many more may not even be knowing whether their music is on the platform or if they are making money at all.
translation.luo: Nenore ni jothum mang'eny ok ong'eyo kata ka thumbegi nie Skiza Tunes kata kapo ni wendegi loso pesa kamoro.

translation.en: Henry Waweru, who claims his songs have made Sh1.5 million in the last three months, wants the ring back tunes withdrawn altogether.
translation.luo: Henry Waweru wacho ni wendene oseloso siling milion 1.5 e dweche adek mosekalo kendo odwaro ni ogol wendenego e Skiza Tunes.

translation.en: “I am just a millionaire on paper,” he says. “You know even if an artist becomes broke, he can’t go to work at a construction site or sell maize because he has a name.
translation.luo: Owacho niya; “An jadhier, kendo miliondena ni  mana e otas. Gima lit en ni,  ka jathum ochando pesa ok onyal dhi goyo orak mar mjengo, kata bulo oduma e bath ndara, nikech nyaka orit nyinge.

translation.en: There was even a day I was asking God why he gave me this talent because people who sell maize on the road are making more money,” he says.
translation.luo: Chieng' moro ne aywak ne Nyasaye ka apenje ni ang'o momiyo ne omiya talanta mar wer, nikech jomauso oduma e ndara yudo pesa mang'eny moloya.”

translation.en: Jacob Boniface Maina (JB Maina), a Kikuyu secular singer received Sh15.5 million as compensation in an out of court settlement in 2014 from Safaricom after he won a case he had filed claiming his songs were being sold on the Skiza platform without his knowledge.
translation.luo: Jacob Boniface Maina, midendo ni JB Maina, jathum mawero wende dho Kikuyu ne odonjo ne Safaricom e kot kowacho ni ne giuso wendene e  Skiza Tunes to ne okiya.  Ne oyie mondo gilos wachno oko mar kot kendo Safaricom ne ochule siling milion 15.5  e higa mar 2014.

translation.en: Back in the 90s when you were interested in a girl and wanted to put your best foot forward, one of the classical lyrics to drop was “I’m So Into You” or better still “You’re the One.”
translation.luo: E higni mag  90, ka ne idwaro nyako, kendo idwaro chopo e chunye, weche mag  wer miluongo ni “I’m So Into You”, ema ne donjone moloyo, to mag “You’re the One”  ne koro toye ni chuth.

translation.en: Or if a girl wants to dump you and you’re still into her, “Before I Let You Go” was spot on.
translation.luo: To kapo ni nyako ne dwaro weyi to in to pod ihere, weche mag “Before I Let You Go”  ne chopone e choke!

translation.en: The lyrical geniuses behind these all-time favourite R&B songs are American trio — Sisters With Voices popularly known as SWV and boy band Blackstreet Boys.
translation.luo: Ne gin wende miluongo ni R&B kendo ji ne oherogi marach! Jower mang'ula ma ne ondiko wendegi ne gin nyi Amerka adek  — Sisters With Voices kata SWV kod band mar yowuoyi miluongo ni Blackstreet Boys.

translation.en: To crown this month of love, the stars are in Kenya for a much-hyped post Valentine’s gig.
translation.luo: Ma en dwe mar hera, kendo jower ma rohumagi obiro Kenya tieko dweni gi thum ma ratipo ma bang' Valentine.

translation.en: The group came last night, and will headline the event dubbed Valentines Throwback Concert at the Kenyatta International Convention Centre in Nairobi tonight.
translation.luo: Grubno ne odonjo nyoro gotieno, kendo gin e grup mogenie mogik e thum miluongo ni Valentines Throwback Concert  mabiro timore kawuono gotieno Kenyatta International Convention Centre, Nairobi.

translation.en: The two world-renowned groups landed at the Jomo Kenyatta International Airport at around 9.30pm on Thursday.
translation.luo: Ndege ma ne oting'o grube ariyo mong'ere e piny mangimagi ne opie  Jomo Kenyatta International Airport Tich Ang'wen gimoro saa 3:30.

translation.en: Clearly exhausted from the long flight, the team posed for a few photos with fans before they were whisked away and driven to their hotel.
translation.luo: Ne nenore maler ni ne giol bang' bet e ndege kuom seche mang'eny,  ne gikawo piche manok kod moko kuom joma oheroga wendegi,  kae to okawgi mapiyo piyo motergi e mtoka ma ne dhi terogi e hotel.

translation.en: The event has been organised by KICC as a Valentine’s treat for Kenyan fans.
translation.luo: KICC ne ochano thumno mondo gimor joma ohero thumbe grubego e kinde Valentine.

translation.en: Entry fee at the gate is Sh5,000 while VIP tickets go for Sh15,000.
translation.luo: Pes donjo en siling 5,000 to ka ng'ato dwaro kar welo moyiedh to ochulo siling 15,000.

translation.en: Even though millenials may not connect with these stars, back in the 90s, the likes of SWV and Blackstreet Boys were one of the all time favourite R&B stars.
translation.luo: Kata obedo ni joma onyuol e higni mag 2000 ok di ng'e jower ma rohumagi maber, grube kaka mag of SWV kod Blackstreet Boys ne gin moko kuom grube thum mag R&B ma ne ohero ahinya e higni mag 1990!

translation.en: Blackstreet Boys known for the “No Diggitty” hit was founded in 1991 by Teddy Riley (formerly of Guy – a American hip hop group) and Chauncey Hannibal also known as C.
translation.luo: Grup mar Blackstreet Boys mong'ere gi wer mar  “No Diggitty”, ne ochak e higa mar 1991 gi jal miluongo ni  Teddy Riley (machon ne wer gi grup miluongo ni Guy – ma en grup mar Jo Amerka mawero hip hop) kod Chauncey Hannibal ma bende idendo ni C. Black.

translation.en: Black. After the disbandment of Guy in 1991, Riley came up with the idea to start a new group featuring himself.
translation.luo: Kane jo grub Guy owere e higa mar 1991, Riley ne ong'ado mar chako  grup manyien ma en ema obiro bedoe jawer maduong'.

translation.en: Originally, the group was to be named Stonestreet, but it was combined with Chauncey’s nickname, Black.
translation.luo: E chakne, ne onego oluong grup manyienno  ni  Stonestreet, kata kamano ne gimedoe Black ma en nying ma ne idendogago Chauncey.

translation.en: When the group settled on the name Blackstreet, it featured Teddy Riley, Chauncey Hannibal, Levi Little and Joseph Stonestreet.
translation.luo: Kane giseyie ni ibiro luong grubno ni Blackstreet, joma ne nie grubno ne gin Teddy Riley, Chauncey Hannibal, Levi Little kod Joseph Stonestreet.

translation.en: SWV on the other hand, a two-time Grammy Award–nominated vocal trio, was formed in 1990 by Cheryl “Coko” Gamble, Tamara “Taj” Johnson and Leanne “Lelee” Lyons as a gospel group.
translation.luo: To komachielo, SWV, grup ma ne oloyo diriyo Grammy Award–mar jower adek, ne ochak e higa mar 1990 gi  Cheryl Gamble kata “Coko" , Tamara Johnson kata“Taj”  kod Leanne Lyons kata “Lelee.” Ne en grup mawero wende din.

translation.en: Like all bands, it underwent other changes along the way.
translation.luo: Mana kaka band duto mag thum, gibende gisebedo gilokruoge.

translation.en: With time, SWV grew to become one of the world’s most successful R&B groups of the 1990s.
translation.luo: Bang' kinde band mar SWV ne obedo band ma rohuma mogik e grube ma ne wero wende R&B e higni mag 90.

translation.en: The trio released their debut studio album titled ‘It’s About Time’ on October 27, 1992.
translation.luo: Oktoba 27, 1992 jower adekgo ne ogolo wendgi mokwongo ‘It’s About Time’  ma ne en dwol kende momak e studio.

translation.en: Some of their favourite hits include ‘Weak’, ‘Right Here/Human Nature,’ ‘I’m So into You’ and ‘You’re the One.’
translation.luo: Moko kuom thumbegi ma ji nohero ahinya ne gin ‘Weak’, ‘Right Here/Human Nature,’ ‘I’m So into You’ kod ‘You’re the One.’

translation.en: The group disbanded in 1998 to pursue solo projects but reunited in 2005. As of 2015, the trio had sold more than 25 million records, making them one of the world’s best-selling girl groups of all time.
translation.luo: Jogrubno ne owere e higa mar 1998 mondo ng'ato ka ng'ato ower kende, kata kamano ne giriwore kendo e higa mar 2005. E higa mar  2015, grubno ne oseuso rekod milion 25. Mano ne omiyo gibedo achiel kuom band mag nyiri e piny mang'ima mosegauso rekod mang'eny ahinya.

translation.en: SWV’s first single, ‘Right Here,’ was released in mid-1992, hitting number 13 on the R&B charts.
translation.luo: Single mokwongo mar SWV, ‘Right Here,’ ne ogol gimoro Jun, 1992, kendo ne obedo namba  13 e grup mar wende R&B.

translation.en: It was certified multi-platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America.
translation.luo: Recording Industry Association of America ne oketo wendno e grup mar wende moseus milion 2.

translation.en: South African artist Percy Maimela stumbled upon his talent by chance, when some salt crystals spilled on the floor of the shop where he worked and as he tried to collect them he realized they formed shapes that he now turns into portraits.
translation.luo: Jagoro ma Ja South Africa miluongo ni Percy Maimela, ne opo kofwenyo talantane mar goro chieng' moro kane chumbi opukore piny e duka ma ne otiyoe. Kane otemo jowo chumbigo ne ofwenyo ni kare chumbi gudorega e kido mopogore opogore, to gie sani kidogo ema olosogo gorone.

translation.en: His latest inspiration is former U.S. President Barack Obama.
translation.luo: Ng'at ma ogoro sani en Ker machon ma Amerka, Barack Obama.

translation.en: "You can just take small stones and make something that no one ever thought of," he told Reuters in the capital Pretoria.
translation.luo: Ne onyiso Reuters niya, e boma ma Pretoria."Inyalo mana kawo kite matindo tindo kae to iloso gima ng'ato ne pok oparoga nyaka nene,"

translation.en: "Even salt companies, they wouldn't say salt is just for food anymore," he said, crouching over his portrait of Obama on his dining room floor.
translation.luo: Ne omedo wacho niya sama onyuongo e ode ka ogoro picha mar Obama: "Gie sani, kata mana kambe maloso chumbi ok  diwach ni chumbi itiyogo mana e tedo!"

translation.en: The 31-year-old applies glue to cloth and then sprinkles table salt to sketch the portrait. Some of the famous faces he has drawn include global icon Nelson Mandela. Often, he'll chance his luck with passers by.
translation.luo: Percy ma koro jahigni 31 ketoga glu e nanga kae to oporo chumbi e picha ma osegoro. Moko kuom joma rohuma ma osegoro gin ji kaka Nelson Mandela, mong'ere e piny ngima. Kata kamano, ng'enyne joma ogoroga gin joma kalo mopo kochung' kama ojabetie mokwaye mondo ogorgi.

translation.en: "I'll just carry just a black cloth and a bag of salt, then you can just come and give me 300 rand ($23) and then I'll just sketch your face, quick," he said. "And for you it's a memory and you'll never get that anywhere else."
translation.luo: Maimela wacho niya: "Ating'oga mana nanga marateng' kod ofuko mar chumbi, kae to ng'ato biro to miya rand 300 kata dola mag Amerka 23 kae to agoro pat wang' gi mapiyo piyo gi chumbi. En tich ma atimo piyo, kata kamano, en kit picha makende ma ok digorni gi ng'at machielo!"

translation.en: Maimela - who quit his job at a retail store last year to pursue his craft - said he has loved art since he was a child but could never afford professional training.
translation.luo: Maimela - ne oweyo tiyo e duka higa mokalo mondo otim tij goro. Owacho ni osehero goro ae tinne, kata kamano ne oonge pesa ma ne onyalo yudogo tiegruok madwarore mar goro.

translation.en: Getting started on a commissioned piece of work requires a tiny investment of less than 50 US cents for salt and a little extra for glue.
translation.luo: Owacho ni chako ohalani ka ng'ato okelo nangane ma igoroe dwaro pesa matinne sendi 50 ma Amerka mar ng'iewo chumbi kae to imedoe mana pesa matin mar glu.

translation.en: He said he can sell a piece for about $30.
translation.luo: Owacho ni onyalo uso goro achiel ne dola mag Amerka 30.

translation.en: Maimela, who also works in pencil, has not been able to get any of his work shown in galleries and relies on the Internet to generate interest in his work.
translation.luo: Maimela, ma bende gorogi pensil pok oyudo thuolo mar nyiso gorone e duke moyang mag nyiso kendo uso goro, intanet ema otiyogo e lando tije.

translation.en: "Being an artist in total is not easy, because not everyone understand art and then not everyone is willing to buy art. But everyone is willing to buy something that's provoking to their feelings," Maimela said.
translation.luo: Maimela wacho niya: "Bedo jagoro, ma tije en mana goro ok yot. Nikech ok  ji duto ma ong'eyo weche goro kata madwaro ng'iewo goro. Kata kamano, ji duto ohero  ng'iewo gik ma morogi."

translation.en: Renowned South African novelist and apartheid critic Peter Abrahams is dead.
translation.luo: Peter Abrahams Ja South African ma rahuma, otho. Ne en jandik buge kendo ne okwedo apartheid kata chenro mar wasungu bwono jorotenge  South Africa.

translation.en: Abrahams, whose novel, Mine Boy, was a set book in Kenya in the late 90s, was found lying in a pool of blood in his house in Jamaica Thursday.
translation.luo: Abrahams ma ne osom buge ma Mine Boy, e skunde mag sekondari e piny Kenya e higni mogik mag  90,ne oyud Tich Ang'wen kotho kendo onindo e ataro mar remo e ode e piny Jamaica.

translation.en: Jamaican police sources said initial investigations indicated the journalist and radio commentator may have fallen off his wheelchair but the large pool of blood found at the scene of his death triggered a foul-play theory.
translation.luo: Polise ma Jamaica wacho ni nonro ma gitimo motelo nyiso ni dibedie ni Abraham ma ne en jandiko kendo jalendo e redio ne opodho piny kowuok e kombe midhiro. Kata kamano, remo ma ne otimo ataro kama ne othoeno nyiso ni thoneno dibedie gi wach.

translation.en: He was 97.
translation.luo: Abrahams otho ka en jahigni 97.

translation.en: Last year, his house was broken into four times, necessitating installation of an alarm, police said.
translation.luo: Polise wacho ni e higa mokalo, jokuoye ne oturo ode ding'wen kendo ne ochuno ni oket alam.

translation.en: Abrahams was among the first African writers to gain international acclaim, alongside fellow anti-apartheid writers such as Alex La Guma.
translation.luo: Abrahams ne en achiel kuom jondiko ma ne kwedo Apartheid ma ne  okwongo ng'ere e piny mangima. Alex La Guma bende ne en achiel kuom jondikogo.

translation.en: In Mine Boy, he writes about the harsh treatment of mine workers and race relations in Apartheid South Africa, matter that simmers in the country's politics to date.
translation.luo: E buge mar Mine Boy, ondiko kaka ne isando jotich ma ne kunyo kite mag nengo kaka goldi. Owuoyo bende e wi kaka  ne ibwono jorotenge South Africa, kendo wachno pod liet e siasa mar pinyno nyaka chil kawuono.

translation.en: Abrahams's personal encounter with racism is best captured by the fact that his mixed-race wife, with whom he had three children, regretted marrying a black man.
translation.luo: Abraham ne oneno gi wang'e kaka wach Apartheid ne pogo ji kane chiege ma janyuolne achiel ne jarateng' to machielo msungu, kendo ma ne gisenyuologo nyithindo adek, ne oweye kendo ne owacho ni oywago ang'e gimomiyo ne otedo ne jarateng'.

translation.en: Born Peter Henry Abrahams Deras on March 3, 1919 in Johannesburg to an Ethiopian father and a coloured mother, Abrahams left South Africa in 1939 after he was charged with treason.
translation.luo: Ne onyuole Mach 3, 1919, Johannesburg, mi  jonyuolne ne oluonge ni Peter Henry Abrahams Deras. Wuon-gi ne en Ja Ethiopia to min-gi ne nigi remo mar msungu e anyuolagi. Abrahams ne odar mowuok South Africa e higa 1939 ka ne odonjne ni okwedo sirkal.

translation.en: He settled in Britain, where he worked as a journalist, writing for The Daily Worker, The Observer in England, and the The New York Herald Tribune in the US.
translation.luo: Ne odak Britain, kendo ne ondiko ne gasede kaka The Daily Worker, The Observer ma England, kod the The New York Herald Tribune ma Amerka.

translation.en: In London he met Pan-Africanists such as Jomo Kenyatta and Kwame Nkurumah.
translation.luo: Ka ne en  London ne oromo kod  ji kaka Jomo Kenyatta kod Kwame Nkuruma ma ne  wacho ni jo Afrika onego obed e achiel.

translation.en: From London he was exiled in Jamaica, where he has lived till his death.
translation.luo: Ne omiye kum mogole London motere Jamaica, kendo kuno ema ne odakie nyaka thone.

translation.en: "I visited Peter Abrahams in his house in Jamaica. He had just reclaimed rights for his Mine Boy and A Wreath for Udomo from the African Writers Series and I took them up," East African Educational Publishers Chairman, Dr Henry Chakava told The Standard.
translation.luo: Jakom mar East African Educational Publishers,  Dr Henry Chakava ne onyiso The Standard niya: "Ne alimo Peter Abrahams e ode e piny Jamaica. Noyudo ka eka oduokne ratiro mag bugene ma Mine Boy kod  A Wreath for Udomo ma gin moko kuom buge mag  African Writers Series, kendo ne ang'iewo ratiro mar tiyo kodgi e skundewa."

translation.en: His other works include Dark Testament, Song of the City, The Path of Thunder, Wild Conquest, Return to Goli, Tell Freedom, A Night of Their Own, The Island is Now and The View From Koyaba.
translation.luo: Bugene mamoko gin kaka; Dark Testament, Song of the City, The Path of Thunder, Wild Conquest, Return to Goli, Tell Freedom, A Night of Their Own, The Island is Now kod The View From Koyaba.

translation.en: Djibouti port poses a great challenge to the success of newly commissioned port because of its close proximity to Ethiopia.
translation.luo: Pot ma Djibouti chiegni gi piny Ethiopia omiyo mondo Pot manyien midwaro ger Lamu  okel ohala, nyaka tim kinda mang'eny.

translation.en: Yesterday, East African Community and Regional Development Cabinet Secretary Adan Mohammed said a team of experts has been assembled to market Lamu in Ethiopia.
translation.luo: Nyoro, Adan Mohammed ma en Jatelo Mochung'ne East African Community and Regional Development ne owacho ni osemany moket kanyachiel joma olony kendo omigi migawo mar manyo ne pot ma Lamu ohala, Ethiopia.

translation.en: He said the State was also keen to have a different body other than Kenya Ports Authority to run the port amid reports that global terminal operators were keen to run the facility.
translation.luo: Ne owacho bende ni sirkal diher ni riwruok mopogore gi Kenya Ports Authority  mondo ochung' ne potno. Wachore ni riwrouge madongo mochung'ne pot mogwaro e piny mangima diher chung' ne pot mar Lamu bende.

translation.en: “The team will aggressively market Lamu in Ethiopia. We are keen to get the Southern Ethiopian market. We know the threat posed by Djibouti,” said Adan.
translation.luo: Adan wacho niya: “Jogo biro timo kinda ahinya mondo giyud ne pot ma Lamu ohala Ethiopia. Wadwaro ahinya yudo ohala mar yo milambo mar Ethiopia. Wang'eyo ni piem gi Djibouti ok yot.”

translation.en: Reports indicate that the Government was also open to allow major global powers to establish military bases in Lamu just like the case in Djibouti.
translation.luo: Wachore bende ni Sirkal oikore miyo pinje madongo thuolo mar yawo kar jolweny Lamu, mana kaka pinjego osetimo Djibouti.

translation.en: "It is about 900 kilometers from Djibouti Port to Addis Ababa compared to 1,279 kilometers from Lamu Port," said Adan, adding that the government had also prioritised the construction of the roads.
translation.luo: Adan wacho niya: "Wuok Pot ma Djibouti nyaka Addis Ababa en kilomita 900 kama, to wuok Wuok Pot ma Lamu nyaka Addis Ababa  en kilomita 1,279," omedo ni sirkal timo kinda ahinya mar loso nderni ma kuno.

translation.en: Currently, the road from Lamu to Garsen is complete, Garsen-Hole-Garissa road is about 83 per cent complete and Garissa to Modogashe is also complete.
translation.luo: Gie sani, osetiek ndara mawuok Lamu nyaka Garsen,  Oselos ndara ma Garsen-Hole-Garissa gimoro pasent 83. To ndara mawuok Garissa nyaka Modogashe osetiek.

translation.en: “Modogashe to Isiolo is yet to start but it will start soon but Isiolo to Moyale is complete,” said Adan, adding that Kenya and Ethiopia have already established a common border post at Moyale.
translation.luo: Adan wacho niya: “Ndara mawuok Modogashe nyaka  Isiolo pok ochak loso, kata kamano ibiro chak lose machiegni, to ndara mawuok Isiolo nyaka Moyale osetiek,” Adan medo ni Kenya gi Ethiopia nigi ofis boda ma giriwo, Moyale.

translation.en: “We want to attract big ships (Panamax ships) to drop cargo in Lamu before small ships transport it to Mombasa, Dar, Salala and Somali ports. Very many shipping lines have shown interest to use Lamu,” he said.
translation.luo: Adan medo wacho niya: “Wadwaro ni meli madongo kaka Panamax ogow kendo owe osikegi Lamu eka meli matindo obi oter misikego e pot mag Mombasa, Dar, Salala kod Somali. Nitie meli mang'eny ma diher tiyo gi pot ma Lamu.”

translation.en: This means that Kenya is focusing on the transshipment business putting it in direct competition with the ports of Djibouti and Durban in South Africa.
translation.luo: Mano tiende en ni Kenya dwaro donjo e ohala mar bedo gi pot ma meli lokoe osikegi madongo kata kontena ma giting'o e meli machielo, mondo meli machielono ema ochop misikego kuondo ma gidwaroree. Pot ma Djibouti kod Pot ma Durban man South Africa timo ohalano omiyo pot ma Lamu biro laro ohala kodgi.

translation.en: KPA has already offered generous promotional offers to the shipping lines and shippers keen to use Lamu Port.
translation.luo: KPA osechiwo nengo moyiewo ne meli kod joma riembo meli madwaro tiyo gi Pot ma Lamu.

translation.en: In the new tariffs, stevedoring charges have been reduced by 40 per cent.  Stevedoring is the loading or offloading of cargo from the ship.
translation.luo: E list manyien mar chudo, nengo mar keto gik moko e yie kendo gologi ne odwok piny gi pasent 40.

translation.en: Shore handling and wharfage services will also attract a 40 per cent discount.
translation.luo: Nengo mar golo, keto, kata kano osike e wath bende dhi dok chien gi pasent 40.

translation.en: Meanwhile, goods dropped at Lamu by big ships before they are transported to other small ports will enjoy a 30 per cent free storage period.
translation.luo: Bende, ka meli madongo oweyo osike Lamu mondo otergi e pot mamoko matindo, ibiro dwoknegi bech keno piny gi pasent 30.

translation.en: Domestic cargo will enjoy free storage for 15 days.
translation.luo: Osike mag Kenya ibiro kan nono kuom odiechienge 15.

translation.en: Between 16th and 18th, Sh3,250 ($30) will be charged for a 20ft container while a 40ft container will attract Sh6,495 ($60).
translation.luo: E kind odiechieng' mar 16 gi 18, kontena mar fut 20 ibiro chulne siling 3,250 to kontena mar fut 40, ibiro chulne siling 6,495 kata dola 60.

translation.en: “We will offer even more generous tariffs to attract cargo,” said Adan, while addressing the press in Mombasa days after President Uhuru Kenyatta launched the first berth of the Lamu Port.
translation.luo: Kane Adan wuoyo gi jofwamb weche Mombasa, ndalo manok bang' Ker Uhuru Kenyatta yawo kidieny mokwongo mar kama meli gowoe, ne owacho niya: “Wabiro medo dwoko nengo piny mondo meli mang'eny okel osikegi Lamu.”

translation.en: Kenya has declined an application by the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to increase flights from Dubai to Nairobi, and vice versa.
translation.luo: Kenya otamore yie ne  United Arab Emirates (UAE) medo kwan mar kinde ma ndekegi biro Nairobi kowuok Dubai, gin bende gidagi yie ne Kenya medo kwan ma ndekegi dhigo Dubai.

translation.en: In a move seen to protect the national carrier Kenya Airways, Transport Cabinet Secretary James Macharia said the government had resolved to deny Emirates unrestricted flights from the two cities.
translation.luo: James Macharia, ma en Jatelo Mochung' ne Weche Wuoth ne owacho ni sirkal ong'ado ni ok gibi miyo Emirates rusa mar biro Kenya kaka gidwaro.

translation.en: Currently, Emirates makes 14 trips per week from Dubai to Nairobi and vice versa. But combined; trips from all airlines hailing from the UAE, including Etihad and Qatar Airways, are 28 per week.
translation.luo: Gie sani, Emirates biroga Nairobi kowuok Dubai kendo dok nyadi 14 e juma, Kenya Airways bende dhiga Dubai nyadi 14 e juma. Kata kamano, koriw ndeke duto mawuok UAE, kiriwo Etihad kod Qatar, ndege mag UAE biro Nairobi nyadi 28 e juma.

translation.en: The CS who was appearing before a Senate committee explained that his decision was aimed at protecting national interests given that the current air services agreement between the two countries was “one-sided and favoured Emirates”.
translation.luo: Jatelono ne owacho ne komiti mar Senet ni otamore nikech odwaro konyo ohala mar Kenya, nimar gie sani winjruok mantie e kind pinje ariyogi en ma nyakonchiel kend kelo ohala maber ne Emirates kende.

translation.en: “The request by Emirates for us to allow them more frequencies will not be allowed. As long as I am the CS I will not allow it. The aviation business between Dubai and Nairobi is one sided and favours Emirates,” stated Macharia when he appeared before the Senate Roads and Transport committee.
translation.luo: Kane Macharia wuoyo gi komiti mar Senate Roads and Transport ne owacho niya: "Ok wabi medo Emirates thuolo mar biro Kenya. Mano ok bi timore tekni pod an e komni. Ohand fuyo e kind Dubai kod Nairobi en ma nyakonchiel. Emirates chiemo e wiwa.”

translation.en: The Senator Kimani Wamatangi-led committee was probing the alleged breach of an air services deal signed in 2002 and trade imbalance between Kenya and UAE following a statement sought by Senator Mutula Kilonzo Jnr (Makueni).
translation.luo: Komiti ma ne itayo gi Seneta Kimani Wamatangi ne nono wach winjruok e ohand fuyo ma Seneta Mutula Kilonzo Jnr ma Makueni ne okelo e nyim komiti. Ne otim winjruokno e higa mar 2002,  to wachore ni ne ok orite kaka dwarore kendo  mano miyo ohala koro oleng'ore konchiel.

translation.en: Macharia explained that the seating capacity of Emirates, Etihad and Qatar was 15,400 against Kenya Airways’ 5,510.
translation.luo: Macharia wacho ni kombe mag Emirates, Etihad kod Qatar koriw gin 15,400, to  mag Kenya Airways gin mana 5,510.

translation.en: Secondly, he said, the number of passengers had gone down since Covid-19 set in, translating to reduced income for Kenya.
translation.luo: Mar ariyo, owacho ni kwan jowuoth odok chien nikech masira mar Korona kendo mano odwoko ohand Kenya Airways piny.

translation.en: “The three airlines benefit from subsidies but we do not. This means they are able to subsidise their seat fares which we cannot do to match them. They can almost fly for nothing because they are heavily subsidised.
translation.luo: Omedo niya: “Kambi adekgo ikonyo kod sirkandegi, Kenya Airways to ok kony gi sirkal. Tiende ni, ginyalo dwoko chien nengo mar kombegi e okang' ma wan ok wanyal timo. Chalo ka gima ginyalo fuyo nono nikech sirkandegi sirogi motegno.

translation.en: National Bank of Kenya (NBK) has reported Sh184 million in profit after tax for the first quarter ending March 31, 2021.
translation.luo: National Bank of Kenya, NBK ogolo ripot ni giyudo ohala mar milion 184  bang' golo osuru e dweche adek mokwongo mag higa, chop Mach 31, 2021.

translation.en: This was a 19 per cent growth compared to a similar period last year, driven by increased income from loan interest and foreign exchange trading, and lower loan loss provisions.
translation.luo: Mano en medruok mar ohala gi pasent 19 kopim gi dweche ma kamago higa mokalo. En ohala mobedoe nikech ne gimedo pesa ma ng'ato chulo e wi lon, ne gimedo ohand loko pesa, kendo ne gidwoko piny kwan pesa ma ne iketo tenge mondo oumne joma ok ochulo lon.

translation.en: NBK Managing Director Paul Russo said the quarter was marked by pockets of slow recovery from the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic following the gradual reopening of the economy after a period of subdued activity.
translation.luo: Jatend NBK Paul Russo wacho ni e dweche mokwongogo ohala ne biro matin tin nikech  ohendni ne yawore mosmos bang' loro ma ne obedoe nikech masira mar Korona.
